trv: bobo bo bokoy btonox eniqan so hari cida hmili na cida qhoni kiya ori.
english: Afterwards, there seemed to be some branches behind the stone. But actually the boy mistook them for branches.

trv: kndalax hiya dooion na ka so cida kndalax hiya mlawa mlawa qpaton ka riso nii ori.
english: The boy grabbed the branches and calls for the frog.

trv: holing kii de miico so walo sndorok heya sndorak heya.
english: The dog was afraid because he was chased by the bees.

trv: kiya ka so mngongo gaga gaga a bokoy btonox ka holing nii ori.
english: Being afraid, the dog hid himself behind the stone.

trv: ma laqi nii ga mheyo bobo btonox lmawa qpaton.
english: And the boy, he was standing on the stone, calling for the frog.

trv: gaga mita heya ka tekong ga s ga cida qhoni bokoy na.
english: The owl was looking at the boy, staying on the branches behind him.

trv: kiya di qitaan ta kingan nii ge holing nii mosa bokoy mosa bokoy btonox kiya ka mosa skloi ka s rqenox.
english: Then we see that the dog went to the back of the stone, which made a deer shocked.

trv: rqenox ka knparo gaga bokoy btonox.
english: It was a very big deer that was behind the stone.

trv: riso nii ga tdiyan wa asi tdiyan a orong a rqenox.
english: The boy was suddenly hooked by the antler.

trv: holing nii mnosa pskloi heya kiya ka totoi ka rqenox nii tdiyan skloi ka laqi ali tdi laqi ga tgdi tdiyan orong na hiya.
english: The dog shocked the deer, so it stood up, and the boy was scared and hooked up by the antler of the deer.

trv: so mlawa dori so angali ko bale dayoi ko e mesa mlawa ka riso nii ori.
english: He seems to be yelling "Put me down! Help me!"

trv: holing na tmalang sbbokoy tmalang pos a holing na ori.
english: His dog is also running behind them.

trv: so ma adison a rqenox ka laqi rseno so mddayo so mdayo ka holing.
english: Since the boy was being carried away by the deer, the dog seemed to be trying to help the boy.

trv: mda paro ka rqenox nii so hari miico ka heya ori.
english: The deer was big, so the dog seemed to be afraid of it as well.

trv: kiya ka byaq betaq kdere di.
wada toting kdere ka ngaho ka kdere ngaho ka holing ori.
english: And the dog also fell off the precipice.

trv: rqenox nii wada na asi gdaani kdere ngaho ka laqi rseno kii dori.
english: The deer threw the boy off the cliff.

trv: kiya o da holing na ma laqi a rseno nii soopo wada toting lhengo a kdere.
english: So the dog and the boy fell into a cave together.

trv: troma na do qsiya kiya kesi yayong peni gcilong kesaon ta.
english: Inside the cave was water. It was a river, or what we call a lake.

trv: qsiya gcilong kdere eniqan kingan qhoni paro na ori.
english: There is also a big piece of wood on the water.

trv: sooyi kiya ka dongos daha daha laqi nii meyah skadi a so qpaton wada qdoriq peni.
english: So their original purpose was to look for the frog that ran away.

trv: da holing nii qitaan ta wa mita kndalax a baro ka rqenox.
english: Here we see the dog, and the deer was looking at it from the top.

trv: mtoting toting gcilong gsiya ka holing na dahaka riso nii dahaka laqi rseno nii.
english: The dog and the boy fell into the water of the lake.

trv: mosa dongan ga skadi a thngali ho btonox kana so sodo wada skadi a wada skadi qpaton.
english: They went to look for it again, on the other side of the stones, where there was grass everywhere. They searched for the frog.

trv: ma meyah betaq a lmangoy ka holing na heya do ano mita kiyan a qhoni boro hiya.
english: The dog swam across, and there the boy found a rotten wood as he arrived.

trv: ma iya sqowaq kesaon na ka holing na yani kelaan gaga troma hii mesa peni.
english: "Keep quiet!" he told his dog. "It might be right in there!" he said.

trv: kiya ka holing na mdakin a boro qhoni nii ma heya ori.
english: So the dog climbed over this rotten wood, and so did the boy.

trv: ano qsiya gcilong ka ga daha eniqan.
english: They are in the lake water.

trv: kiya ka mdakin a qhoni boro nii ka laqi rseno ma holing na.
english: Since where they were at was the lake water, the boy and his dog climbed up this rotten wood.

trv: dheya do mntena so mdakin bobo qhoni boro kii paro riyong qhoni nii biciq.
english: In the same way they both climbed up this rotten wood.

trv: ma qitaan daha toma na eniqan qo qmita maano dheya.
english: Then, they looked (into the wood). What were they looking at?

trv: daha qpaton bobo na dahaka wawa na.
english: It was two frogs-the mother frog and her child.

trv: msoopo ga tloong bokoy qhoni boro.
english: They were sitting together behind the rotten wood.

trv: ma meyah hini dongan mtara mota qitaan daha holing na tloong baro ori tloong baro boro qhoni tloong ka riso.
english: Then, they came here again to see, the dog and the boy sitting on the rotten wood.

trv: qaras riyong mita ego qpaton wawa qpaton meyah mita meyah a meyah mita bobo dahaka qpa wawa qpaton nii peni.
english: They were happy to see so many children frogs. They came to see the mother frog and the children frogs.

trv: so wawa na ga bokoy na ori wawa na paro.
english: There were also children frogs behind the mother. They were bigger ones.

trv: nii do tniyo wawa na hani yani mntoting hari.
english: All these frogs seem to be newly born babies.

trv: mqaras riyong bobo qpaton nii mqita so wawa daha mqaras ka riso dori.
english: The mother frog was very happy looking at her children, and the boy was happy too.

trv: mqaras ka so skloi mita kana holing na ma heya so ga mholis paro mesa.
english: The dog and the boy were happy and surprised to see all the frogs, so they laughed loudly.

trv: nii ta sdiyalon qpaton wada gedang di mesa so kiya ka kari laqi rseno nii.
english: "Here, we have found the forg that had been lost!" That's probably what the boy said.

trv: kiya do laqi riso nii angalon na kingan ka qpaton so hari wada wada has sdorakon mneniq sapah na.
english: The boy then grabbed one frog that looked like the one that was originally living in his house.

trv: ga dmoi a kingan qpaton ka baba baga na di laqi rseno nii ma tmalang mmaha sapah de osaan daha osaan posa sapah na dongan.
english: The boy grabbed one frog, and ran back to his house, to put it in the house.

trv: kiya ka hngali nii we bobo na tama na ini kelai ha tama na ka bobo na.
english: The frog on the other side... it's not known whether the mother frog was actually the father frog.

trv: bobona hiya mpito mpito ka wawa ga tloong bokoy qpaton nii.
english: Seven kid frogs sit behind this parent frog.

trv: mita mita dheya mita wawa na wada adison riso kii.
english: They watched the kid frog being taken away by the boy.

trv: so sm maa e gmaalo so wa nii wada adison seediq di mesa piya.
english: The parent frog seems to find it pitiful, crying out "wa..." "It has been taken away my a human" he said.

trv: kiya mita bale mqaras dori mholis kana daha.
english: But they all looked really happy, and laughed.

trv: kelaan daha seediq nii ini sipaq seediq ini pnhoqin dheya.
english: They guessed that this person wouldn't kill people, so he would not kill frogs either.

trv: kiya mntena mheyo hiya ka daha qpaton mpito wawa na ga mesa swaye ta.
english: So the two frogs, along with the seven kid frogs, stood there and said "goodbye, then."

trv: so kiya ka mqaras p lngelongan na tama bobo qpaton.
english: The father frog and mother frog felt happy.

trv: so betaq hini kari so nodaan nii we.
english: So the story would probably end here.

trv: wada mq so ini kseyang bobo tama bobo na ori.
english: The father frog and mother frog were not worried.

trv: kiya mesa kelaan dngaon daha seediq gaga malo lngelongan na riso kiya.
english: They guessed that the boy was kind-hearted.

trv: mqaras paro ka holing paro qowaq holis na.
english: The dog was very happy. He laughed, with his mouth widely open.

trv: kari nii betaq hini so nodaan qpaton dahaka riso ma holing.
english: So the story about the frog, the boy, and the dog ends here.

trv: ma ricah kiya iya reboi qsiya ma asi a a rterocon a timo tikoh tikoh om rterocon timo tikoh ma.
english: Do not soak plums in water; rub them directly with a little bit of salt.

trv: kika temaqon di si yiode yiodedapo ma hoN2T.
english: Then break them, as some say.

trv: sinoon kiya ma qlolion ka mngihon na si sinoi.
english: Wash them, and then the water will wash out its bitterness, as they say.

trv: ma kika ma s mhedo smino smino di se asi angali baro di ma?.
english: After finish washing, take them out of the water immediately.

trv: om osai a phido saso peni.
oka qsiya di si? porei ka sato so.
english: When it becomes dry (without water), cook your sugar.

trv: kiya sato peni qsiya sato kiya qsiya hnpore so sato kiya cowaqi ome hiya di tele tleeto da.
english: Pour sugared water you boiled into the pot of plums. Sugared water of course has to be cooled to room temperature.

trv: om di om kiya da baka di.
yako cbeyo a kndalax ko a a mnseneng ko hini cbeyo a.
english: Long time ago, I grew up to be a young man here.

trv: jonanasai ko mosa a mosa a sigang mosa hetai na tanah tonox.
english: When I was seventeen, I volunteered to join the Japanese army.

trv: sangkageco ko ka kongdeng moda tai a kongdeng taico.
english: I went to Taichung for training for three months.

trv: kiya kndalax miyan taywang hini mosa miyan takao di ma.
english: Then we went to Kaohsiung from Taiwan here.

trv: moda ko hiriping moda ko Hiriping sangkogeco eniqan mo hiriping ma.
english: We passed the Philippines and stayed there for three months.

trv: kndalax ko raboro mosa nami a a mswaye hida.
mosa ko nyooginiyano Soromonhoto yako di menaq kana.
english: I went to Solomon Islands near New Guineas, and all stayed there.

trv: tnhiqan mo mosa da mosa da wada miyan ini po pqqita da pqqita pqqita di ma.
english: As for those who accompanied me there, we have never seen each other since.

trv: menaq ko a Soromongongto yako do betaq ko a syowa jyoonananen a syowa nijyoo nannen.
english: I stayed in Solomon Islands until seventeenth year of Showa, no, until Showa twenty something (around 1945).

trv: ma kohoko do sono kndalax ko ciida menaq a hananpo.
english: Then it was Restoration. Since then, I had stayed in the south.

trv: tgheton nami so hari qolic a mssdorak ma ma so hari a mgleing ma qdoliq so hari qolic.
english: We were stuck there like rats. Being chased, hid and fled, just like rats.

trv: menaq miyan a rima knkawas mekan miyan poso moka ma poso blebon ma yasi.
english: We stayed there for five years, and we ate the roots of papaya trees and banana trees, and coconuts.

trv: heno a qyqeya nami osa tmlenga mosa miyan tmlenga mekan miyan boyak di ma.
english: With tools we set up traps and ate boars.

trv: mhoma miyan sari mhoma miyan bonga ma mhoma miyan kesaba.
english: We planted taro, sweet potato and cassava.

trv: pstihiqi kana so a boyak nga nangan nami di ma.
english: Like mixing everything with the boar we caught.
We had nothing, not even clothes.

trv: nimai bale sato ma gonengkan klokoson kiya do.
english: Two shirts to wear for five years.
There was nothing. All were ragged.

trv: sonoaidaniJ dongan do a mbberas miyan oka lokos.
english: During that time we were naked again. We had no cloth.

trv: hani miyan mosa mccebo do kingal bale handosi mosa mccebo.
english: In the beginning, we went to the war only in loincloth.
All were already naked, without clothes.

trv: so kiya ka ndaan mo krosi riyong cbeyo a ndaan mo.
english: My experience like that in the past was very painful.

trv: kndalax menaq hini tah tonox cbeyo.
english: It began with the Japanese occupation here in the past.

trv: e e saya da rodan ko nak da ini ko nak lngelong mmaano di.
english: Today, I am already old. I do not think about anything.

trv: a yako a mpprengo ko saya so nodaan mo a.
english: Now, I would like to talk about my experience.

trv: so sbiciq cbeyo a a kndalax ko so nakahara yonense ko a meyah kndalax nakahara meyah ko alang tongan hini.
english: In the past, as a child, I had come from Nakahara- I was in the fourth grade then- and came to Tongan here.

trv: a mesa ka tamabobo mo a oN nita tongan da gaga hii kana ka so dheran ta ma a iya ta eniq ano ka naka nakahara hini de oka a oka phomaan bonga mesa to qahor mesa to btonox ka nakahara mesa ma.
english: So my parents said: "Let's go to Tongan! All our land is over there! Let's not stay in Nakahara here. There's no place for us to plant sweet potatoes, because the land is infertile."

trv: oN ano ka kmeepah dheran nami di.
english: Then we worked on our own land.

trv: kika mesa ka bobo mo a a micang sa as a ta mhoma bonga ho sa a dm a ##sbsawan da ha ta mhoma bonga si ma.
english: Then, my mother said: "Micang, let's go plant some sweet potatoes!" The weather's cooler now, and let's go plant sweet potatoes, she sai."

trv: ini ko kela mhoma bonga mapa ko broro ma.
english: I didn't know how to plant sweet potatoes, and I was carrying a basket on my back.

trv: asi mo osai rmemox daha ka bong a waso ma rima ka waso mnenaq broro di ma.
english: I immediately stick (into the dirt) a couple of sweet potato rattans which were in the basket.

trv: mhedo ko di bobo kesaon mo.
english: "Mom, I have finished planting!" I said.

trv: mosa kos mosa meyah mita bobo mo.
english: Then my mother came to see.

trv: ga ino ma so wada qhedoon rmeos kana ka wahin bonga nii di si ma.
english: "What? How come you burried all these sweet potato rattans?," she said.

trv: ma tero ba pnhomaan so gheti wa nodaan kingan broro biciq nii mesa ka bobo mo ma.
english: "Only three? You can actually plant a broad area with (the rattans in) this one basket!," my mother said.

trv: osa da osa sapah di ini so kela ini so kela mhoma bonga.
english: "Go! Go home now! You don't know how to plant sweet potatoes!"

trv: meyah ko sap meyah ko sapah di ma.
mosa ko pore ido wa di ma pore ido romo wa ido maco.
english: So I went rice cooking, and I cooked porridge, millet prridge.

trv: ino dong sqerol dong ido m ido mo maco ma.
english: But, I don't know why, again my millet was burned!

trv: eyahon ko na mseyang dong bobo mo.
english: Again, my mother came to me angry.

trv: maano sqerol na ido mac ido nii dongan howa kesaon mekan ka sqerol si bobo mo ma.
english: "Why did you burn the rice again? How do you eat the singe like this?," my mother said.

trv: ma oxe ko pore dheno wa ini ko kela pore da kesaon mo hi ma.
english: So I didn't cook, as a result. "I don't know how to cook!" I said to her.

trv: ma osa mangan a qocon da meyah pore sa bobo mo ma.
english: Coming here to cook, my mother said "Go take some shallots!."

trv: mhada ka ido dheya di ma mosa miyan mangan qocon di ma bonga tomon di ma bonga tomon di ma damac nami ido ma ma ano ka a sari.
english: The rice was already cooked, so we went out to pluck shallots, round sweet potatoes, pumpkins, and taros as side dishes.

trv: a han na maribo a mangan na lodox bobo mo ma lodox bobo mo ma bobo ido hii ka.
english: First, my mother would take the sprouts (of those we just plucked) and put them on the top of the rice.

trv: ano ka tarox kiya di ma gimaxon na ido hii ka tarox bobo mo ma.
english: Then, my mother would mix some sweet potato stem into that rice.

trv: ma paro ko hari de wada ko mkela meepah di ma.
english: Then, as I grew a little older, I was able to work.

trv: ni ta wada ko gonense da rokonen.
english: I was in about fifth or sixth grade then.

trv: ni ta di si bobo mo a pahae ta smkegoy di sa.
english: "Let's go!" my mother said "Let's do ramie peeling, then"

trv: oh pahae ta ma ko tmgesa smkegoy si ma ma t tminon ma mnoqah tgesaon ko na bobo mo ma.
english: "Let me teach you how to do ramie-peeling, weaving, and thread-twisting" she said. "I'll teach you" my mother said.

trv: ma a dmaos ma ini ko kela ano ka dmaos ma.
english: As for organizing threads, I didn't know how to do it.

trv: bbeon na baga mo dongan ma so ini kela dmaos si.
english: She hit my hand again, saying "How come you don't know how to organize threads?"

trv: mkela ko ka qnnoqah ma mkela ko tngiya dmaos ini ko kela.
english: I knew how to twist the threads, I knew how to spool the threads. But organizing the threads, I just wasn't able to do it.

trv: giso hmowa tninon so nii a a bleqi a hmabik ka habik so ga mridih habik so kesaon ko na.
english: "How can you weave like this? You've got to fasten your belt when you wear it! You're belt is tilted!" she said to me.

trv: odaan ko na smeboc papak dong ka bobo mo ma.
english: My mother came again and whipped on my foot.

trv: lmingis ko mesa ka lobi mo.
english: So I cried, as Lubi said.

trv: iya bbei bobo howa mesa m.
tminon di ma oxe a pkela tminon a beeboon so si bobo ma.
english: "She's already weaving (learning how to weave), and she won't be able to do it if you whip her," said Lubi.

trv: oN lmngelong ko naq di ma thowe ko naq tminon di malo ka tnninon mo di ma.
english: So I did a lot of thinking myeslf. Slowly I weaved, and my weaving became good.

trv: o kiya da si bobo mo mqaras bobo mo ma.
english: "Oh! You're good now!," said mother. She was happy.

trv: kika kika mhedo mhedo kiya de jyo jyogosai ko di mosa ko yosai paran mosa mes yosai paran di ma.
english: So after that (my traning for weaving) was finished, I turned fifteen years old. I went to do western dressmaking in Paran.

trv: smalo ka lokos ta lokos ta so a lokos a mokan da.
english: I made clothings, like those of the aborigines, and those of the Chinese people.

trv: matak di ma ini ko kela matak dori ma.
english: I did cutting, and I didn't know how to do it either.

trv: jyogosai ko ciida ma mkela ko qmita ka a mesa yi piri yi piring kiya kelaon mo kiya ma.
english: I was fifteen years old at that time, and I knew how to tell the measurement of the cloth, which they call one piri/piring. That I know.

trv: ma matak ko ori de wada ko mkela tikoh dori di ma.
english: I did the cutting too. And I got to know a little about it.

trv: slaale ko matak de ini mo ciya a wohon ka lokos kiya di ma.
english: When I first do the cutting, I didn't add five centimeters to the clothing.

trv: mlokos ko di ini osa di wada wada wada.
english: So I wore it, but it didn't fit me.

trv: wada ini ano ka ciya ka ano ka a ano ka konghon na di peni ma ini osa plokoson di ma.
english: I didn't add the centimeters; and I couldn't wear it.

trv: mesa ka oh ano ka tnheyaqan ga hmowa da n iso nii ma i ga so ini ciya di si.
english: Those who were with me (also learning western sewing there) said: "What's going on with your work?" "You're not adding (the centimeters) " they said.

trv: kika mhedo kiya de mhedo miyan yosai de meyah ko sapah.
english: Then, when that was finished, when we finished learning western dressmaking, I went home.

trv: ma mosa nami a meepah da ma sntoko pila ma mhoma kana kosoy cbeyo kiya ka angalon nami pila.
english: Then, we went to work to make money. In the past (at that time), one can make money even by planting lemongrass.

trv: ma maha ma lqelaq sntoko pila tmabon.
english: We worked at rice paddies to make money. We plowed.

trv: icinici goen bale ori ka han miyan tmabon kiya ma.
english: Plowing there (at the rice paddies), we were really making just five dollars a day.

trv: ani so kiya de ini nam ini nami a sgaliqi ka pila kiya han miyan me mege a rodan nami a.
english: Despite that, we didn't waste that money. We gave it to our elderlies.

trv: baroyon daha tikoh so beras ma timo.
english: They would buy some things like rice and salt.

trv: han daha maroy ma ma mqaras riyong ka so a b bobo nami ma tama nami ma.
english: They bought things, and our parents were very happy.

trv: kika gonense ko de wada ho wada hoqin ka tamabobo mo a tama mo wada hoqin.
english: When I was in the fifth grade, my father passed away.

trv: a tado cili ka tama mo wada hoqin ka tama mo di ma.
english: My father was Tado Cili. He passed away.

trv: so ko bale gloon di ma meepah ko naq da theyaq ko bobo mo meepah ma.
english: (After he passed away,) I was so pitiful, so I just workd. Together with my mother, I worked.

trv: kika jiyo kndalax ko yosai de meyah ko sapah de jyorokosai ko.
english: When I finished learning western sewing and came home, I was sixteen years old.

trv: eyahon ko daha smrai meyah snrai ka awi di ma.
english: Awi came, and proposed to me.
I was about sixteen years old then.

trv: so jyoichigaco ka kekong nami maha ko maha ko jyorokosai jyonigaco de kekong nami ka awi di ma.
english: It was November when we got married. I was about sixteen years old in December, and I was married to Awi.

trv: ma ma kika jyonanasai ko de toting ko a laqi mo paro.
english: When I was seventeen years old, I gave birth to my first child.

trv: ma so ba gloon ka nodaan nodaan nami ciida dori di ma.
english: We were also having a tough time in those days.

trv: ga baro nii ka neepah mo a.
english: The place where I worked is just up above there.

trv: nosaan nami tmokoy a maco ma.
a wada miyan poqolon ka laqi.
ma kika ani maano phomaon kana ani so ppoqon ma so rodan cbeyo so.
english: People in the past planted everything, as long as its edible.

trv: so a tmorak peni ma kerong ma bonga ma tmorak peni ma kerong ma bonga ma phomaon nami ma.
english: We've planted things like pumpkins, chayotes, and sweet potatoes.

trv: ma mesa ka seediq mas ma namo ma so a mdoromoc riyong mhoma kesaon ko daha.
english: Some people said to me: "Why are you so diligent in plantting?"

trv: ma oka so nii laqi mdoromoc mhoma a ppoqon mesa ka seediq.
english: "There are no other young children that are so diligent in plantting," people said.

trv: kana beloh pais phomaon mo ma baro gaga ma ani kana seediq neeyah iyo a mosa lmamo beloh no pais ma.
english: I even plantted adzuki beans, right up there. And all the people from the Iyu tribe went to pick the red beans (that I planted).

trv: a kana songoc tnokoy mo ma eyahan daha smeboc pgeelok smeboc ka seediq ano ka alang iyo hini.
english: I even planted tree beans, and the Iyu people rushed here for priority to pick the tree beans.

trv: ma kika mqaras riyong ka baki mo dori a tmokoy ko a maco ma.
english: My grandfather was very happy too, since I was plowing millet.

trv: ma so bi gloon ma so bi lgoon.
english: Why am I so pitiful? Why am I so pitiful?

trv: tera nako nii da mesa ko mooyas ko baro ga lmingis ko.
english: I am so pitiful in this way! I would sing these lyrics up there, and I would cry.

trv: lmingis ko a mooyas ma ma lmngelong ko naq so nodaan na bobo mo dahaka taa bobo mo tama mo ini mo so kelai riyong tama mo ori gonense ko wada hoqin ka tama mo.
english: I sang, crying, and just thought of what my parents had gone through. But I didn't know much about my father, since I was in the fifth grade when he passed away.

trv: lmigis ko posaon ko daha seno laqi mosa seno ma.
english: I cried, because they made me marry when I was little.

trv: ani so kiya we wada mo dehokon peni a dmanga laqi mo ga.
english: Despite that (being married young), I managed to take good care of my kids.

trv: a mm mpito laqi mo ma daha wada gedang di ma rima ka wa moodos.
english: I had seven kids. Two passed away, and five are still alive.

trv: a laqi to rseno ori wa ma kingan ba laqi mqedil laqi mo.
english: All of my kids are boys, except for just one who is a girl.

trv: ma ma wiso ko qrinoc dongan saya ma wada ko s hition malix dongan ma wiso ko pqrinoc dongan.
english: I am suffering again now, because I was left alone again. I am suffering again.

trv: ma ma oka naq barahan na kiya da kiya naq so n nodaan ta moodos bobo dheran.
english: Nevertheless, that's just what we have to undergo, living on this land.

trv: a so so nii so wiso meyah so so tmgesa so oda so nii ka laqi so mbarah nii dori a.
english: It's just like now, where kids of the new generation are being taught (about our traditions).

trv: malo riyong ka so nodaan so nii a so ini ba chongii ka so a so gaya ta cbeyo ma.
english: This (kids learning the tribal traditions) is very good, because our tribal law would not be fogotten.

trv: laqi a so ini kela mmaano nii ka laqi saya.
a say saya de ini pntena so cbeyo ka s saya da.
english: Things are different from the past now.

trv: a malo riyong ka so nodaan ta saya meyah sa tngesa so a.
english: What we did today is very good, coming here to study (our language).

trv: so a ano ka laqi so kndalax so a oh tepaq l laqi nii so meyah so tmgesa so oda so so a l lmotoc so kari seediq wiso daha so a eyahon so a so a tmgesa ita hini.
english: The kids from Taipei came to study our traditions, to pass down our language, and they are coming to teach us here.

trv: a biyo tara ko bi hiya weewa rodo toxox nii yo sare o sare.
english: Ah, you must wait for me there, the girl with the nest-like hair. Young lady, oh young lady.

trv: nrabe nomin nrabe nomin he so mtara he so mtara cceka yayong yayong bnaroy.
english: Rabe Nomin, Rabe Nomin! I will wait for you. I will wait for you, right at the middle part of the river, river Bnarury.

trv: nrabe nomin nrabe nomin he so pdehok he ko pdehok mtara hido nii hido ronge.
english: Rabe Nomin, Rabe Nomin! Will you arrive? Will you arrive? I am waiting for the sunrise, for the sunshower.

trv: a na ima yako wa o nay o nay ima dori wa o nay o nay takon sare wa o nay o nay takon sare wa o nay.
english: Ah who am I, who am I again? I am Takun Sare, I am Takun Sare!

trv: o nay ima dori wa o nay o nay awi robo a o nay o nay takon sama wa o nay o nay micang tado wa o nay.
english: Who is this, now? This is Awi Robo, this is Takun Sama, and this is Mican Tado!

trv: ima ka soring wa ima ka soring wa nweewa lahoy nii nweewa lahoy nii.
english: Who is this young wife? Who is this young wife? This old lady, this old lady.

trv: nyami nii da nyami nii da.
english: This is ours now, this is ours now.

trv: a ima ko dongan wa nyako snhabo bi morox.
english: Who am I again? I am Habo, who is really single.

trv: a ima ko dongan wa nyami nii ita ho nniso ta bi nii.
english: Who am I again? This is ours now, and this is yours now.
We are accustomed to our language.
We are the true Seediq people.

trv: nita bi mneyah nalang ta bi tongan.
english: We are truly from the Tongan tribe.

trv: wada gedang tikoh pawan nii kiya.
english: He died at the age when Pawan was small.
He fought with others, and he died.
He was about thirty years old.
He was ill for a long time.
Were you a child at that time?

trv: laqi kana deheya nii ombeyax naq meepah bobo na.
english: Their siblings were all small. Their mothers was very diligent (so that she could bring up children.)
At that time I was still small. I went to do...

trv: maha theyaq tikoh a pholing ka oqian daha camac.
english: At that time, I went with elders to hunt game for us to eat.

trv: ini wa kndalax ko sbiciq ini ko keepah han.
english: I did, I rarely did farmwork when I was young.

trv: wana tikoh qolic sdorakan mo ma.
english: and I played chasing mouse since small

trv: mosa ko theyaq pholing seediq peni.
english: I followed elders to go hunting.

trv: ano ano ba kingan cece so na.
english: Do you only have one elder sister?

trv: tena ko mke tena ko mangan mangan miyan some a awi takon moodos na han.
english: At that time when Awi Takun was alive, I had already hunted a bear.

trv: moodos moodos tama so siida na.
english: Were your father still alive at that time?

trv: moodos na ma bobona dong mosa ko mangan some yami ka pawan mohing dongan.
english: He was still alive. After that, I hunt another bear with Pawan Muhing.

trv: wada so nansay mosa snegon deheya.
english: About what age did you go hunting with elders?
it should be about twelve or thirteen

trv: jyooni nisay oxe so ba pkela biciq ba jyoici na wa.
english: How was it possible? Eleven years old is too small to go hunting.

trv: ma om ini wada ko jyoisai hari seong ko naq paro.
english: Yes, I was really about twelve, my height was tall enough you know.

trv: wada howa mesa wada ho wada mhoqin maano tama so wa mo ini honoy lo saya.
english: I have not recorded yet how your father died.
Tell me in detail from the beginning.
Since he was beaten by others, he died
What is the reason they beat your father.

trv: mona rodo mona rodo mkoni han ma.
english: For the reason of Mona Rudo, they went angry.

trv: mneyah bkasan ini osa theroy Boarong han deheya kii ciida.
english: Were they from Bkasan village? Hadn't they moved to Boarung village at that time?
Not yet, they still lived in Bkasan.
They had moved from Pradu village to Bkasan village, is that right?

trv: on kndalax prado ma mosa bkasan.
english: Yes, they originally moved from Pradu to Bkasan.
At first, they escaped (from quake site) separately.

trv: meniq a bkasan hii ka rowah mo.
english: My uncle, Ruwah, lived in Bkasan.
Did Ruwah live in Bkasan there (at that time)?

trv: X hoh mnenaq bkasan rowah kiya.
mnenaq Bkasan beeboon ka kowa a.
english: Kuwa was beaten (by our relatives of Mhebu) somehow.

trv: pshako bgorah ka hako ta nenaq heno hii peni.
english: Was it at the new bridge (by our Mhebu tribe)?

trv: moda sipo napa ko na mmaha miyan bosi ma ino.
english: My father once passed that bridge and went to Busi village, carrying me on his back.
At that time, your father was still healthy. He was not sick yet.
My father suffered from chest pain all the time.
Pawan's father was ill for a long time then.

trv: om oka ising oka eioy ciida.
english: (At that time in our village) no doctor.

trv: naka naq deh naka hbaro laqi bobo pawn pawan nii na.
english: (If the accident had not occurred to his father), Pawan's mother would have had more children.

trv: ma o ma kika wada nanneng hari mnarox sanjyo nansay mnarox a.
english: He started to be sick around thirty years old.
So, how many years had he been sick in your memory?

trv: jyonansay gorai wa mnarox hii jyonanneng wa.
english: He was sick for more than ten years.

trv: gojyo nanneng naqah hei tama so.
english: Was your father sick for fifty years?

trv: o wada mnarox paro ciida mnarox ini totoy bsiyaq.
english: His illness was so serious that he could not get up by himself for a long time.

trv: ma kndakax kii de iso ka smnegon seediq mosa.
english: Since then, you went to hunt following elders...
Others also told about Pawan family's situation like that.
Let me stop here for a moment.

trv: om irih so rih so mona rodo tikoh dmanga iso di.
english: Mona Rudo played a role of your care-taker?

trv: heya heya ka ini ppooyas yako di.
english: Then Mona Rudo also did not let me go to school.

trv: ino heya ka so a qmlahang yako di.
on rih so heya qmlalang yamo di na.
english: So he took care of your family.

trv: kesaon na pokoh takon a drodox.
english: It was when she went to remarry Pukuh Takun of Drodux village.

trv: o kii kesaon so pokoh takon.
english: Is he the Pukuh Takun you mentioned?

trv: plowe laqi mosa platoc sapah alang seediq mesa.
english: (Mona Rudo thought) If my mother got remarried, our children would be miserable (since we would be buried in the step-father's house.)
(Elders of our family) they told like this.

trv: on dmayo naq so mona rodo ka tama mo dmayo naq yami ka heya dongan.
english: My father helped Mona Rudo, when he was alive. Thus, after my father passed away, he helped us.

trv: om om om pteyoxon miyan na pkparo ka yami ma paro nami do maha miyan mddayo dong.
english: He rushed to bring us up, and we would help him after we grew up.

trv: tena ko wa ko mkela mheyan di peni.
english: I could shoulder at that time.

trv: ye so wada jyoloko siji hari di.

english: About thirteen to fourteen years old?

trv: ma ko mbeyax mheyan di peni.
on wada howa kesaon rmeos tama namo tama so wa reoson ino.
english: When your father passed away, how did you bury him? Where did you bury him?
We dug grave with a hoe.

trv: kiya ka eniqan a nosaan ta eniqan a.
english: We buried them where you and me have passed...
Is it where there are houses?

trv: ini ta romeos sapah ciida di.
english: At that time, didn't we bury in house?

trv: ini da hndore wa hiya tama mo ori.
english: We no more buried under house at that time. My father is also there.
Didn't People of our tribe bury corpse in house?

trv: yamo de ini namo reos sapah di.
english: We did not bury under house any more at that time? Have you ever seen burying in house?
Did you seeour people buried in house?

trv: oN ini ko kita a om om.
ke mkela so rmeos sapah toma repon qitaan mo qitaan miyan so nii peni.
english: I have seen a people buried under storehouse. I was looking at it like this.
I have not seen burying in house, I have only seen burying under a storehouse.

trv: tahtonox o smeling tahtonox do tlwayan hiya da wa hii tama mo ori.
english: (During Japanese period,) they opened a place for cemetery. Since then, we bury people in Tlwayan.

trv: wa hii ka elo na mesa eniqan gamin qhoni moda ko qdoriq klaali miiso ko habong wa so hiya peni.
english: The road bound to the cemetery is there. That road has a stump like this. Whenever I passed there, I would turn aside, because I felt fear passing there.

trv: om ini oda hii saya di tiwas.
english: Tiwas does not pass there any more.

trv: qdoriq klaali mtali kana poso mo ngongo miiso habong kiya.
english: I felt so scared passing the cemetry there.

trv: a a so o o angali han pawan angali angali.

english: You know we buried under a storehouse, is that right?

trv: ma hmowa oka rmeos sapah ita.
english: How did not we have custom burying in house?
People of Bgala (who belong to Squliq Atayal) have a custom burying in house.
So, people of Bgala have a custom buring in house.

trv: ita we a troma na repon ita.
english: We buried under storehouse, is that right?

trv: a oxe oxe repon ori so ngangoc gaga ori peni ngangoc ta nanak.
english: not exactly under storehouse, we buried them outside of house like a yard of own house.

trv: so o asi reosi hii seediq cbeyo.
english: So we buried corpse in yard?

trv: ma ini ta osa rmeos ngangoc seediq ngangoc ta nanak.
english: We did not bury somebody else's yard. We buried them in our own yards.

trv: n ita nak dheran ini preos seediq.
english: Under the own ground. We don't bury the dead in each other's land.

trv: o o o ma mosa so toma a modo so gaga ori ga toma modo so gaga baki mo.
english: It's like we buried them under the orange trees. My late grandfather were buried under oranges trees like that.

trv: a mari naq liwas heya ga mosa liwas paro peni toki toki paro.
english: He bought big pot while alive. He was put inside the pot with big mouth.
Who taught us to bury the dead like this?

trv: heya naq ma heya naq bnari tktoki paro paro qowaq wa.
english: It was grandfather himself (that ordered the pot).
It is big enough to put corpse.
He bought the pot with a big mouth by himself. They prepared first.
They may buy it by themselves.
They ordered the pot they will use after they were dead.

trv: kiya qitaon mo patis rmeos ta sapah si ma.
english: I have read in a book that our people had custom of burying in house.
It was Bgala people who had that custom.

trv: toda sapah ma toda toda rmeos sapah.
english: Bgala people, as well as Toda people.
Do Toda people have custom of buring in house? I do not know that.

trv: kela mita om rmeos sapah daha.
om om om so kelaon ani rneos rodan ta cbeyo ini ta qita ori peni.
english: We possibly had a custom of buring in house, but we were not in time to witness that.

trv: kika mekan ido plaale mangan deheya ori si.
english: When we eat, the ghosts also scramble for meal.

trv: meniq ka siida si pawan na ini osaan sndeho na ini ini ini adis qbolic seediq.
english: Pawan, I heard at that time, when we bury them, we did not bring wood ash (ash produced by burning wood for housework).

trv: asi se asi osa sndeho ma qitaan otox daha meyah mekan kiya di si.
english: (We did not scatter wood ash). We buried them directly (during the age of that custom). We could see a ghost of the person came to eat food.
There was a person came from back like this.

trv: berah om om om ma dmidin naq qbolic ka mhiti bokoy.
english: and the person who is scattered was in the back (He scattered ash along the road).

trv: ima ka m m m mrehak a qbolic.

english: A child, a woman or anyone could do it?
Should he be a relative of a dead person, or it does not matter?

trv: ita nanak laqi ita nak tndadan.

english: Person who has relative relationship with the dead.

trv: kleelo naq a rmehak qbolic di.
english: Did you scatted ash along a road?

trv: on kndalax siida ini eyah a mgeela mangan baga daha mekan di sa.
english: From that time a ghost will come to scramble for food with people alive.

trv: X qitaan baga na mangan sa ini qitai hei.
english: I heard we could see their hand but could not see their body.

trv: kndalax ciida di si ma ini qitai baga daha meyah mgeela mekan di si ma mangan baga a naq seediq mangan naq deheya ori si.
english: Since then, the invisible ghost competes with us with his hand. People alive scramble for food, the ghost also scramble for food.

trv: ma msdagni naq a bsokan ori si.
english: Ghosts would get drunk themselves blind too.

trv: qitaan daha oxe mberiq kari nii wa bale bale kari kiya.
english: People alive could see them like that.

trv: yaani bale kari cbeyo kana nii mona rodo kari tnkari tmgesa yako kiya.
english: A story like this is not a lie. It is true. It is what Mona Rudo told me.

trv: tmgesa kana rodan oxe wino heya.
english: Not only him, our elderly people all could tell this story.

trv: rmeos rmeos ta toma qlapo ciida sa ma mtaho ta poniq plaale mtaho poniq deheya sa baga na msdangi.
english: I heard that corpse were buried under beds. Ghosts scramble for fire when people maked fire.

trv: ano kesaon daha waga angalon a maano ka prado hii wa qitaan daha otox na msdangi bsokan sa.
english: Elderly people said they could see drunken ghost with shoulder crossing shoulder in Pradu village

trv: prado hii sa ado wada angalon sono peni oN prado kiya.
english: since the place was buried by landslide.
I see. The place was buried by landslide.

trv: a rmengo ko kingan n nodaan laqi rseno.
english: I am going to tell a story about a boy.

trv: laqi rseno nii malo ba lngelongan na.
english: The boy, he had a kind heart.

trv: dmanga kingan holing ma kingan qpaton.
english: He kept a dog and a frog as pet.

trv: ma mqaras riyong ka holing na dori.
english: His dog was also very happy.

trv: rong qmita qpaton ka laqi rseno ga do qmita siyo na ka holing ga dori.
english: When the boy looked at the frog, the dog was also looking at it.

trv: dmedax di totoi ka laqi rseno gaga.
english: At dawn, the boy woke up.

trv: naqah ba koxon na a qmita ka laqi rseno nii.
english: The boy felt very sad seeing this.

trv: ma mlokos plokos ye mmaha skadi qpaton na kiya.
english: He got dressed and set off to find his frog.

trv: ma so ba ima ka holing na dori ini gdema s dmayo skadi laqi rseno kiya.
english: His dog did not stay idle, and helped him search (for the frog).

trv: ma ini kela ali lmawa qpaton ka laqi rseno nii ragohon na ka bais na qori ngangoc lmawa qpaton na.
english: The boy, on the other hand, did not seem to notice what was happening to his dog. He opened the window and called out to his frog.

trv: wada ba skloi ka? laqi rseno gaga mosa ngangoc ma osaon na memox ka holing na.
english: The boy was shocked, so he ran out to see if the dog was ok. When he got there, he hugged his dog.

trv: ma mqaras bale ka holing na oh oh so myeha a qmita heya ka oh holing nii ma cehakon na dqeras na.
english: The dog was happy to see him and licked his face.

trv: ma kika mddaha mosa skadi yqeyaq hiya ka daha ka laqi rseno nii ka holing nii di moda lmiqo qpaton qpaton si lmawa.
english: So the boy and the dog set off together to the fields and the forest to find the frog. The boy called, "Frog! Frog!"

trv: ma qitaan na eniqan kingan beling ma mqiri beling kiya ka laqi rseno nii wa qiyocon qolic qtehor ngongo ka mohing na.
english: When they saw a small hole, the boy put his head in to see if the frog was there. Instead of finding the frog, the boy's nose was bit by a field rat.

trv: ma ini kela ali ga skadi a qpaton ka holing na ga dori.
english: His dog also tried hard to find the frog.

trv: osaon na lngelo ka qhoni paro ga ini na qitai ka tdiyong a gaga m baro hiya.
english: It shook a very big tree, but did not realize that it had bees in it.

trv: qpaton qpaton bale sa d skadi qpaton.
english: "Frog! Frog!" yelled searching for the frog.

trv: ma mdakin qhoni baro ka laqi rseno nii ini kelai toting a a nrgeroyan na ka rodo tdiyong ka holing nii tmalang sdorakon na tdiyong.
english: And the boy climbed the tree, not knowing that his dog was chased by the bees because it shook the tree and made the bee hive fall.

trv: moda s moda berih na laqi a rseno ga ka tdiyong dori toting kndalax qhoni baro ka laqi rseno.
english: The bees passed by the boy and the boy fell off the tree to the ground.

trv: skloi qmita ka toy tyaqong gaga siyo hiya.
english: The crow nearby was shocked seeing this.

trv: ma kedo ba knnarox tonox mo ha mesa ka laqi rseno dmoi tonox na ma qmita bale ka tyaqong ssiyo hiya.
english: "My head hurts so badly!" said the boy, holdin his own head. The crow was watching nearby.

trv: ma mdakin qho oh btonox baro ma ye na seedan so cida ka laqi rseno ga lmawa qpaton na.
english: Then, the boy climbed up to a stone, and leaned against something like a branch, calling out to his frog.

trv: qmita ssiyo ka qbheni dori qpaton qpaton bale si ga lmawa.
english: The birds were watching nearby, the boy calling out: "Frog! Frog!"

trv: skloi ka dn dnoi na ka so hari ka cida qhoni kiya kela naq rqenox.
english: The thing that the boy leaned against was actually the horn of a deer rather than a branch.

trv: skloi ka rqenox tmalang mbahang kari na.
english: The dear was shocked, and started to run, hearing the boy's voice.

trv: ma qmita wa toloson na rqenox na ka holing na smdorik siyo na dori tmalang betaq berih na.
english: The dog saw the deer dragging the boy, so it chased them, and ran to the front.

trv: ini na kelai ka kdere berih hiya ma.
english: However, it did not know that there was a steep slope in the front.

trv: wada toting troma hiya ka laqi rseno ma kana holing skloi mita ka rqenox ssiyo hiya.
english: Both the boy and the dog fell off the cliff. The deer, who was watching beside, was shocked.

trv: ma wada toting yayong troma toting rcilong roro hiya.
english: fell into the river, which was a deep creek.

trv: ma bale totoi wa laqi rseno gaga ma angalon na baro kana ka holing na.
english: To one's surprise, the boy was still able to stand up, holding his dog high up.

trv: mqaras bale ma a in a mddaha ini so oh wada so ini so mangan ini hangan loqah.
english: Both of them were very happy, probably because they were not hurt.

trv: ma thowe a lmangoy mosa roro oh siyo hiya dehok so qhoni hiya ma.
english: Then, they swam slowly to one side of the creek where there was a tree.

trv: iya sqowaq kesaon na ka holing na.
english: The boy said to the dog, "Don't speak!"
Both of them climbed up a tree.

trv: wa na sdiyalon hiya ka qpaton na di wa mddaha ga toloong ssiyo qpaton hiya.
english: There, they found boy's frog, which was sitting beside.

trv: hbaro bale ka kana qpaton gaga s a kana theyaqan hiya.
english: Many companion frogs were there, too.

trv: ye kela naq mosa skadi dangi na mesa ka laqi rseno nii.
english: The boy probably thought: "It turns out that he went to look for his friends!"

trv: a kesaon daha a mo m msaane ka oda nii.
english: Here is the story of their so-called brother-in-law relation.

trv: kesaon na msaane nii we a neton mangan mqedil neton mangan mqedil ka rseno ma eniqan swai ma eniqan qbsoran ka ka qedil na.
english: The so-called brother-in-law relation means that if a man marries a woman, she has an elder or younger brother.

trv: kiya naqah riyong so naqah ka so pqitaan nodaan so a so a kndesan kndesan so a so a msoopo ka a dheya ka ane di.
english: It is very bad to let the brother-in-law see things done in life, such as they being together.

trv: mneton qitaan daha dowe e sngaya mesa.
english: If it happens that they see it, this is said to have broken the law.

trv: ma kiya ka a pgayaon daha.
english: Therefore they feel it is a taboo.

trv: ma eniqan eniqan dori mneton so smmalo so sapah.
english: In addition, there are also situations like when building a house.

trv: ma mosa baro ka ane na ma.
meniq troma ka so a a so ka swai rseno na qedil na.
english: The younger sibling of the man's wife was inside.

trv: qmita so a qmita so eyo a baro de qitaan na kana so begax dowe.
english: If he sees his penis up there and even testicles.

trv: kiya ka a a mesa ma mchaya ka ane do ma kika ini rengo hayan.
english: He would say, "Why did brother-in-law do this?" but he did not say at that time.

trv: bobo na mesa bobo na de a mhedo mhedo a a ga mosa baro ma meyah.
english: Later, he finished the work up there and he went down.

trv: ma anaq qbsoran na mqedil na.
ma kiya ka a kesaon na smgaya kiya di.
english: That is something that would break the taboo.

trv: ma ma smgaya dowe en maano di asi ka asi ka a dmahor ka ane na kiya di.
english: If the brother-in-law broke the taboo, he must make atonement to his brother-in-law.

trv: ma eniqan ori so o so mddidil so ano ka mddidil ka ane dowe a naqah daha riyong kiya dori.
english: Like if the brother-in-law commits adultery, that is very bad as well.

trv: ma so kiya so mddidil dowe.
ma ma ani kari ori mrengo kari dori dowe mrengo so a so a mrengo naqah kari.
english: Even when talking, when saying bad words.

trv: ado ko mneton so kiya mrengo kari naqah dowe kiya a sota ano a srengo daha ma kika.
english: Because I said something bad, the villagers will gossip about it.
The brother-in-law will make atonement for it.

trv: a so kiya ka a ndaan daha cbeyo.
english: That is what is done in the past.

trv: kiya ma asi a rteroci a mose qsiya tleeto micox peni micox sato ma.
english: That, then you should knead them in lukewarm water, and mix them with sugar.

trv: shaokai qsiya kii de kika hnoon di maano di a basoon so qsiya kiya di kii di ma.
english: Boil the water, and let the water cool down.

trv: posai bo a cowaqi ome hiya ka qsiya di kiya nanak.
english: Pour the water into where plums are, and that's it.

trv: qsiya sato kiya sato peni qsiya sato kiya qsiya hnpore so sato kiya cowaqi ome hiya di tleeto do wa cowaqon.
english: That sugar water...that sugar water...you pour that sugar water you boiled into where plums are. When it's lukewarm, then you pour it.

trv: mano di pkero maha kesaon maha lmamo ricah kesaon maha lmamo ricah han.
ma kika so kiya di na bange a maano di hanzikang hanzikang maano hanzikang kari seediq di ini ko kela kari seediq.
english: Half an hour... what's the word for half an hour in Seediq? I don't know the word in Seediq.

trv: oqo nak hanzikang deno oqo nak hanzikang di ho ini ko kela kari seediq.
english: Just say hanzikang for now? I don't know the word in Seediq.

trv: hanzikang reboon so timo timo han na kika.
english: Immerse them in salt first for half an hour.
Immerse in salt water or salt?

trv: on ma okoso a pstoyon dongan.
pstoyon di ma kika reboon so qsiya dongan t reboon so qsiya tleeto dongan kika kingan rabi.
english: When they are removed, immerse them in lukewarm water for one night.

trv: kingan rabi reboon so qsiya tleeto.
english: Immerse them in lukewarm water for one night.

trv: te so koson do pstoyon so di.
english: The next day, remove them from water.

trv: pstoyon so di ma kika phidoon so saso di peni.
english: After you remove them from water, dry them in the shadow.

trv: phidoon so saso di kika mdengo hari do kika kika temaqon so di.
english: When they dry a little, you smash them.

trv: temaqon so di ma kika a podaon so toswe.
english: After you smash them, you dehydrate them.

trv: kika nak kiya cowaqanon di kiya di.
baka di baka di qitaan zikang.
eniqan ka kingan ano ka seediq ano ka waga kiya waga so meniq so ano ka a neepah na seediq nii ma.
english: There was a person who was in his own field.

trv: m ma kika wa mosa lmamo wada hiya ka kingan ka so riso hari gaga mosa a mosa mangan a o mosa mapa ano ka ano ka hei na qhoni kiya ma.
english: As he went picking, there came a young person who went to carry the tree fruits.

trv: ano ka taapa ano ka ano ka rolo tmediq ano ka mapa kingal rawa napa na ano ka hei qhoni kii yaani qotirodox ini kelai ma.
english: Then, rode a bike, taking a basket of fruits, which were probably guavas. I don't know.

trv: kika wada so tmalang madis ano ka a kingal rawa a qotirodox kii di ma.
english: It's like he ran taking those fruits.

trv: wa eniqan btonox ka elo kiya ma wada moda a so a ptebok hiya di ma wada.
english: There was a stone on his way, and he bumped into it.

trv: takon ka ano ka seediq a mapa ano ka a qotirodox kii di ma wada tdoroy kana ka ano ka hei na a napa na qotirodox kii di ma.
english: There was a stone on the road. As he went past, he bumped into it and fell. All those guavas that he carried rolled down.

trv: giso ka tero a riso so laqi ha di ma.
english: Then, there came three boys, who seemed rather young.

trv: kiya ka wada di wada mswaye di ma.
english: Then, they went away, and separated (with the boy).

trv: moda elo ka ano ka laqi kii wa qmita kingan ano ka ano ka oh bnobong na a tonox mntena hari a so a a bosi peni.
english: Those kids went passed the road and saw something used for covering the head, which was kind of like a hat.

trv: wa qmita kii deheya kii di ma waga na wa na splawa a wa na hrenang qowaq na mlawa ano ka miyok qowaq na mlawa ano ka seediq wada taapa jidensha madis a a hei qhoni kii di ma.
english: As they saw it, they called out, making noises and whistling with their mouths, to the person who had already gone riding the bicycle with the fruits.

trv: ma kiya naq a wada mswaye di.
mlawa qoyox nii na asi ka ml a seediq tnalang ociicin ka mosa smkagon kesaon plawa qoyox nii.
english: As for the ritual to pray for rain, it is neccesary to ask people in other tribes to request the shaman who prays for rain.

trv: ma bobona han ta cim ma qqeya hadocon ta.
english: After asking him to pray for rain, we give him the instruments.

trv: mosa lmawa qoyox we saadis ta kingan rodox.
english: We should bring a chicken when we pray for rain.

trv: ma kika wada mqaras mangan ka seediq skagolan mosa a.
english: The person asked takes the chicken, and he is very happy.
They walked toward the river to pray for rain.

trv: mosa treero yayong mosa nangi qloli.
english: walked into the river and pretended to drift with the tide.

trv: kika plp plepingan daha ka rodox kiya wa.
qlolion daha yayong stheyaq daha kana sdsodo ka rodox kiya kana ko.
english: They put in the river the chicken, grass, and flowers, and let them float on the water.

trv: mangan roting ma mhedo kiya do kiya meyah sapah di.
english: After the ritual is done, they go home.

trv: bale ba kiya nii sa m kesaon mlawa qoyox nii do.
english: It is said this ritual is effective.
The so-called ritual to pray for rain really works.

trv: a mhedo dehok a ya mosa yayong deheya do asi qoyox doma.
english: Sometimes just as they reached the river, the rain fell down.

trv: ma kiya ka mqaras ka seediq ka.
english: Then, our tribe would be very happy.

trv: ah prengo ko kari a oda nodaan kesaon nasi.
english: I am going to tell a story about pears.

trv: ma paro nasi na di mosa lmamo nasi rodan kiya.
english: When pears grow big, that old man goes to pick them up.

trv: ma ga lmamo baro ka baki kii.
english: That old man is picking up pears above.

trv: ma mnoda hiya kingan seediq mnoda kingan a riso.
english: Then there passed a person, a young boy.

trv: madis ah dmodon ah miric kesaon.
ma ini na qitai rodan gaga mangan nasi ah qhoni baro.
english: He does not see the old man that is picking up pears in the tree.

trv: wada asi oda hiya ini prengo dori mhm.
english: He goes... he passes there without speaking (to the old man).

trv: bobona ini qbsyaq moda hiya ka kingan laqi rseno.
english: After that, in a short while, a boy passes by.
rides a bike... a small bike.

trv: ma ini ini na qitai ka rodan ga lmamo nasi dori.
english: Then he also does not see the old man who is picking up pears.

trv: anisi laqi rseno kii ma qitaan na rawa na ego nasi ma oh qomi ma mkmangan nasi laqi kii mesa oka seediq qmita icin ma ini na qitai rodan ga baro.
english: But that child sees his basket full of pears. That child wants to take pears, and observe if there is anyone else here. He still does not see the old man above.

trv: ma kiya ka wada na asi didil wada na asi didil ka kingan rawa nasi ma posaan na rolo na kiya ka wada ka laqi kii di.
english: Therefore, he takes... takes one pear basket and puts it on his bike. Then that child leaves.

trv: ma sterong ini qbsyaq ka nosaan na laqi rseno kii moda elo giso kiya laqi mqedin.
english: Then in a short while, that boy leaves. A girl comes up.

trv: laqi mqedin giso ma ano qmita bokoy ka riso qmita weewa.
english: The girl is getting closer, and that boy looks at the girl over his shoulder.

trv: qmita weewa ka riso kii ma ano wada asi osa laqi mqedin kii ma wada ptatok.
english: When that boy sees the girl in that way, quickly... When the girl leaves, he bumps into something.

trv: ah wada sbgihoron ka so bo ah ah maano di ah bosi na bosi na ma kiya ka wada toting di.
english: The wind blows and... what does it call? His hat, and his hat fallss down on the road.

trv: qn mita bokoy nana ma ini na kelai ka btonox gaga gaga berah oda na.
english: While he looks back over his shoulder, he does not know that there is a stone in his front.

trv: kiya ka asi osa ptabok btonox ka ah rolo na di.
english: Then his bike bumps into a stone.

trv: ma takon rolo na takon heya dori takon kana so nasi nangan na.
english: Then his bike falls down and so does he.

trv: takon dheran wada s ah wada cowak dheran kana ka nasi nangan na.
english: All the pears that are taken away fall onto the ground. All the pears taken get scattered on the ground.

trv: ye mnarox papak na laqi kii nii ini asi totoi.
english: perhaps that.. this boy hurts his foot, so he does not get up soon.

trv: ma ini qbsiyaq giso tero laqi lmiqo te laqi bi ah laqi rseno tero ma qitaan daha.
english: In a short while, three boys come close, and then they look.

trv: ma so hari ga mhm so mnarox ka papak laqi kii ma meyah lngelongan daha dayoo ta mesa.
english: It seems that that child's foot hurts. They approach him and have sympathy with him, thinking "let's help."

trv: kiya ka dmayo ka laqi eh ah laqi tero kii peni.
kinga daha dmayo ma kingan ini dayo ga naq cmebo ah cobo na kingan ma.
english: one... two children help him. Then one child does not offer help, and he is just patting his ball alone.

trv: ma totoyon daha ka rolo na dori.
english: Also they help to raise the bike too.

trv: kiya ka wa ini kesa mhoe ka laqi ah mntakon kii dori.
english: Then, that child who just falls does not say "thank you" either.

trv: ma wada ka tero laqi kii di.
ma laqi mntakon kii wada naq ah mhedo naq posa rolo wada nax wada naq di.
english: Then that child who just falls leaves by himself... placing the bike by himself... and leaving by himself.

trv: ma ini q qnte ini ktheya nodaan daha mkesa laqi ah ah tero rseno kii qitaan daha elo cceka hii ka bonoh na.
english: Then not walking too far, the three boys see his hat in the middle of the road.

trv: bonoh we kesaon bosi kari nihongo.
qitaan daha ah ceka elo hii ka bonoh na ma angalon daha we sa.
english: Seeing his hat on the road, they take his hat and say "wee!."

trv: tot ah ini mita bokoy ka riso ah mhm taapa rolo kii ma ah ma bosi mo ma tob bonoh mo mesa.
english: Then the boy who rides the bike looks back at the hat, and says "my hat."

trv: kiya ka hadocon daha heya ka bonoh na ma eh so mesa mhoe bale mege namo ah bonoh yako mesa ka riso ah laqi rseno kii ma kiya ka mangan tero nasi sbege na deheya peni.
english: They send the boy his hat. The boy seems to say "thank you very much for returning me the hat.." Then he gives three pears to them.

trv: ga mqaras deheya dori kiya ka wada deheya di.
wada deheya di ini qbsyaq wada ka riso taapa rolo dori ma tero riso nii dehok poso qhoni hii qo qhoni nasi.
english: Then they leave. In a short while, and so does the boy who rides the bike. Then these three boys arrive at the tree... pear tree root there.

trv: ma moda ssiyo baki hii wa naq baro baki nana ma moda hiya ka tero riso so hari ini kqita di wada naq wada ma mkesa hiya ka laq tero laqi kii.
english: Then the three boys pass by the old man who is still up alone. The three children do not look around and they leave... they just walk away.

trv: wa wada wada ka tero laqi kii di ma rodan nii meyah kiya.
english: they leave... those three children leave and this old man comes down.

trv: stenge llnabo na nasi ah loboy na di ma.
english: Yeah, the old man just comes down. He puts the pears into bags, and they are full.

trv: meyah kndalax qhoni baro ka baki kii di ma baki rodan kesaon na baki kii meyah do ma meyah hatang morey mposa rawa nasi na di ma so hari mesa i wada ino kiyan rawa mo di mesa.
english: That old man comes down the tree. He says... that old man comes and comes... he thinks that he has put his pears in the basket. He seems like saying "Where is my basket?."

trv: so hari smepo baga na mesa w tero han ma daha bale di ke lmngelong baki kii wada ino kingan a rawa wa rawa nasi mo di mesa.
english: He seems to count by hand... there should be three but here are only two of them. He thinks "Where did the other pear basket go?."
Those three children, when passing there, see that old man.

trv: mita tero laqi kii peni ma mesa mita oxe deheya wada gmeegoy di mesa ka baki kii lmngelong na naq.
english: Seeing those three children, that old man himself thinks "Did they steal my pears?."

trv: ma ini qita heya ka tero laqi kii dori ma wada naq kiya.
english: So those three children do not see him and just go on.

trv: so mesa wada ma so hari wada oka kingan rawa nasi mo mesa ka baki kii so nii na wada naq ka tero laqi de baki.
english: Then it seems... then it seems that that old man says "There is one basket missing," when the three child leave.

trv: m m a tikoh kari maano di kesaon a poso ta bale a rodan nita seediq.
english: I am going to tell a story, the so-called origin of our Seediq ancestors.

trv: e kari nii ori ori ge e tngesaan ko na ima di sk a sktiwas pawan ori daka skpawan nawi peni.
english: The story was taught to me by the late Tiwas Pawan and Pawan Nawi.

trv: ani si howa ka bobo de ego ka rdrodan nodaan mo smiling ori ha m mesa ka kari na.
english: But afterwards, I have also consulted many elders, and the following is what he said.

trv: en eniqan kingan a e dgiyaq e dgiyaq e dgiyaq paro ha bnohon kesaon na.
bnohon nii na saya di na kiya ka han han a han madok seediq peni.
english: This Bnuhun now has been the area to go hunting for the Seediq.

trv: a madok mesa ka toda ha.
adokon asi ta kesai ita ita tgdaya peni.
english: We, the Tgdaya call it Dupun.

trv: ani dehok saya na lmiqo nii na ego riyong ani maano ka troma hiya camac peni.
english: Even until now, in the mountain area there are still many animals.

trv: ma cbeyo si cbeyo cbeyo wada so keno a keno cbeyo na ini kelai ini kelai smepo si na.
english: Then in the past, long long time ago, like we don't know how to count.

trv: e kika dgiyaq kesaon bnohon nii na eniqan kingan qhoni paro.
english: In the so-called Bnuhun, there existed a big tree.

trv: n so ro kari na rodan paro riyong sa qhoni nii ma kika qhoni nii ne qho qhoni nii ge ga so hari ga tloong maano di e dgiyaq peni.
english: The elders said that this tree is very big, so it's like it sits within the mountains.

trv: ma kika qhoni nii na en poso na peni na eniqan lhengo paro.
english: Then at the lower trunk of this big, there exists a big cave

trv: ma qsiya kii na msbobo ka s nrcilongan na hii di na gcilong kii di na kika thowe moda maano di berah na ka qsiya nii mosa mttoting qori icin.
english: Then the water... the accumulated water overflowed the pool, and slowly flowed pass its front to the other side.

trv: ma poso kika beling nii peni na kiya ka nsperoqan kesaon poso ta ba ita.
english: So the cave at the lower trunk was reportedly the real birthplace of our ancestors.

trv: rodan ro a poso ta ba rodan ita seediq mesa ka rodan ba rodan ta cbeyo.
english: the real origin of our ancestors, our Seediq ancestors, the elderly said, our real ancestors in the past.

trv: kari nii ge oxe kari hndore nii ori ha kari ba kndalax cbeyo.
english: This story was not recently told, but came from the past.

trv: ma qitaon qitaon kesaon poso qhoni nii na.
english: Then looking at this legendary lower trunk of the tree.

trv: ye adoka gaga dgiyaq peni na qhoni ka baga na sa a kana ba baga na a daha baga na ma teerang we mgrabang mgrabang bhege ka teerang na.
english: Maybe because it exists in the mountains, its hands are trees... all its hands... both of its hands... and then the ashen chest, its chest is of the color ashen and white.

trv: ma paro riyong qitaan a ma kika a ye ma mesa ka kari rodan.
english: Then, so the elderly said looked very huge.

trv: o sknowan ka maano di yani wada sbgihon paro peni na.
english: No one knows when, one day there was a big wind.

trv: wada na maano di gerongan a bgihon ka baga na a baga na narac.
english: The wind snapped its hand... its right hand.

trv: kiya si a maano di ciida si na da e kari daha na.
kingan mqedin ma kingan rseno pnsperoq hiya mesa.
english: A woman and a man were said to be born there

trv: ma kingan kari daha we kingan mqedin ma daha rseno mesa.
english: The other story says one woman and two men.

trv: ma kika kingan mqedin kingan rseno nii e kika wada m prana ita di mesa ka rodan ha.
english: The elders said that these one man and woman reproduced us.

trv: neton so daha rseno kingan mqedin na daha ro daha bale a da tero mo tero seediq nii na msperoq ciida.
english: Two men and one woman, these three people were born then.

trv: ma kingan mqedin ma daha rseno.
ma eniqan kingan rseno ge ma mesa qmita kesaon ga ta eniqan bobo dheran nii peni.
english: Then one man looked at the world where we now live.

trv: ma oxe nii di oka ani maano mesa si.
maha ka ko da oxe ko menaq hini yamo naq enaq hini di mesa.
english: "I am leaving. I'm not staying here. You stay here on your own." said.

trv: kika irih so daha kingan mqedin kingan a rseno ka dheya kiya ori.
english: Therefore, (the story of one woman and two men) is similar to the story of one woman and one man.

trv: ma kingan rseno daka kingan mqedin nii ka kiya ka poso ta bale ita.
english: This one man and woman are our real origin.

trv: rodan ta ita kesaon seediq mesa.
english: They are said to be the ancestors of us, the Seediq.

trv: kari daha e rodan ta dehok saya.
english: Our elders said so even until now.

trv: ma kari nii we bnhangan mo yaani wada maxan hari knkawas cbeyo di ha.
english: I heard about this story long time ago. It has been almost ten years.

trv: a oka ka rodan nii ori di.

e ba ciida na dah daha ka rodan tngesa yako kari nii kingan we skpawan a sk a tiwas pawan kingan we sk a a pawan ma mesa ka rodan tsk cbeyo si we ita seediq si peni na meniq ta alang kesaon trowan peni e bale naq bale cbeyo ori.
english: And the elderlies said it is said that we Seediq people used to live in the so-called Truwan area. It was really so in the past.

trv: a klaali na ini kelai mesa a ini ta kelai ka karac han na.
english: Usually, we do not know the weather beforehand.

trv: mcowin qmoyox ma mcowin so m a malo karac peni.
english: Sometimes it rains, and sometimes it is fine.

trv: ma ita cbeyo na oka ani mmaano so saya ka bbrigan ta meniq alang a a a a seediq ta cbeyo.
english: And, in the past, we did not have anything like today's goods in our Seediq tribe.

trv: ini so saya de kndalax ta alang de mosa ta hori de mosa ta mari ani mmaano peni.
english: It was unlike now. Now we go from our tribe to Hori to buy any kind of things.

trv: kika asi naq mhoma naq so ppoqon kana so a a sama ma so kesaon na ma a bonga peni.
english: Thus we simply grew food by ourselves, for example, vegetables, and sweet potatoes.

trv: kika eniqan a a kingan na mano di stexan sa a knkawas ciida peni hmnowa naq ori a mndndengo ba karac paro.
english: Then, one... it is said that once, no one knows why, there was a really severe drought that year.

trv: ma mndndengo ba karac paro ciida na.
english: It was a really severe drought.

trv: hmowa ka howa ka plaale han wa yaani wada kingan idas daha idas han we eniqan ka so ppoqon daha pnneniqan daha repon peni.
english: At first, it was not serious. About one or two months later, there was still food put in their stockhouse.

trv: ma kika ciida bale ba oka ppoqon di na laqi so pga so sgaalo di peni.
english: At that time, there was really no food, so hildren were pitiful.

trv: deheya ka plaale so mhoqin e kingan ali de wada mgedang kingan ma mcowin naq we kingan ali de wada mgedang daha.
english: They died first. Each day one passed away. And sometimes two passed away each day.

trv: kiya ma oxe nii di mesa ka rodan ta si.
english: Our ancestors thought it could not be like this.

trv: ma ha wo a ha ta hae ta theroy icin a yani.
english: Let's go move to aother place!

trv: so kii naq ka lngelongan na rodan cbeyo na.
english: This is the thought of the ancestor.

trv: ye na hili mesa kesaon karac we anaq mndndengo karac ka hini we yaani ini kdengo karac ka icin kika ha ta theroy icin di mesa ka kari na.
english: They thought even though there is drought here, maybe there is no drought in another place. Thus, he said, "Let's migrate to another place."

trv: ma bale a kari na rodan we qitaon mo lngelongon mo saya we ma rih so maha wada mqori a yayong ino di soko ga lngelongon mo kari na rodan ciida.
english: What the ancestor meant, now I think, was to go toward the Suku river. I think this is what ancestors meant.

trv: ma lmngelong maha ta ba dehok ino di mesa.
ma wada thowe a mkkesa deheya ma bale ba oka naq riyong ppoqon ciida na.
english: They walked slowly. At that time, there was barely any food.

trv: irih so ani naq so m hei qhoni mmaano odaan daha mekan elo ori di.
english: They ate all the fruits from trees they passed on the road.

trv: ma ciida a ciida na a cbeyo cbeyo cbeyo cbeyo riyong ka kari nii hayan na.
english: At that time, this is a story of long long time ago.

trv: ciida si na kana seediq daka c cmcamac peni na mgkela kari.
english: The storyteller said, at that time, people and all kinds of animals could know each other's language.

trv: kika m m mkleelow mmaha s a skadi neniqon a a k neniqon daha knbra osaon daha k knbgorah meniq we smiling ka so qbheni ma so camac peni.
english: Thus, on their way to find a new place to live, to go and reclaim a land, consulted with fowls and beasts.

trv: ma kika pneeroon ka pneeroon daha rih so mgd rih so m mg maano di ado ka mggalok kari ciida ka kesaon cmcamac daka seediq kika mkela mbahang ori ma mkela naq mprengo ori.
english: Ancestors told. Since at that time animals and people could communicate, they could understand and speak each other's language.

trv: ma ma mbahang so kiya ka camac de pglowe namo bale mesa ka ima di camac peni a nasi howa kesai so nii di mesa.
english: When animals heard about that, they said, "How unfortunate you are! Tell us how to handle this."

trv: ma ani si kari neyah troko ini ko kela ka kiya.
english: I do not know how to call it in Truku.

trv: ma dehok me dehok hii ka seediq ta kndalax trowan de kika mano di msseli hii kana ka cmcamac ma kana seediq.
english: Our tribespeople came from Truwan and arrived there. And animals and people all gather there.

trv: kelaan wada bbiyan bbiyan hari di peni wa mgrebo ceka na ali ori ini kelai.
english: Maybe it was almost the evening, or was it in the morning or at noon? I do not know.

trv: ma ma kika mesa ka mano di camac si hmowa ka lmngelong a mprengo ka dangi rih so msdangi kana deheya nii han anaq s ani naq seediq ma ani naq camac wa.
english: Then animals said, "How about..." thought and said that they were all like friends, even though they were human and animals.

trv: ani si bobo na ego riyong so pnrengoan daha we oka ka kesaon maha malo ka lm lmngelong seediq we ori mp mpmalo we ini daha kelai.
english: There was much discussion afterwards, but the human beings thought none was going to work out and they did not know whether the result would be good.

trv: ma bobo na de so hari sisin ka rmengo di sa ke kesao ta kini ho mesa ka sisin si.
english: After that, maybe it was thrush who said, "Let's do this way, shall we?"

trv: yani kiya si maha malo so nodaan namo mesa ka ima di ma kndalax ciida di m maha malo ori wa mesa kana ka cmcamac ma kana seediq peni me mesa sa ima di doma so camac peni sisin ka kari na rodan wa kari na rodan a s tngesa yako peni kari na ima di sktiwas we daka skpawan we sisin mrengo mesa kesaon ko na mano di.
english: It was proposed by some animals. Elderly people said that was thrush. Elderly people who taught me told me this. The elderly people who taught me said so. The late Tiwas and Pawan said to me, "It was thrush who said so."

trv: yamo seediq na ado namo oka gaya mesa kika so nii ka ga namo rih namo so ga qrinocon na ka otox a otox namo di mesa lm mesa ka kari na.
english: (Thrush said,) "You Seediq people, because you do not have tribal laws, you are punished by God, your God." They said.

trv: ma asi ka howa kesaon ka so nii di mesa seediq ma kika s s lmngelong so nii ka sisin.
english: "How to deal with this situation of people?" thrush throught like this.

trv: ma ma lmngelong ka seediq ciida we o maha malo ori mesa.
english: At that time, ancestors thought, and said, "That is good."

trv: kika peeyah ciida kana cmcamac de srriyox mosa mano di mkmosa mkdmidin tasin btonox kii wa tasin paro wa kiya wa.
english: Afterwards, all the animals took turning going, wanting to move that big stone.
And no one could make it.

trv: ma ani naq ani naq mano wa ani naq a ani naq so kesaon ta qbheni peni ani ta naq kesaon so camac sepac papak wa ani keros ani ta naq kesaon qbheni eniqan palic peni mosa oka kmmekon.
english: No matter which one, even our so-called four-footed animals or the winged birds, they all went but could not make it.

trv: ma bobo na de msngari tero tero bale ka mano di a camac gaga ini osa mano di a qoqo dmidin dongan.
english: Then, there remained three who did not go and try to move.

trv: ini o ma kika kingan we e tero camac nii we kingan we a sisin ma kingan we pocaq ma kingan kingan ge mano di tiyaqong.
english: Of these three, one was thrush; another was black bulbul; the other was crow.

trv: ma ado paro ka tiyaqong na heya plaale mosa sa tiyaqong.
english: Since crow was big, he went first.

trv: wada tiyaqong mosa dmidin btonox kii we.
english: Crow went to move this stone.

trv: ma ino dong wada wa wada iriqan papak ka ima di tiyaqong rmengac qdoriq ini kmekon.
english: What's more, crow's foot was hit and he yelled in pain and ran away. He could not make it.

trv: ma kingan we mhedo kii de rih so msngari pocaq daka sisin di.
english: That one was finished, which means there remained black bulbul and thrush.

trv: wada ka pocaq han mesa ka lmngelong ka sisin a yamo plaale mesa kesaon na pocaq on si pocaq wada poca wada pocaq ma.
english: Black bulbul went first. Sisin thought and said, "You first." Black bulbul said "yes" and went.

trv: ani asi m kweko pocaq ini kmekon dmidin.
english: No matter how hard black bulbul tried, he could not move.

trv: ma kika bobo na de m rih so msngari ano wano sis m mtngari wano sisin ini osa dmidin di.
english: Then, there remained only sisin who did not go and move.

trv: ciida seediq a seediq ta mesa ka rodan a ima sktiwas we naqah koxon daha bale naqah koxon daha sa maano bale nii di.
english: The late Tiwas said that people at that time were really sad, saying "What can we do with this?"

trv: mpkmekon ba maano qbheni biciq nii mesa ka lmngelong ka ima di seediq si peni na.
english: People thought, "What is such a small bird capable of doing?"

trv: ma kana cmcamc ori we mesa ma misa maha oka kmekon mangan btonox dmidin btonox kii di mesa lmngelong.
english: All the animals as well thought probably no one was capable of taking and carrying that stone.

trv: ma ino sisin nii ini kesai mmaano wada sisin wada mosa a kesaon na dgiyaq a pttingan kii.
english: But thrush did not say anything. He went to that so-called Pttingan mountain.

trv: ma kika didilon na ino dongan ini qbsiyaq dilan daha bale btonox kiya.
english: It was not long before they raised that stone.

trv: ma so hari ka ga mita otox di ma so hari mano di e wada mkloi paro peni.
english: It was like they saw the God. It was also like they were frightened greatly.

trv: kedo beyax na sisin nii si kika ma mqaras riyong kana seediq di.
english: People said, "How powerful thrush is!" They are all very happy.

trv: kiya ka wada angalon kndalax ciida ka wada angalon gaya kesaon ita seediq ka sisin nii.
english: Thus, from then on, our Seediq people take thrush's words as tribal law.

trv: ma bobo na na si e ma mesa ka seediq dong ciida eniqan ka kingan kari dongan mesa.
english: Afterwards, people say there was another story at that time.

trv: pawan ka mano di rnengo tikoh nii da mesa ka skpawan skpawan nawi wa.
english: Pawan said a little about this. The late Pawan Nawi told about it.

trv: ke ke a mesa te m oxe oxe kingan ba kesaon na sktiwas daha btonox ga hii kesaon na.
english: Here it goes, "There were not really one, but two stones over there," he told the late Tiwas.

trv: o mesa tiwas ma hmowa kesaon na ma.

mesa ka ma pawan ka smneero nii di kesaon ko na ma ciida na kela naq wiso ego riyong ka cmcamac ini skela qmita ka dnidin daha a maano di a dnidin daha b mosa dmidin berah a s mosa dmidin a a maano di btonox paro mgaya kii we ini skela kii ka doma camac dehok hiya kika smiling a sisin dongan o a polo hawan bale ha ma miyan ini skela ma miyan ini skela ka yami di mesa peni.
english: Some animals who failed to (witness them) go to move that big stone for the first time arrived there and asked thrush again, regretting, "Why did we miss it? Why did we miss it?"

trv: kika wada ino dongan kesaon na sisin te e hmowa ka mosa namo mangan texan dongan ado miyan so kelaon mesa iso iso bale ka mo mo mnadis btonox nii kesaon na ka sisin ma.
english: Thus they went and said to thrush, "How about you going again to bring back a huge stone, so that we know it was really you who have brought back this stone?" they said so to thrush.

trv: ini kesai mmaano ka sisin wada dongan.
english: Thrush said nothing and left again.

trv: ana dehok hndore hari rodan na mosa mesa ka pawan nii ani dehok a hndore hari rodan m mosa maano di tmlenga hii di na odaon daha mita btonox nii di na m rih so o o nii a btonox dnidin tasin kesaon s kesaon na ka lmotoc kari ka laqi betaq saya kesaon ko na.
english: Pawan said that recently some elderly went there to set traps. When thet passed this stone, they said, "It is necessary that chidren be told this story," he told me.

trv: ma meya ado oxe miyan mekan meloq mesa ka seediq smiling sisin peni.
english: "Is this because we eat raw food?" people asked thrush.

trv: m malo ori wa mesa sisin ma kika sisin de heya de lmngelong.
english: "Well, that would be good," thrush said and thought.

trv: ma p splawa na ka ima di tiyaqong daka ima di pocaq peni.
english: Then, he called crow and black bulbul to come over.

trv: a kesai kesao ta di ho naka so mosa skadi maano di irih irih so poso poniq peni.
english: "What do you say we do this? Can you go find... the supposed source of fire?"

trv: howa kesaon rmengo saya ini ko kela ori.
english: How to call it now? I do not know, either.

trv: o osa skadi a poso poniq mesa ka sisin a skagolan na ka ima di a tiyaqong daka a tocaq nii.
english: "Go find the source of fire," thrush said and dispatched crow and black bulbul.

trv: ma ma lmngelong pocaq daka tiyaqong nii we kedo bale beyax na sisin nii asi thei.
english: Crow and Black bulbul thought of such power thrush had, so they obeyed immediately.

trv: adoka km kmmekon dmidin btonox paro heya na ma lmngelong naq sisin daka tiyaqong nii ori o ma nii si ma niqa ma ga dayoan otox ka heya mesa lmngelong ma asi thei ka pocaq daka ima di tiyaqong nii.
english: Because thrush can move the big stone, black bulbul and crow thought to themselves, he is helped by God. Thus black bulbul and crow obeyed immediately.

trv: kika wada wada mqori honac skadi kesaon a poso a poso poniq.
english: Then they went downstream to find the so-called source of fire.

trv: ma yani wada bsiyaq hari wa ma kika meyah.
qtaan de giso heno giso ka deheya nii a pocaq daka maano tiyaqong nii ma mgeela ka pocaq ma qitaan daha pocaq kii na mgtanah ka qowaq na mgtanah kana papak na.
english: They saw black bulbul and crow, and black bulbul was in the front. They saw black bulbul's mouth was reddish, and his feet were reddish, too.

trv: ma po a p ma menaq ka tiyaqong we qa qa smdorak pocaq kndalax bokoy ka heya.
english: And crow was cawing, following at the back of black bulbul.

trv: a mtanah kii wa so hari mtanah maano ini kelai ptotingon na dheran.

trv: ma ino di ptotingon na dheran ciida na kii naq malo karac ciida tnogiyo eniqan ka so sodo mnddengo menaq dheran na asi sqama.
english: Oh dear! He dropped on the ground. At that time, it was sunny, and all over the ground there were dry grass, which burned immediately.

trv: ma kika s sqama slamaq ka kika m a so sodo mnddengo kiya ma maano nii so qdoriq seediq.
english: Then that dry grass was burning. "What is it?" people ran away.

trv: ma so kiya hari de mt wada wada mthedo so slamaq sqama de oka di oka mtanah kii di ma mbhege di.
english: As the burning stopped, that was not red anymore, It become white.

trv: qitaan we so hari btonox mbhege ma so hari a maano di qrari qrari peni.
english: It looked like a white stone, a white flint.

trv: ma btonox kii de so hari bhege ma qrari ma saadox qitaan.
english: That stone looked like a white and hard flint.

trv: ma e maano ma wada ino ma oka poniq di mesa ka seediq ma.
english: Then someone said, "Where has the fire gone?"

trv: ye ma eniqan kingan seediq om wada ini ini rnrengo ka kingan seediq wada mosa hii ma angalon na ka daha btonox kiya kika king daha btonox nadis na ima di pocaq nii na qn qniyocan na kingan ma kika qeraqan na papak kingan.
english: Then, there was one man who went there without saying anything, and picked up those two stones, the two stones that black bulbul had brought back, one he bit in his mouth, and the other he grabbed by his feet.

trv: kika s angalon na kndalax dheran na ma kika poto maano di rih so potongan na.
english: He picked up from the ground and then he lit the fire (by rubbing them against each other).

trv: potongan na ma ey ma malox malo malox eniqan a rana poniq mesa ka ima di seediq nii peni wa kela naq so nii mesa.
english: When knocking, "why there is fire spark?" this man said. "It was like this," he said.

trv: o kela naq so nii kiya kiya nii na mesa ka ima di seediq ma mqaras bale ka seediq kedo so bale knmalo kesaon na ka pocaq nii peni.
english: "So it works this way," people said. People were really happy. "You are really kind," they said to black bulbul.

trv: ma menaq ka kesaon menaq a pocaq lmiqo nii na saya di na pocaq lmiqo mesa kari miyan laqi da rodan na pocaq mesa.
english: Besides, with regard to this black bulbul, now younger people call them Pucaq lmiqu in our language, while elderly people call them Pucaq.

trv: malox ka tanah qowaq na daha papak na na.
