trv: rih so wada wada ho oxe kesaon wada slamaqon so hari wada slamaqon maano di rtahoc poniq kika maano di qowaq na daka papak na ma kika mtanah papak na daka qowaq na pocaq lmiqo dehok saya mesa ka rodan.
english: In other words, black bulbul seemed to be burned by the ember, so his mouth and feet are still red now, the elderly said.

trv: ma menaq ka menaq ka tiyaqong ga na kingan kari daha we wada iriqon btonox kesaon so mo ini daha nkmekoli a dmidin soni na.
english: Then, as for crow, there is one story. I just told you he was hit by the stone and could not move the stone.

trv: mosa mosa skadi maano di a poso poniq nii pocaq daka maano di a tiyaqong nii na.

trv: ado plaale mang ado plaale a maano di smdiyan ka tiyaqong a maano di pocaq kika ma mesa mesa ka tiyaqong lngelongan na mesa a ma oxe kii di ma ta na oxe baka dongan peni.
english: Because black bulbul found it first, crow thought, "How can we lose to him again?"

trv: kika osaon na gmeelok ino naq dong knk kmekolon so gmeelok maano ka pocaq a.
english: Thus he went to rob black bulbul, but how could you possibly rob black bulbul?

trv: kii naq beyax na ps maano di so ps kmeto ma dmoi papak na oka na ngangalan.

trv: ma mosa ho hmeri heya mosa mosa lox maano di pcoling hii ka ima di tiyaqong nii di.
english: Instead, crow went and got scalded for no reason.

trv: kika dehok dheran tiyaqong nii na ado ka pncoling ka menaq maano di skiya baro han na ado pncoling papak na peni kika dehok dheran di na kika so hari sbbobo icin kkesa na ani dehok saya tiyaqong nii di so kika kari rodan ta.
english: Thus, when crow arrived on the ground, because his feet were scalded when he flew above, he swayed when walking even to this day. Our ancestors told the story like this.

trv: ma ki ma kiya ani dehok saya na kesaon tongan nii na kari kesaon tongan nii na potongan k poso na kari we potongan.
english: And even to this day, the place called Tongan, the so-called Tongan this word, its word root is p-utung-an.

trv: zi bale bale na e kesaon po a pkesaon a tongan nii na potongan bale ba ka ngayan na.

trv: ma bale ba ori ga ino saya kesaon na qra qrari naq knmalo kiya sn snlayan pocaq kii ini ko kela ori.
english: Was it true? Where is the real place where black bulbul found the nice white flints? I don't know, either.

trv: kiya naq dehok hini kari mo.

trv: o kii howa so mo denwa wada ino laqi kii di ha.

ga naq so mhemoc mkkesa alang.
wada skadi malo heya ado eniqan na ado eniqan rolo han on on eniqan kana kamera.

ego ego riyong so REDosaon dori.

oxe ini eyah baro kari na.

eniqan naq rolo ma eniqan kamera.

mosa ko nanto ciga om meyah ko o kengos maano kekong ma.

trv: heya naq morox neyah ka mqedin.

trv: kii ga ko na rengoon maha ko naq a niciyo ga ko na kesaon.

eniqan o mita hii kiya hari da.

trv: heya om malo kii riyong malo riyong o knowan eniqan so jikan ha ta mita texan.

trv: iya ani so naq ini pahae so mo pqita ko te ta howa mesa mokan pgeelok pila.

ima ka osaon namo mita ga mhoqin singgi.

ma ma maha namo ngerac dongan kiya ga hmowa.

I heard that is a bad illness.

trv: oxe so hari yani oxe pqbsiyaq.

So he does not look good.

trv: meyah do ga smiling a laqi rseno nii.

trv: oxe ini howa osa skadi mrebo han eniqan seediq rengoon kesai.

diannao na ga ga na ini adisi a mano di mprengo mprengo na gaga.

trv: kiya ka wada takor di ma wada cowaq a a hei qhoni pnosa na rarawa nii.

trv: ma kiya ka mono rodan mnosa baro dowe e qitaan na bale ka angalan na nii.

a so keno ka nodaan na.
a ini mo kelai kiya di.
ah yako na eh neyah ko jinago yako neyah ko alang tongan ga ko meniq ka alang bayke hini na.
english: I come from Meixi tribe, Renai village. I'm now still living in Meixi tribe.

tama bobo tamabobo mo de tama mo de temo pido ma bobo mo de komo biyogo bobo mo ha.

trv: ma so cbeyo na kana so kana so nodaan na bobo mo peni.

trv: bobo mo ga hmowa ceka rabi so eh sanji de ga totoi ga mesa kong kong kong ka bobo mo ma.

trv: ma osaon mo qmita ma kela naq ga tminon pala ka bobo mo.
english: So I looked in the front, to find that my mother was weaving.

trv: ma ga mnoqah doma ka mqedil gaga ssiyo na hiya ma.
english: Next to her were women who were twisting the threads of ramie yarn.

trv: ma totoi ka bobo mo de ga tminon.
english: My mother weaved when she got up from bed.

trv: ma bsiyaq hari de gaga tminon kana so oyong ma so so deriq so ah ssiyo sapah hii.
english: And not long after (my mother got up), those who lived behind and next to our house were all weaving.

trv: ma kana mqedil ga mesa kong kong ka keeman sanji di ma.
english: Then all women were making the 'kong kong' sound at three o'clock in the morning.

trv: giso naq hmowa rodan nii mesa ko ma ini ko qemi dori.
english: So I thought: "What are these elderly women doing?" I couldn't sleep.

trv: ma wiso tminon lokos plokoson namo mesa ka bobo.
english: My mother said, "I'm making clothings. I'm making clothings for you all."
"We're running out of clothes!" she said.

trv: ki mgrebo totoi se ego riyong ka so ooda smalo so pala kana hilo si ma kana so pala ka so plokoson namo mesa ka bobo mo.
english: "I get up in the morning, because there are so many things to do, such as making quilts, and making the cloths for your clothings" said my mother.

trv: ox mesa ko ma ma ini ko qemi di tloong ko siyo na bobo mo.
english: I said: "I see!," and could not continue sleeping, so I sat next to my mother.

trv: ga miri a pacang capang rato paro ka bobo mo.
english: My mother was weaving flower patterns in making large thick quilts.

trv: ma mesa ka bobo mo eh iwan slohei tikoh mesa ka bobo mo.
english: "Iwan, come and learn!," said my mother.

trv: ma peeyah ko naq narac yako ka so ah moda so lmamo ma gaga peeyah so ah migi ka bobo mo lmamo tninon msterong miyan ckceka.
english: I started from the right, and passed through the threads. My mother also started from the right moving up and down across the threads. We came across each other in the middle (of the cloth).

trv: kika wada so wada so biciq ba hari ka odaon na bobo mo ma dmayo ko tikoh hiya ma.
english: In this way, the area on the cloth that she had to go though became less. I helped a little!

trv: maha mapa kana waso bonga bbiyan meyah tmabo baboy tmabo rodox meyah maho lokos keeman mesa ko ma.
english: "She carries back all the yam leaves in the evening, coming home to feed the bips and the chickens, and she does the laudary at night" I thought

trv: kika qitaan mo so bobo mo kana so ata mo kana so tama mo ma eh qbsoran mo.
english: I saw my mother, my sisters in law, my father, and my older siblings.

trv: ma ma ma ano ka so ah ah mbqeros riyong ka so ah.
english: So I saw my mother, my sister-in-law, my father, and my older brothers and sisters. All of them worked so hard.

trv: nodaan cbeyo mesa ko nodaan saya mesa ko ma kika mlome m lmngelong ko di.
english: Life in the past was much harsher than life in the present. This is what I thought.

trv: ano meepah kelaon daha rodan cbeyo ma mapa broro ma mosa so mapa qhoni.
english: The elderly people in the past, they only knew about working and carrying baskets and woods.

trv: ma bobo mo de malo tonox na bobo mo mesa hiya iwan sa ah secogiyo so kokoming gako de osa nogio gako osa slohe tikoh ano ka smais lokos kesaon ko na.
english: But my mother, she was so brilliant. "Iwan, you have graduated from elementary school. Go to the Wushe Agriculture School and learn how to do dressmaking!" she said.

trv: ma moqi malo tonox ka rodan kiya.
english: This old lady is indeed very brilliant.

trv: ini so kiya bobo mako mbeyax bale so ah so smeelo oda mo.
english: But my mother was not like that. She tried her best to lead me.

trv: osa mooyas nogiyo gako paran sa osa slohe ah smais kesaon ko na ma.
english: She told me: "Go to Wushe Agriculture School and learn dressmaking."

trv: kika rokageco ko mhedo smais mooyas ah ah paran de meyah ko sapah di.
english: So after learning dressmaking in Wushe for six months, I went back home.

trv: ma kesaon ko na do iwan s ini osa ini baka snlohean so na osa ano ka slohe ano ka yosai hori smais lokos dongan kesaon ko na.
english: And she told me: "Iwan, what you've learned is not enough yet. Go to Puli to learn western dressmaking and make clothings."

trv: ma kika mosa ko slohe hori dongan ma kela ko hari smais di.
english: So I went to Puli to learn more. Then I got to know a little more about dressmaking.

trv: ma kika secogiyo nami hori hbaro ba ka tnhiqan mo ka mokan ori ma seediq ka hori hii ma.
english: When we graduated in Puli, we had many classmates. There were the Southern Min people and also the Seediq people.

trv: meyah ko sapah di kika so haykjo so ah tensokjo so lokos kana lokos ah paro biciq adison daha sapah mo.
english: As I came home, all the clothes that the church allocated to the tribe, the large ones and the small ones, were brought by people to my house.

trv: kela smais iwan komo sa ha ta mege hii kana ka li lokos ah so paro ah lokos ah dame nii ha ta kayjyo hiya.
english: They said: "Iwan Kumu can do dressmaking. Let's bring her all the clothes, the large ones given by the foreigners, and have them busheled!

trv: ma kika adison daha kana lokos daha.
english: Therefore, they brought all their clothes to me.

trv: knkingan lokos na wada mo kayjyo de gocogen angalon mo ciida ma.
english: One after another, I busheled the clothes, and was paid fifty dollars for each piece.

trv: kesaon ta gocogen ciida ge paro riyong pila ka ciida ma.
english: At that time, fifty dollars was quite a lot of money to us.

trv: qaras riyong ka bobo mo ma ko malo riyong ppoyas ko iso sa eN eniqan oh ah eniqan dongos na kiya mesa bobo mo.
english: My mother was very happy and she said, "It's good that I made you study. It's a valuable thing!" she said.

trv: ma kika mosa ko seno di ma kika eniqan naq ka so pnsokay ah seno mo kiya ma mosa ko telo ma.
english: So via a matchmaker, I married to a Chinese person.

trv: bo berih ko alang dongan meyah ko ah smiling bobo mo bobo mesa ko howa mesa tminon tgesai ko tminon ha kesaon mo.
english: Then I returned to the tribe, asking my mother again about weaving. "Mother," I said, "please teach me how to weave!"

trv: ciida de tena ko so cogosay corokosay hari do ma.
english: At that time, I was about fifteen or sixteen years old.

trv: so eh tgesai ko tikoh tminon kesaon bobo mo ma tgesaon ko na.
english: "Please teach me a little about weaving!" I said to her. So she taught me.

trv: kana so kegoy nii han mo mangan seediq kana kegoy.
english: All the ramies (used for weaving) were from (the seeds given by) other people.

trv: slaale ko mhoma kegoy han ma kika noq ah qmnoqah ko di ma so tmgiya kana so dmgese so tminon di.
english: I grew ramie first, and then I twisted the threads, rolled them, coiled them, and then weaved.

trv: kika m meyah naq kana lnlongan mo do ma.
english: Because of this, all my interests were aroused.

trv: betaq saya ge maha ko bale yonjonen hari smalo kana so lokos ah lokos seediq so lokos ta ita so tgdaya di peni ma.
english: I've been making all kinds of clothings for about forty years, including our traditional clothings of the Tgdaya people.

trv: ncoin ko tminon dori ncoin ko mosa maroy tikoh so kasimirong so tninon mokan dori ma kika matak matak ko lokos ma.
english: Sometimes I would buy nylon threads for weaving, and I would use the Southern Min techniques to cut and make clothes.

trv: nasi oxe tikoh kiya ka so wada mo ga mo so cikao tikoh so dmayo tikoh so seno mo so dmanga laqi.
english: If it hadn't been that (little amount of money earned by weaving), it would have been a little tougher for me to help my husband raise our children.

trv: eN biciq bale ka hokjo na seno mo dori ma.
english: My husband also earned very little at that time.

trv: kika betaq ko saya rodan ko saya di.
peeyah ko co gosay colokosay slohe bobo mo saya de rokoco haci ko saya di rodan ko qodi kana tonox mo di.
english: I had learned (the art of weaving) from my mother since I was sixteen years old, and now, I am already sixty-eight years old. I am old now, with my hair all becoming white.

trv: ma ego riyong ka kana sa so gokgoso ma so genseho na gaga so dmayo bale ka so so seediq yoanzhomin yoanzhomin.
english: Many government authorities concerned, such as the Township Office and the County Government, are offering a lot of help to the aborigines.

trv: mesa eN totoi kana so nodaan rodan cbeyo mesa hiya kana so tmlenga ma so tminon di kana so mhoma ma totoi kana kiya sa.
english: They said:"Revitalize your traditions! Revitalize the cultures of trap-hunting, weaving, and plant-growing."

trv: gokgoso giso so tmotoy dmayo ori na.
english: The Township Office is also pushing forward (all the revitalization programs).

trv: ma kika kika eniqan nanaq so so daigako dori moda sapah he moda rmigo tikoh so tminon ko ma so eniqan naq so ooda so tminon so smais.
english: Also, some university came to my house to know something about my weaving techniques, the processes involved, and some sweing techiniques.

trv: ego bale riyong ka snalo mo ga sapah hii dori ma ma eniqan naq moda maroy de maroy seediq ma.
english: Many of my works are in my house, too, and when people pass by, they would buy them.

trv: kika an ta naq so ah meniq naq hii ka doma ma hbaro ba ka moda ka so seediq ma so mokan ma qmita koxon daha de maroy di.
english: Even though some people are just looking, there are still many people, including Seediq and Southern Min ones, who would buy if they like the works after looking.

trv: ma saya de saya de kika ima ka sense ah sense ano ka neyah so daygako nii kana so da aking nii hoang hoangmeiyo laoshi hoN oN ma kana sense ka daygako mokan.
english: Today here we have the university professor of Southern Min origin, and also teacher Meiyu Huang.

trv: ma mesa hii ano ka posai tikoh so rengoi tikoh ka nodaan so cbeyo mesa hiya.
english: Then they said to me: "Tell us a little bit about your past experience."

trv: lngelongon mo bobo mo na so nodaan mo cbeyo.
english: I then thought of my mother, and my past experience.

trv: ne mesa ka mesa ka lngelongan mo lmngelong mita ko sasing na bobo mo klaali bobo mesa ko lngelongon so mo riyong.
english: Whenever I see the pictures of my mother, I would say in my mind: "Mother, I miss you so much!"

trv: nasi oxe iso ga dmayo yako ge naka so ini so nii knmalo nodaan mo mesa ko naq lmngelong.
english: "If you hadn't helped me, I wouldn't have lived such a good life" I think.
"Thank you so much, mother," I said.

trv: knootox ko naq rmengo so sapah ma ani ko moda elo.
english: I'd say so when I am alone at home, and even when I'm walking on the road.

trv: lmngelong ko bobo mo ge lmingis ko.
english: I cry every time I think of my mother.

trv: malo so riyong bobo mesa ko.
english: I would say, "Mother, you are so great!"

trv: nasi oxe iso oxe ko mpso nii mesa ko naq lmngelong kiya ka arigato bale bobo mo ha.
english: "If it hadn't been you, I would not have become like what I am now" I would say this to myself in my mind. I am truly thankful to my mother.

trv: ano kiya ka kari mo saya di.
english: So these are what I want to say today.

trv: eN arigato bale ka so sense giso meyah so ah mhowe namo bale so sense giso moda so theyaq sapah mo rengoi tikoh nodaan so ah cbeyo mesa ka sense nii mesa ka deheya nii.
english: I want to thank the professor, who has come here, visited my house and said "Tell us a little bit about your past experience!"

trv: anaq betaq naq hini kari mo da.
ah yo betaq kiya da ha arigato.
eniqan kingal seediq alang ini gdema tikoh mosa meepah qneepahan na.
english: There was tribe man. He was very busy with his field work.

trv: mhei ka pnhomaan na di ma.
english: The tree that he grew had borne fruits.

trv: wa ini gdema mosa lmamo oh hei qhoni na.
english: He was busy picking the fruits.

trv: ani naq so wada paro ka knkawas na mosa mdakin qhoni baro sskingal kn kingalon na mosa lmamo ka hei na qhoni kiya.
english: Although he was very old, he still climbed onto the tree and picked his fruits one by one.

trv: ma ini naq gdema ka kingal seediq tmolos miric moda ssiyo na hiya.
english: There was another busy person. He pulled his goat and passed there.

trv: ini oka krkari ini naq pprengo ye mteeyox meepah oda daha ka seediq tn alang kiya.
english: They did not talk to each other because they were busying doing their own work.

trv: ini qbsiyaq do yani wada tero rawa ka lnamoan na qneepahan na hei qhoni ka baki rodan nii.
english: This old man finished his job and gathered three baskets of fruits.

trv: giso ka laqi na kndalax sapah poyasan taapa rolo.
english: His child came back from school by bicycle.

trv: ma ye na sgaalo ka tama na rodan angalan na hii ka kingal a rawa hei qhoni kiya.
english: And out of care, he helped his grandpa to take a basket of fruits.

trv: dmayo tama na rodan ah haqolon na adison na sapah.
english: He helped his grandpa take the basket home.

trv: ma ini naq kl kela ka tama na rodan gaga lmamo hei qhoni siyo qhoni baro gaga.
english: And his grandpa concentrated on picking fruits and did not know that.

trv: ma ye mteeyox naq madis raw rawa oh hei qhoni ka oh laqi na kiya ma ini naq klkela dori.
english: And the child rushed to take that basket of fruits, and did not know it at all.

trv: ma wada taapa rolo ka laqi na oh oh riso na kiya ma.
english: And then, his grandson rode his bike and left.

trv: sterong a kingal a oh seediq tnalang mtena taapa rolo.
english: met a person in the same tribe who also rode a bike.

trv: ma qmita laqi mqedin ka oh riso kiya ma wada skiya ka bonoh na.
english: This boy looked at a girl and then his hat flew away.

trv: ma ye moda tdiyan btonox di ma moda takon tgarang dheran kana ka hei qhoni lnamo na baki na rodan.
english: As he bumped into a stone and fell down, the fruits were scattered on the ground.

trv: ye mnarox ba ka papak na ma mklmingis en s kingal lamoon lamoon na ka hei qhoni kiya.
english: His foot seemed to hurt and he felt like crying; he picked up the fruits one by one.

trv: ma moda hiya ka oh tnalang ka lqlaqi dori.
english: At the same time, children in the tribe also passed there.

trv: qmita taqi hiya taqi oh takon ma ye gmaalo heya ma do dayoon daha lmamo ka oh toting dheran hei qhoni ka seediq tnalang laqi hiya malo ba m ggaalo bale.
english: Those children in the same tribe saw him fall down. They felt sorry for him and helped him pick up the fruits on the ground. Cooperation is really good.

trv: ma mhedo a lmamo di ma ini taapa rolo toloson na ka rolo na dahaka hei qhoni laqa laqi nii ma mkesa ma ye mnarox papak na.
english: After picking all the fruits up, he walked with his bike. He felt like crying because his foot hurt.

trv: ma bsiyaq hari do moda moda lamoan a oh hei qhoni hiya ka le la lqlaqi ma.
english: Before long, the children passed by the place where the old man gathered the fruits.

trv: qmita rawa na ka baki rodan ma wada oka kingal a hei qhoni di ha mesa lmngelong wa na sepoon ma wada ino di.
english: The old man saw the gathered fruits and thought, "How come there is one missing?." He counted and thought ""Where has it gone?."

trv: lmngelong baki rodan wada ino kingal na rawa mnangal na hei qhoni di ha oxe tero peni ye daha bale ma lmngelong bale ba ka baki na rodan nii.
english: The old man thought, "Do I not have three baskets of fruits? Where is the missing one? Is it that in fact I have only two baskets?."

trv: ita na wiso ta soopo tloong han na.
wiso ka seediq di ma kika.
mlawa ta ma agoh agoh agoh.
english: Let's call out (to that person): "Come! Come! Come!"

trv: oN ma eh yako do mosa ko hmangoc sama kesa iso da monlamo peni ego kari iso han.
english: "I'll go cook some vegetables," you'd say. all kinds of words! Aren't you talkative? You go first!

trv: yako de maano oka so bego qnooqo mesa ko ma.
english: What should I say? "Is there any alcohol here?" I say.

trv: niqan wa si ma maano ka cikon ta peni mesa ko yako a.
english: "There is," someone would say. Then, "What should we eat along with the alcohol?" I would say.

trv: oh skadio mo so nngari hini han ah mesa so han.
english: So you say: "Let me see what is left over here first."

trv: ima dadan ta kesaon mo plawaane ta ka kiya gaga ino mesa.
english: "Who's our friend?" I'd say. "Let's call that person! Where is she?"

trv: ga ino haroko ah c cece ta ha mesa ta han.
english: We would say: "Where is our sister Haruko?"

trv: ma okas a maano mesa ka haroko.
agoh eyahi mangan a patis awi baso nii a miiso mian seno a.
english: Come! Come and take this letter from Awi Baso! We are afraind of your husband.

trv: naqah seno mseyang sa mplawa mimah sino.
english: The husband is bad. People say he scolds if we invite each other to drink.

trv: naqah roro beebo na wa haroko deno.
english: Roro is bad. He still beats Haruko.

trv: miico riyong miico riyong roro wa haroko.
english: Haruko is very fraid of Roro.

trv: har osaon miyan a mnangi ko mesa eyahi mangan tegami a m kesaon mo ma.
english: I'll pretend to say "Come take the letter!"

trv: mkela naq a oN nangion mo mesa eyah mang tegami a.
english: She'll know that I'm just pretending in saying "Come take the letter!"

trv: mke mkela riyong kari iso ha.
on mesa miyan eyahi mang tegami so mesa de miico seno de kani eyah ma ado kesaon tegami de meyah kesaon ma.
english: We can say "Come take your letter!." She is afraid of her husband, so she wouldn't come (to drink with us). But becuase we say that there is a letter, she will come.

trv: a m m mapa laqi diyan a mbserox ta mapa laqi di ma.
english: Taking care of the children during the day, we get tired.

trv: bego naqah kiya ka bego nami imahan sino de.
english: That soup is what we will have with the alcohol.

trv: kika m kika mimah sino de ka ego riyong ka kari di ma mhemoc mprengo di.
english: So we've already talked a lot about drinking alcohol. It's just random chatting.

trv: Sndamac namo balay. Mprading ta da.
Sndamac namo balay. Hyaon mnchaya rmngaw kari Sediq ka oqon tosaon mptosa diyax saya.
english: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say food in Sederik.

trv: Klaon so mbahang ka tnsanan mptosa?
english: Do you understand what the teacher says?

trv: Mptosa, ini mo klayi. Malo so rmngaw mntxan dongan?
english: I don't understand. Can you repeat it again?

trv: Ini mo qbhangi, ya so malo kbeyhing hari kari?
english: I can't hear you, can you speak louder?

trv: Qita hini! Snoli ko smpo txan.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Everyone read it out very well.

trv: Spo txan dongan. Kbeyhing hari hnang.
english: Read it again. Please speak louder.

trv: Mptosa, cnhongi ko madas impico da.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

trv: Mptosa, cnhongi ko madas ssoros da.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.

trv: Usa knbarox ssiyaw tnhiqan so moyas ka ssoros.
english: Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

trv: Moda hini ka ratoc snlhayan ta han, mstorong ta babaw dongan.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

trv: Laqi ko Sodo Tada ka yako, Kayko Sodo ka hangan mo.
english: I am the son of Sudu Tada, my name is Kayku Sudu.

trv: Tnsanan ko na Siyac Bawah ka yako, Dakis Torih ka hangan mo.
english: I am a student of Siyac Bawah, and my name is Dakis Torih.

trv: Yodaw Mona ka hangan tama mo.
english: My father's name is Yudaw Mona.

trv: Qbsoran mo snaw ka hiya, Abo Nokan ka hangan na.
english: He's my brother, his name is Abu Nukan.

trv: Iyaq, Bakon Piyang ka hangan na.
english: Yes, his name is Bakun Piyang.

trv: Uxay, Temo Ciray ka hangan niya.
english: No, his name is Temu Ciray.

trv: Sama Watan ka hiya. Swayi qridin bobo mo ka hiya.
english: She's Sama Watan. she's my aunt.

trv: Dangi mo ka hiya, Bakan Watan ka hangan niya.
english: She is my friend and her name is Bakan Watan.

trv: Khno kngkawas niya ka hiya da?

english: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

trv: Dha ka qbsoran mo mi, taxa ka swayi mo.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

trv: Piya knhbrawan hiyi ka tnsapah namo?
english: How many people are in your family?

trv: Spac knhbrawan hiyi ka tnsapah mo.
english: There are four of us in our family.

trv: Wa qmpah mano ka mnswayi snaw bobo so?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?

trv: Niqan qpahon ka qbsoran so qridin?
english: Does your sister have a job?

trv: Wa mniq byoing qmpah ka hiya?
Kiya, mqaras balay kana ka tnsapah mo.
english: Yes, we are all very tall.

trv: Wada moyas ka swayi so qridin da?
english: Does your sister go to school?

trv: Iyaq, wada moyas ka hiya da.
Mkla rmngaw kari Sediq ka dswayi so?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?

trv: Iyaq, mkla rmngaw kari Sediq ka dhiya?
english: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?

trv: Ttoro nami hiyi ka tnswayi nami.
english: I have three brothers and sisters.

trv: Msopo so tama bobo mniq sapah ka iso?
english: Do you live with your parents?

trv: Iyaq, msopo ko tama bobo mo mniq sapah ka yako.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

trv: Msopo so tama rodan bobo rodan mniq sapah ka iso?
english: Do you live with your grandparents?

trv: Ini, ini ko psopo dhiya mniq sapah ka yako.
english: No, I didn't live with them.

trv: Msopo so ima msopo mniq sapah?
Msopo ko tama mi bobo mi qbsoran snaw ka mniq sapah.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.
I am from the tribe of Duda.

trv: Wa mniq alang Ungo ka sapah mo.
english: Our home is in the Ungu Yanu tribe.

trv: Wa mniq ino ka alang nniqan rodan so?
Wa mniq alang Snowil ka alang nniqan rodan mo.
english: My hometown is in the Snozakura tribe.

trv: Wa mniq ino ka alang namo?
Wa msdalih Bnohor Rmdax Tasil ka alang nami.
english: Our tribes are all in the White Rock Holy Mountain area.

trv: So knowan ka mosa namo alang?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?

trv: Sngayan rbawan cida pa qolong ko mosa alang.
english: I will go back in the summer.

trv: Pcriyo ka hidaw da, mtilox bay ka karac.
english: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?

trv: Mskoy balay, plkosi oo hari lokos.
english: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

trv: Ini, msbwihor da, mtlto balay ka karac.
Ini ktilox mi kskoy ka karac saya, mndongos balay.
english: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

trv: Uka rolong ka karac, pcriyo ka pngerah da.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

trv: Hana msowan, thidaw da, pcriyo ka Hakaw Utox da.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
What's the weather like where you are?

trv: Wiso msbwihor beyhing ka yami hini.
english: We're going to have a big storm here.

trv: Ya mndongos ka karac iso hiya?
Malo balay, mthidaw beyhing bay ka hidaw.
english: Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

trv: Mskoy balay ka karac, koo hari pnlkosan so lokos.
english: It's cold, you need to wear more clothes.

trv: Mpqoyox beyhing kiya da, iya chongi madas trasi.
english: It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

trv: Nhana mbrowa, ya bay mosa qmoyox kiya hari da.
english: There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

trv: Qmnoyox ka soni, wiso msowan ka saya da.
english: It just rained, and now it's stopped.

trv: So bay qmnoyox da, mhoriq ka elo beyhing.
english: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

trv: Qmnoyox? Ma mhoriq kana ka hiyi so?
english: Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

trv: Wa qmoyox ka ngangoc, ini ko adas trasi.
english: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

trv: Beyhing bay ka bwihor, mako so mnarox bay ka tonox mo nyopan bwihor.
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

trv: Beyhing bay ka hidaw, mako so mtnoyong balay ka tonox mo tnhdawan hiyaw.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

trv: Ini ko adas ori, nta mari.
english: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?
Well, I still have to buy erasers.
Let's go get breakfast, shall we?
No, I've already eaten at home.
I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

trv: So kiya da o psopo ta mkan hndayo moda ha!
english: Then let's eat my lunch box together!

trv: Mkan so mano ka cka hidaw?
english: What are you having for lunch?

trv: Mpkan ko oqon pnhapoy sapah pyasan.
english: I want a nutritious school lunch.

trv: Mpkan so mano ka cka hidaw?
english: What are you having for lunch?

trv: Mnadas ko hndayo ka saya, psopo ta mkan ka cka hidaw pa!
english: I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Let's go play basketball, shall we?
Let's go play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.

trv: Iyaq, bqani miso ka sksik ni.
english: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

trv: Dyawi ko mangal waliq ssoros haw?
english: Can you help me with the cloth?

trv: Wiso ko smksik, plwani ka Ukan Rabay dmayaw sonan mangal.
english: I'm sweeping the floor and you ask Ukan Rabay to carry it for you.

trv: Mrotiq ka dxral, hay smoros tikoh han.
english: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

trv: Iyaq, hay ko mangal waliq ssoros.
english: Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

trv: Mrotiq balay ka bnlingan way, hay smoros tikoh han.
english: That window is very dirty, go clean it.

trv: Tawa han, ini ko qdo smksik ka hini na.
english: Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.

trv: Mphoya so ka babaw mlatac sapah pyasan?
english: What do you do after school?

trv: Mptohoy ko dangi mo mosa moyas oyas?
english: I'm going to sing with my friends.

trv: Mphoya babaw mlatac sapah pyasan ka hiya?

english: May I ask if Ayuc Watan is home?

trv: Wa sapah ka hiya, awah ckcka sapah.
english: She's at home, please come in.

trv: Uka wah, niqan mano ka ddaon so?
english: She's not here, what can I do for you?

trv: tama rodan, yako Rabay Diro, rwahi ko rhngon.
english: Grandpa, I'm Rabay Diro, please open the door.

trv: Lobi, yako Komo Nawi, wiso ko miyah tohoy sonan da.
english: Lubi Nawi, I'm Kumu Nawi and I've come to play with you.

trv: Kiya wah! Lnglongon miso balay! Nhari miyah pprngaw ta kari pa!
english: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let's chat!
Please sit down and have a cup of tea.
Please have a cup of tea.

trv: Malo bay mmahon ka ociya namo.
Iyaq wa! So knmalo bay qtan ka hhiyi pnwalang niyi.
Mnhdo pchada oqon idaw kmanan ka bobo da, nhari miyah mkan pa!
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I'll go wash my hands.

trv: Qoqo mkan mi mimah, mbay so sediq icil da.
english: Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you're not an outsider.

trv: Oo bay qnqan mo da, mtngi bay da.
english: I ate a lot, I'm full.

trv: Koo hari oqon so, iya qsiqa.
Mmosa ko da, miyah ko mita sonan nxal dongan.
english: I'm leaving, I'll see you next time.

trv: Kman bay da, mosa ko sapah da.
Iyaq, niqan diyax so pa awah tohoy sapah mo.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

trv: Sndamac namo balay, mptosa ka madas yamo mosa smlohay mi smiling rdrodan alang.
english: Hello everyone, today I'm taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

trv: tama rodan, wiso nami miyah qmita sonan da.
english: Grandpa, we've come to see you.

trv: Mkla namo rmngaw kari Sediq hay! Laway bay knmalo!
Sndamac namo balay, mpwela yamo mosa qnpahan tmokoy maco ka mptosa saya.
english: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

trv: Awah tbko mhiyo hini kana, iya chngi madas ka qqiya ddiyon qmpah.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

trv: Iyaq, mptosa, wa nami madas qqiya ddiyon qmpah kana da.
english: Yes, sir, we've got our tools.

trv: Ini dhoq na, thiyaq balay na.
english: Not yet, it's still far away.

trv: Iyaq, yako ka moda cmoyoq qsiya.
Usa mangal plwaqan qdoda ka iso.
english: You go get the bird catcher.

trv: Iyaq, yako ka mosa lmiwaq qdoda.
english: Okay, I'll go and catch the birds.

trv: Sndamac namo balay, mosa ta sanan mita ccamac ka saya.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

trv: Taway bay knmalo wah! Mphoya ta mosa ho?
english: Awesome! How are we going to get there?

trv: Blayaq tbko mhiyo kana, psramal ta mari kipo.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

trv: Brah o qdoda, bokoy o qoyo, sani nanaq sdmhaw qmita.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

trv: Ini hoya, so kiya da o osa qmita qdoda.
english: It doesn't matter, then you go and watch the birds.

trv: Kingal jikang spngan da o awah ta mstorong hini dongan.
english: We'll meet back here in an hour.

trv: Mano ka qnita so diyax saya?
Oo bay qntan mo qoyo, kari bay ka qdoda ori.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

trv: Tawa ko han, mowic bay ka qaqay mo.
english: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

trv: Psopo ta mosa tmapaq qsiya haw?
Hbaraw bay sediq ka wiso tmapaq qsiya hini.
english: There are a lot of people swimming here.

trv: Rboq bay ka qsiya hiya, tmapaq ta qsiya hini da malo da.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

trv: Tnapa so rolo mano ka iso?
english: What kind of car did you take?

trv: Tnapa ko baso miyah ka yako.
Mnchoya so mosa pnrholan ka iso?
english: How do you go to church?

trv: Mriq rolo mapa knan msopo nami mosa ka tama mo.
Hmnoya mosa sapah pyasan kddiyax ka hiya?
english: How does he usually go to school?

trv: Tapa cyeyyon mosa sapah pyasan ka hiya?
english: He took the subway to school.

trv: Mnchoya mosa mari sama ka bobo rodan so?
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

trv: Mriq otobay mosa mari sama ka hiya.
english: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

trv: Mphoya so mosa Tao ka iso?
english: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

trv: Mptapa ko aso ka mosa Tao.
english: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?

trv: Tnapa skoki mosa Tao ka hiya?
Tnapa rolo mano mosa Takaw ka hiya?
english: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

trv: Tnapa kawtyey mosa Takaw ka hiya.
english: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

trv: Tnapa kisya mosa Tayto ka hiya?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

trv: Iyaq, tnapa kisya mosa Tayto ka hiya.
english: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

trv: Uxay, tnapa skoki mosa Tayto ka hiya?
english: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

trv: Niqan sanan tapa baso ka hini?
english: Is there a bus stop near here?

trv: Niqan, msdorox mosa da o kiya ka mpqita so ppaon baso da.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

trv: Weyno ka ceyyon msdalih bay hini?
english: Where is the nearest MRT station?

trv: Uka ceyyon ka hini, wana haya ka malo so ppaon.
english: There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

trv: Khno diyax ka tapa baso dhoq sapah pyasan?
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

trv: Khno diyax ka tapa kawtyey dhoq Taycyo?
english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?
I will come to Taichung in an hour.

trv: Bsiyaq balay ka mriq rolo mosa Ulay?
english: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

trv: Khno diyax ka tapa so ceyyon dhoq sapah mo?
english: How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

trv: Mkla ko mriq ddeynsya ka yako.
Uxay ko, ini ttoko ka knkla mo.
english: Don't, I don't know much about it.

trv: Niqan so diyax ka babaw cka hidaw? Knmosa ko qmita sonan, ya malo ho?
english: Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that OK?
Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

trv: Niqan diyax so ka koson? Iyox ko mpsiling sonan qori pnngalan kari pnsltodan Sediq.
english: Are you free tomorrow? I'd like to ask you about the saga of the Sedecks.

trv: Mosa ko lmiqo ka koson, oka ko mniq sapah wah.
english: I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, I'm not home.

trv: Mbahang ko iso pa niqan balay knklanan so qori waya Sediq, knpsiling ko sonan.
english: I've heard that you're very knowledgeable about the traditional customs of the Sedykes and would like to ask you a few questions.

trv: Ini ttoko ka knklanan mo, binaw, qqowi ko cmiyok kari.
english: I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

trv: Ya ko malo psoeyga? Kiya ka mndongos bay smko ndanan ta.
english: Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

trv: Khno so kngkawas ka saya da?
Mngari kmxalan mspac kngkawas mo da.
Uxay wah! Rodan ko bay da.

english: I'm from the alang Truwan Deer Bay tribe.
Is your wife also a Sedek?

trv: Mkla ko rmngaw kari Sediq Toda mi kari Seejiq Troko mi kari Seediq Tgdaya.
english: I will speak the Seddiac Dutta and the Seddiac Telugu and the Seddiac Telugu Daya.

trv: Mqaras ko balay malo pssiling sonan ka diyax saya, brahaw so balay oda snrno qori waya psaniq omadok haw?
english: It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

trv: Iyaq. Risaw ko cida pa kntto ko mosa omadok kddiyax.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

trv: Mhoway so balay, laway bay knmalo ka tnsanan so diyax saya.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

trv: Balay bay balay ka rnngaw mo kari, lnotoc hniti snrnowan kari rodan cbiyaw.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

trv: Moda hini ka pprngawan ta. Mhoway so balay snrnowan so kari.
english: That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

trv: Ini hoya, oda ta pprngaw babaw dongan.
Mosa ko da, so mpqbahang oo bay klowanan snrnowan kari ka ndoray dongan.
english: I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

trv: Sndamac so balay, mpbari so mano?
english: Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a cup.
I want to buy a hat.

trv: Mpbari ko kopo, niqan ka sbari namo?
english: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?
No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.

trv: Wada qdiyon pbari ka bonga da.
english: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.
I want to buy two bottles of oil.

trv: Msngari nami kingal balay rosoq da.
english: We only have one bottle left.
How many pounds do you want to buy?

trv: Khno cnhdilan toting ka briyon so balong?
english: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.
I want to buy two green onions.

trv: Msngari toro bnkiyan, sboway miso kana da!
english: There are three left, all for you!

trv: Khno hbangan briyan ka kingal loboy bowax payay niyi?
english: How much is this bag of rice?

trv: Kingal loboy o dha kbkoy klaboy.
Kana baray o mposal kingal krtan pila, ana mposal krtan pila da baka da.
Hini pa mngari kmxalan rima krtan pila.
Mpbari ko tikoh dongan, dhqon kbkoy klaboy.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

trv: Kana balay o rima kbkoy klaboy mi maxal krtan pila.
Ngali ko smpo rima kbkoy klaboy haw?
Scoqi mkray ka niyi da, malo sbari mhnok hari?
english: It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

trv: Naqah, mhnok balay ka niyi da.
english: No, this is already very cheap.

trv: Mangal ko kingal lnbowan pingkan niyi.
english: I want this packet of cookies.

trv: Mtorol krtan pila ka emo ni, mbari so mano nina ho?
english: $30 for the cookies, anything else you need?
Can I borrow money from you?

trv: Malo wah! Khno ka ddiyon so?
english: Yes! How much do you need?

trv: Cnhongi ko madas hbangan da, malo ko knbarox hbangan so?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

trv: Ini ko adas hbangan ori wah!
english: I don't have any money either!

trv: Cnhongi ko madas pila da, malo ko knbarox pila so?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

trv: Uxay ko, ini so brnahi moway knan ka knbrxan so cndoray na.
english: No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

trv: Wada mo kbrxan Tiwas Pawan da.
english: I lent it to Tiwas Pawan.
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

trv: Iyaq, binaw brnahi ko hmadoc koson dongan.
english: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

trv: Qmoyox da, ini ko adas trasi, kbrxi ko trasi haw?
english: It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

trv: Kingal balay ka trasi mo, psopo ta dmowi pa!
english: I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

trv: Niyi ka patas knbrxan miso cndoray, sbrahon miso moway.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

trv: Smatang so mita mmnno patas na? Malo so srngaw knan kana.
english: What else do you want to read? You can tell me anything.

trv: So knowan ka brnahon miso moway hbangan?
english: When do I have to pay you back?

trv: Ini hoya, pprngaw ta niqan so hbangan nxal da.
english: It doesn't matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

trv: Tbrnahon so moway knowan ka hbangan mo?
english: When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.

trv: Tbrnahon so moway knowan ka patas mo?
english: When are you going to return my book?

trv: Uxay miso tbrnahon moway ciwa dpa?
english: Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

trv: Knbrxan so na Korak Tanah ka impico niyi?
english: Did Kurak Tanah lend you this pen?
Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

trv: Knbarox so Bawah Harong ka impico niyi?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Bawah Harung?

trv: Uxay, bnari bobo mo ka niyi.
english: No, this is what my mom bought.

trv: Uka timo da, osa knbarox Komo Nawi tikoh han.
english: We are out of salt, let's borrow some from Kumu Nawi.
Well, I'll go borrow it first.

trv: Plwani ka Trmi Pohok, so ko na brnahon moway ka hbangan mo.
english: Go tell Trmi Puhuk to return my money.

trv: Khno ka wada so na kbrxan hbangan?
english: How much does she owe you?

trv: Mosa ko qnpahan mo mhoma sama.
english: I'm going to plant vegetables in the garden.

trv: Kari bay ka spriq da, wiso ko tmatak, mosa ko cmoyoq qsiya ka kiya hari dongan.
english: There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

trv: Dyawi ko mangal kaol mi aoc haw?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?

trv: Nhana ko tmabol, kiya hari da o rmhak rhak da.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

trv: Malo sqton ka pnhoma so sama da?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

trv: Malo sanan smqic ka tmana hini da, naqah sqton ka sama Watan way na.
english: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

trv: Ibah! Laway bay ka bonga knriyan so.
english: Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

trv: Dyani ko posa rpon binaw haw?
english: Will you help me with the barn?
We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

trv: Oo balay ka qcorox qnrapan nami wa ckcka kobo qcorox.
english: The fish basket has been full of fish.

trv: Hmoya so mnchaya qmraq qcorox kddiyax ka iso?
english: How do you usually catch fish?

trv: Dmowi ko raqic qcorox meytaq qcorox ka yako.
english: I shoot fish with a spear.
Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

trv: Kntto ko posa wasil snoyok qmraq ccamac ka yako, mncowil ko madas poniq mi holing omadok ori.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

trv: Dapin boyak ka niyi, kiya ka elo ddaon boyak ka niyi.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

trv: Knllo ta mosa qmita dorang so bay wada tdiyan camac da.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

trv: So bay wa smknox ka holing da. Snoli ta mosa nhari.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

trv: Mano ka wiso namo smlon saya?
Dangar tasil ka ni, sqraq qolic kiya.
english: This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.
What is that thing you put there?

trv: Wasil snoyok ka tdiyan papak ccamac, ddiyon nami mangal pada.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

trv: Qrason balay ka Utox Tmninon snblayaq tnan, pndongos oo balay ka nangal ta ccamac.
english: We thank the God of Weaving for blessing us with a great harvest today.

trv: Balay kiya! Dsanay ta alang tblayaq msopo msaso ka malo hay!
english: Yeah! It's good that we're bringing it back to the tribe to share!

trv: Yako mptosa saya pa tsanon mako kari Sediq hmoya mchaya rmngaw ka ccamac.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in 3S3T language today.

trv: Yako mptosa saya o tsanon mako kari Sediq hmoya mchaya rmngaw ka hiyi pnwalang.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in 3S3T language today.

trv: Uxay, lokos oba Sawa ka ni.

english: Teacher, I didn't bring my textbook.

trv: Tohoy siyaw tnhiqan so moyas msopo qmita.
english: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

trv: Wada stoq ka ingpico mo da.
Wada oka ka ssoros mo da.

english: I will lend you my eraser.

trv: Mpalix ta moyas da, qhahang elo mmosa sapah!
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

trv: Malix ta moyas da, knbiyax ta kana
english: The class is over, goodbye everyone.

trv: Sndamac namo balay, Walis ka hangan mo.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Walis.

trv: Sndamac namo hangan mo o Takon.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Takun.

trv: Sndamac so balay, Pedang ko ka yako.
Sndamac so balay Pedang, yako pa hay Bowih hangan mo.
Sndamac so balay, Sorok ka hangan mo.
Sorok, sndamac so balay, Bakan ko ka yako.
Bobo ko na Harong, Bowih ka hangan mo.
Swayi qridin ko na Watan ka yako, Bakan ka hangan mo.
english: I am Watan's sister. My name is Bakan.

trv: Mptosa mo ka hiya, hangan niya pa Harong.
Qbsoran mo snaw ka hiya, Qaqong ka hangan na.
Ima hangan niya ka qbsoran so qridin?
english: What is your elder sister's name?

trv: Hangan qbsoran mo qridin o Sama.
english: My elder sister's name is Sama.

trv: Ima ka hangan swayi so qridin?
english: What is your younger sister's name?

trv: Hangan swayi mo qridin pa Robaw.
english: My younger sister's name is Robaw.

trv: Khno kngkawas ka qbsoran so snaw da?
english: How old is your elder brother?

trv: Piya kngkawas ka swayi so snaw da?
english: How old is your younger brother?

trv: Niqan sapah pyasan ka alang namo?
english: Do you have schools in your community?

trv: Wa so moyas sapah pyasan alang ka iso?
english: Do you study in your tribe's school?

trv: Iyaq, wa ko moyas sapah pyasan alang, mntna nami kingal tnsapah.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

trv: Wa qmpah mano ka bobo so?
Wa qmpah mano ka tama so?
Uxay, dangi swayi mo snaw ka hiya.
english: No, he is my younger brother's friend.

trv: Uxay, swayi mo qridin ka hiya.
english: No, she is my younger sister.

trv: Khno knhbrawan hiyi sediq ka tnsapah na?
english: How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.

trv: Piya hiyi laqi ka tnsapah namo?
english: How many children in your family?

trv: Kana nami balay tnsapah o niqan 4 hiyi laqi.
english: There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

trv: Uka ka swayi mo snaw, niqan 3 hiyi ka swayi mo qridin.
english: I don't have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

trv: Piya ka qbsoran so snaw mi qridin?
english: How many older siblings do you have?

trv: Uka qbsoran mo snaw mi qridin.
english: I don't have any older siblings.

trv: Piya hiyi tnswayi so snaw mi qridin?
english: How many siblings do you have?

trv: Uka tnswayi mo snaw mi qridin.
Iyaq, qbsoran mo snaw ka hiya.
Iyaq, Sediq Tnposo nami ka yami.
Iyaq, Sediq minjoko ka hiya ori.
Mskoy hari ka karac, mahi oo hari mtilox oyo.
english: It's a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

trv: Mtilox hari ka karac, mahi oo hari qsiya.
english: It's a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

trv: Beyhing ka hidaw, qlahang hndawan hidaw.
english: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

trv: Oo bay rolong, oka hidaw ka karac.
english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

trv: So bay mosa oka hidaw ka koson, oo rolong, sbwihor beyhing.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

trv: Hmoya ka karac mmosa ta rmiwaw cida?
english: How was the weather that day?

trv: So bay mpskoy hari ka diyax cida, mlatac ngangoc o kasi ka mlokos lokos oba.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How's the weather on the weekend?

trv: Ya bay mosa mdongos ka karac diyax sngayan cida.
english: It will be sunny on the weekend.

trv: Mpqoyox ka diyax mmosa rmiwaw cida?
english: Will it be rainy that day?

trv: Mpsowan ka karac cida, ya bay oxay mpqoyox.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

trv: Iyaq, ya bay mpqoyox ka diyax cida.
english: Yes, it will be rainy that day.
The rain stops and the sun comes out.

trv: Qmoyox da, ini ko adas trasi.
english: It is raining and I don't have an umbrella with me.

trv: Ini qoyox ka saya, ya bay mpqoyox ka babaw cka hidaw, mosa ngangoc pa adas trasi.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

trv: Mpkskoy bay ka misan kawas ho?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

trv: Iyaq, ya bay mosa mskoy bay ka misan kawas, plkosi oo hari lokos.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

trv: Mosa mtilox bay ka rbawan niyi.
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

trv: Ya bay mosa mtilox bay ka rbawan, koo hari nmahan qsiya.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

trv: Snkoxol ko srwasaw, moxol bay ka karac.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

trv: Ini ko hari skoxol krpohan, oo bay sbwihor beyhing ka krpohan.
english: I don't like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

trv: Wada ko cnhongi madas patas da.
english: I forgot to bring the textbook.

trv: Wada ko cnhongi madas ssoros da.
english: I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?

trv: Iyaq, kbrxi ko ingpico so haw?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

trv: Mano ka oqon so cka hidaw?
english: What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?

trv: Mnkan so mano ka cka hidaw?
english: What did you have for lunch?

trv: Usa kramal iso han, sanon miso miying kiya hari da.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

trv: Uxay, hayi ta knama hmaqon patas han.
english: No, we have to carry books first.

trv: Ini na, wiso ko sminaw pngerah.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

trv: Ma so ini trima bawa na?
english: Why didn't you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

trv: Malix so pyasan daw mphoya so?
english: What are you going to do after school?

trv: Malix pyasan daw mphoya ka hiya?
english: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

trv: Wa ko sapah, awah cka nhari.
Uka hini Sawa wah! Ayoc ko ka yako, niqan mano ddaon so? Miyah sapah ka Sawa daw tsaon mo.
english: Sawa is not at home. I am Ayuc. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

trv: Bobo rodan, yami o Trmi mi Komo, dyawi nami rmawah rhngon!
english: Grandma, we are Trmi and Kumu, please open the door for us.

trv: Awi ko ka yako, miyah ko ming Temo ka yako.
english: I am Awi, I am here for Temu.

trv: Bobo rodan, niso ko miyah mita sonan da.
english: Grandma, I am here to see you.

trv: Bsiyaq so balay ini awah da, lnglongan miso balay.
english: You haven't been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

trv: Ayoc, niyi ko miyah tohoy iso ppolah da.
english: Ayuc, I am here to play with you.

trv: Nhari miyah cka sapah, bsiyaq ko bay tmawa sonan da.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

trv: Pnhoma mo ka bonga niyi, tlamay mkan binaw!
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

trv: Chiya bay oqon ka bonga niyi.
english: The sweet potato is so sweet.

trv: Awah! Pnhoma ka hiyi pnwalang niyi, tlamay mkan pa!
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

trv: Chiya bay oqon ka hiyi pnwalang niyi.
Tlong! Pnhoma mo lhngay ini cyoqi noyako ka niyi, tlamay mkan binaw!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

trv: N! Balay bay chiya mi malo bay oqon ka lhngay niyi.
english: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

trv: Naqah ko mkan modo ka yako, mkan ko ringgo da malo da.
english: I can't eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

trv: Sqriyay miso pkan hiyi pnwalang haw?
english: Let me peel the fruit for you.

trv: Mhoway so balay! Laway bay biyoq na ka hiyi pnwalang niyi.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.

trv: Koo hari qnnqan so, oo bay sama pnchada mo.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

trv: N! Balay bay malo bay sknxan mi malo oqon.
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

trv: Koo hari qnnqan so, niqan oo ka hini niya na.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

trv: So kiya daw, oxay ko mpqsiqa da wah!
english: I'll make myself at home then.

trv: Koo hari qnnqan so, niqan oo ka hini nina.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

trv: Oo bay qnnqan mo da, naqah ko mkan da.
english: I ate a lot and couldn't eat any more.

trv: Yako mptosa pa dsi mako lmiqo.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

trv: Rmngaw ka bobo o kari bay preykay ka lmiqo.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

trv: Yako mptosa o dsanay namo qnpahan.
english: I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

trv: Dsanon ta na ssiyaw yayong ka mptosa.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

trv: Dsanon ta niya qnpahan ka mptosa.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

trv: Mposa ta siyaw yayong ka saya ho?
english: Are we going to the riverside today?

trv: Uxay, dson ta na lmiqo ka mptosa.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?

trv: Uxay wah! Mosa ta qnpahan ka saya.
english: No, we are going to the fields.

trv: Mptosa, mosa ta qmita mano ka ssiyaw yayong?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

trv: Mptosa, mosa qmita mano ka lmiqo?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.

trv: Mano ka ddaon ta mosa qnpahan?
english: What are we going to do in the fields?

trv: Mosa ta qnpahan qmita pnhoma ta lhngay, qdahang niqan oyah mi tdiyong wah!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

trv: Mptosa! Mosa ta tmapaq qsiya yayong?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?
No, we are going to see dragonflies.

trv: Mptosa! Mosa ta qnpahan phoma sama?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

trv: Mosa ta tnborah dxral ka saya.
english: We are going to loosen the soil today.

trv: Saya ka hana ko mita mnodos bay diyadan.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

trv: Ibah! Ibah! Snkoxol ko tlaway, malo bay qtan.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

trv: Uxay tlaway ka way, walo ka way.
english: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

trv: Eniq hini iya osa thiyaq balay nniqan wah!
english: Come here and take a look. Don't go too far!

trv: Iyaq, oxay nami mosa thiyaq balay nniqan.
english: Got it, we won't go anywhere too far.

trv: Iya oda tmalang, thoway mksa kiya ka ini oda skriboc.
english: Don't run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.

trv: Hmoya so mchaya mosa beywi hiya ka iso?
english: How do you go to the block-house?
How does he go to the hospital?

trv: Mnchoya so mosa Pngho ka iso?
english: How do you go to Penghu?

trv: Pnapa ko skoki ka mosa Pngho.
english: I go to Penghu by plane.

trv: Pnapa ko aso ka mosa Pngho.
english: I go to Penghu by boat.

trv: Tnapa so mano ka mosa sapah?
Tnapa ko cyeyyon ka mosa sapah.
Tnapa mano mosa sapah pyasan ka Tapas?
english: How does Tapas go to school?

trv: Tapa kisya mosa sapah pyasan ka Tapas.
english: Tapas goes to school by train.

trv: Tapa mano mosa pnrholan ka Sodo?
english: How does Basaw go to church?

trv: Mriq ddeyngsya mosa pnrholan ka Sodo.
english: Sudu goes to church by bicycle.

trv: Tapa so cyeyyon mosa sapah pyasan ka iso?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

trv: Uxay, tapa ko baso mosa sapah pyasan ka yako.
english: No, I go to school by bus.

trv: Mriq so ddeyngsya mosa sapah pyasan ka iso?
english: Do you go to school by bicycle?

trv: Iyaq, mriq ko ddeyngsya mosa sapah pyasan ka yako.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

trv: Tapa so kawtyey mosa Takaw ka iso?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

trv: Iyaq, tapa ko kawtyey mosa Takaw ka yako.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

trv: Mosa Tayto pa tapa so kisya ya skoki?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

trv: Tapa ko skoki, tapa skoki mi kisya o noqo ini biyaw ka tapa skoki.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

trv: Mosa so pnrholan pa tapa so baso ya mriq rolo?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

trv: Mriq ko rolo ka mosa pnrholan, mriq rolo mi tapa baso pa noqo mslxan ka mriq rolo.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

trv: Bbriyan cawso o msdalih sapah namo?
english: Is the market close to your house?

trv: Ini sdalih, mriq ko otobay mosa briyan Cawso.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

trv: Msdalih sapah pyasan ka sapah yobing?
english: Is the post office close to the school?

trv: Msdalih balay, mksa da o kiya ka mpdhoq da.
english: Yes, it is within walking distance.

trv: Msdalih ppanan rolo ka sanan mkan idaw?
english: Is the restaurant close to the station?

trv: Mlatac ppanan rolo da o mksa 5 pongkang daw kiya ka dhoq da.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

trv: Niqan ddaon mo oka ko sapah saya. Babaw da haw!
english: I am out today. How about another day?

trv: So kiya o niqan ka diyax so koson pa? Yahon miso mying koson da.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I'll visit you tomorrow afternoon.
Sure, I will wait for you at home.

trv: Malo ko phnang hnang so? Yoxon mo mbahang mi matas.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

trv: Ini ko so mndongos qtan, ini ndwani smtor ka soko ori, iya ta haw!
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn't been tidied up yet.

trv: So kiya daw psasing ko da malo da.
english: Then I will just take photos.

trv: Mhoway so balay! Srwanon so ka knan moda smiling sonan.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.

trv: Ini hoya, iyox so mpsiling mano?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

trv: Risaw so cida han pa mano ka qpahon so?
english: What do you do when you are young?

trv: Keysaco ko coxan han, binaw wada ko msangay qpahon niyi ka saya da.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.

trv: So kiya o wa so qmpah ka saya na?
english: Then, are you working at the moment?

trv: Wa ko qmpah sapah pyasan ka saya.
Wa mniq alang ka llaqi so ori?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

trv: Ini, wa mniq alang mkbrnox kana ka llaqi mo.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.

trv: So kiya daw morox so nanaq mniq sapah?
english: Then, do you live by yourself?

trv: Tmabo ko kingal holing mi kingal qdoda ori na, tnsapah mo ka dhiya ori.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

trv: Tmabo ko kingal ngiyaw nina, niqan tnbowan ka thiqan pa ini ksdamac.
english: I have a cat too. I won't get bored with the company of my pet.

trv: Iyox ko mpsiling sonan qori pnwaya omadok.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

trv: Ini knoo ka knkla mo, banaw klaon mo doma o cyokon miso kana.
english: I don't know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

trv: Qqiya ddiyon namo omadok pa niqan mano ka pnwaya namo?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

trv: Qqiya ddiyon nami omadok pa naqah tlngon qridin.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

trv: So kiya o malo msopo mosa omadok ka qridin?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

trv: Naqah! Naqah mosa omadok ka qridin.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

trv: Awi, ddiyoc pciyos damac ka sinaw micyo, oka sinaw micyo ka sapah da, osa mari sinew micyo.
english: Qabus, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

trv: Niqan 1 rosoq ka pchdanan nina, ana ini bari pa!
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

trv: Ini toko ka 1 rosoq, osa mari 2 rosoq dongan.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

trv: Mari ko sinaw micyo, niqan namo pbari?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

trv: Niqan hmi! Khno ka briyon so?
english: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

trv: Mari ko 2 rosoq, mari ko 1 loboy bowax ori.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

trv: Ni ka bowax, mano niya na ka briyon so dongan?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?

trv: Mari ko balong dongan, niqan namo pbari ori?
english: I want to buy eggs, do you sell them too?

trv: Wada qdowan mari ka balong nami da.

english: I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

trv: Mari ko boton ocox na lokos.
english: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

trv: Niqan ini pntna klowanan rakaw niya?
Niqan nami rakaw mbhoway mi rakaw mcays mi rakaw tmkarac na.
english: We have white and blue ones too.
Please give me the clothes in blue.

trv: Teymo, mnosa so ino ka soni? Mnosa so pskbiyax hiyi?
english: Teymu, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

trv: Uxay, mnosa ko dmayaw bobo rodan mo pbari sama.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

trv: So kiya hay! Niqan diyax so kman saya? Sopo ta mkan idaw haw?
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?
No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

trv: Sndamac so balay, khno pila ka sama niyi?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?
The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?
Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

trv: Biqi ko 2 bnkiyan sama mi 1 toting bonga.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

trv: Sodo, cnhongi ko madas ingpico da, malo so skbarox knan?
english: Sudu, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

trv: Uka ka nako ori, na Ayoc ka ingpico niyi.
english: I don't have one either. This is Ayuc's.

trv: Kbrxi mo tnayis han haw? Uxay mo biyaw sobway sonan dongan.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

trv: Mhoway so balay, dyawi ko rmngaw ka Ayoc ori.
english: Thank you and thank Ayuc for me.

trv: Miyah ko tbrinah moway 2 patas ni.
english: I want to return these two books.

trv: Iyaq, mano dongan ka sntangan so na?
english: No problem and what else do you need?
I would like to borrow these three books.

trv: Mhdo da. Iya chngi mk3 diyax daw yahi tbrinah moway dongan.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

trv: Ini so sbway knan ka ssoros nina.
english: You haven't returned me the eraser.

trv: Tna miso tbrnahon moway ciwa da.
Ma wada oka ka ssoros mo da.
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?

trv: Ya so wada kbrxan Trmi da.
english: Did you lend it to Trmi?

trv: Ini ko kla. Hayi mo smiling ka hiya.
english: I don't know. I will go and ask her.

trv: Kbrxi miso ka ssoros mo han.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

trv: Sawa, knbrxan so na Ukan ka pnlkosan so lokos jyanba niyi?
english: Sawa, did Ukan lend you this coat?

trv: Uxay, bnari ko na bobo mo ka niyi.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

trv: Mntna niso ka lokos jynba na Ukan.
english: Ukan's coat is the same as yours.

trv: Mqalox ka lokos jynba niya, ini pntna rakaw nami.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.
Kumu, did you borrow money from Pawan?

trv: Niqan, ida mo tbrnahon moway saya, wada ko cnhongi madas pila da.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?

trv: Tbrnahon mo moway koson ka hiya.
english: I will return to him tomorrow.

trv: Iyaq, dyaon miso rmngaw ka Pawan.
english: Okay, I will tell Pawan for you.

trv: Kasi ka dmowi dangal btonox qmraq ka qolic, tkorih o dmowi serak qmraq ka malo, so ka beyhing ccamac pa, kasi ka dmowi dorang ka malo, so kiya ka mndongos.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

trv: Kla bay so kiya, wada ko qnoqo da! Kiya ka ini mo bay dhqi qmraq.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that's why I cannot catch any of them.

trv: Tsani miso ssalo dangal mi serak mi dorang ndoray da.
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

trv: Malo wah! Laway bay knmalo kiya da! So kiya daw mpanganl ko ccamac nxan da.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

trv: Knbrawan bay ka spriq qnpahan da, sani mangal ka soki skowan qqiya, nta qnpahan.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let's go to the fields.

trv: Wa mniq siyaw brongoy, mosa so kcka skowan qqiya daw kiya ka qtaon so da.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

trv: Qdahang mangal, iya qloqah, mhongon balay ka soki.
english: Be careful and don't get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

trv: Wa mniq trahoc qhoni way ka dorang mo.
english: My trap is under that tree.

trv: Niyi hini ka pnskrayan mo, klaon mo wino ka dorang mo.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

trv: Niyi ka kobo qcorox, psaon nami siyaw yayong tnqcorox.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

trv: Uka nami kobo ka yami hiya, pngahi nami mangal qcorox ka yami.
english: We don't have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

trv: Uxay ko dnowi ngahi ka yako, tsani ko ndoray da haw?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

trv: Malo wah! Psopo ta mosa pngahi ndoray da.
english: Sure! Let's go fishing together next time.

trv: Tsanon miso smmalo kobo ndoray da.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

trv: Wa lmlo ka bhniq ngahi so da, ya wiso tdiyal qcorox da! Bbili nhari.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn't the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

trv: Kiya hari da, scoqi lmlo ka aso da. Mniq ko hini bnbil bhniq ngahi, osa hnali way dyawi ko mangal ka ami.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

trv: Sani bnbil yako hini ka qcorox. Dyaon miso bnbil.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

trv: Taway bay knmalo wah! Kari bay nngalan saya, htngay kana ka loboy qcorox da.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

trv: Sanay ta mosa nhari msopo psaso kana ta.
english: Let's go back immediately and share it with everyone.

trv: Iya ppolah da, Nhari tlong wakac.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

trv: Ini balay klayi, scoqi ko da!
Topiya diyax iyax sngayan ka saya?
Torima diyax iyax sngayan ka saya, msangay ka koson, psopo ta mosa ppolah pa!
english: It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!

trv: Kingyobi ka saya, msangay ka koson, psopo ta mosa ppolah pa!
english: It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!
Great! Let's go to the riverside.

trv: Piya diyax iyax sngayan ka koson?
english: What day will it be tomorrow?
What day will it be tomorrow?

trv: Totoro diyax iyax sngayan ka koson, nta ppolah boro ka babaw cka hidaw koson pa!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let's go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

trv: Diyax sngayan ka koson, tohoy ko bobo mo mosa pnrholan.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

trv: Knpbrih ko, mosa ko ngangoc han.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

trv: Pqori troma ka dqras mi hiyi so msangay.
Mptosa, mnarox nboyas mo, mosa ko san ngangoc.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

trv: Malo ko mosa trima bawa ho?
english: May I go wash my hands?

trv: Uxay biyaw msangay snlhayan da, osa kiya hari da.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

trv: Mptosa, mnarox bay ka tonox mo, mpsangay ko ka babaw cka hidaw han.
english: Teacher, I have a severe headache. I need to take a sick leave in the afternoon.
Okay, take care and go home.

trv: Mptosa, mpsangay ko ka tokingal diyax iyax sngayan, mmosa ko pqita ising.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

trv: Iyaq, ndwani qmlahang ka hiyi so.
Mnarox ka nboyas na, wa mniq san ngangoc ka hiya.
english: She has a stomachache. She's in the restroom.

trv: Mptosa, mnarox welo na ka Pawan, msangay ka diyax saya.
english: Teacher, Pawan has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

trv: Ma oka miyah ka Sawa saya?
Watan Nokan ka hangan mo, maxal kngkawas mo ka kawas ni.
english: My name is Watan Nukan, and I'm 10 years old.

trv: Laqi so minjoko ima ka iso?
english: What ethnic group are you from?

trv: Laqi ko Sediq minjoko ka yako.
Sediq tnposo kana ka tnsapah so ho?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

trv: Iyaq, Sediq blbalay kana ka tnsapah nami.
english: Yes, my whole family is Sediq.

trv: Uxay, Sediq minjoko ka tama mo, sediq Holo ka bobo mo.
english: No, my father is Sediq, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

trv: Laqi ko Watan Nokan ka yako.
Way ka tama so ho? Khno kngkawas na da?
english: Is that your father? How old is he?

trv: Uxay, rodan tnoalang nami ka hiya, mspac kmxalan kngkawas ka hiya da.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

trv: Piya kngkawas na ka qbsoran so snaw da?
Maxal mspac kngkawas na ka qbsoran mo snaw da.
Mabang balay kngkawas so ka qbsoran so snaw ho?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

trv: Mabang rima kngkawas mo ka hiya.
Kbkoy spatol seyntmider ko ka yako.
Bsiyaq ta ini tqita da, wada so mreykon da hay?
english: I haven't seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

trv: Kiya hmi, wada ko kbkoy mtorol sentmider da.
Ini, wa so toqo mita da.
Iyaq, mtorol kiro ko ka saya da.
Mosa ko nniqan qpahan mptosa ming mptosa.
english: I'm going to the office to see the teacher.
I'm going to the office to see the teacher.
He's going to throw away the trash.

trv: Wa san tmapaq qsiya ka hiya, mosa pnsong tmapaq qsiya ka hiya kiya hari da.
english: He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

trv: Wa ino ka Sawa? Moda pnsong tmalang ka hiya kiya hari.
english: Where is Sawa? She's going to compete in a running competition later.

trv: Wa mniq psliyanan ka hiya, sanon mo lmawa ka hiya.
english: She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.
Let's go to the playground together.

trv: Hayi ko mari oqon cka hidaw han, miyah ko ming iso kiya hari da.
english: I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.

trv: Psopo ta mosa kmodaw hndayo pa!
english: Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

trv: Usa ming sediq, mosa ko ming mptosa.
english: You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.

trv: Mosa pnsong cnbo boro toting ka Sodo saya ho?
english: Is Sudu competing in croquet today?

trv: Uka, mmosa pnsong storing ka hiya.
english: No, he's competing in high jump.

trv: Mosa so pnsong ka ondokay cida ho?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

trv: Kiya hmi, mosa ko pnsong tmalang.
Mano ka owda ta ondokay cida?
english: What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

trv: Pbari ta oqon ka ondokay ho?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

trv: Wada so mangal ici bang ka iso hay, mbiyax so balay!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!

trv: Wa sapah ka bobo rodan ho?
Wa sapah, wa mniq cka tqiyan mtaqi ka hiya.
english: Yes, she's sleeping in her room.

trv: Uka sapah, hana wada ngangoc ka hiya, kasi ka kman da o kiya ka miyah sapah.
english: No, she's not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

trv: Wa mniq sapah ka tama roda ho?
Wa mniq todha tkadan sapah ka hiya, osa baraw ming hiya pa.
english: He's upstairs. You can go up and find him.

trv: Ukan hay, bsiyaq so ini qtayi da, sndamac so balay, ya so malo ho?
english: It's Ukan. I haven't seen you in a while! How have you been?

trv: Malo ko balay wah! Miyah ko ming sonan pprngaw kari.
english: I'm doing great! I came to chat with you.

trv: Wa mniq pchdanan pciyos sama ka hiya, haon mo lmawa ka hiya.
english: He's in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

trv: Wada kado rodox qmraq rodox ka hiya da.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

trv: Uka sapah ka tama rodan namo, wa mniq qnpahan ka hiya, hay tmawa sapah ka hiya pa.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He's in the field. Wait for him to come back.

trv: Swayi tama, ni so da hay!
Bsiyaq ta ini tqita da, wada so mdakil da.
english: I haven't seen you in a while. You've grown taller.

trv: Mqaras ko balay qmita ko iso miyah tohoy.
english: It's so good to see you.

trv: Ni ka kalac sboway monan, pniqi kcka kolo hoda.
english: Here's a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

trv: Bsiyaq so balay ini awah da, plwanon mo ka dhiya msopo ta mkan idaw kana.
english: It's been a while. Let's have a meal together.

trv: Iya psramal ana mano da, mimah ko ocya da malo da, mniq ta cka dxral sapah pprngaw kari.
english: No need to bother. I'll just have tea. Let's sit in the living room and chat.

trv: Mhoway so balay snbliqan so, mmosa ko da.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

trv: Hana wada mhdo smipaq ka rodox ni, dsi iso thwani mkan.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

trv: Prngaw ko sonan storong ta babaw cka hidaw kason dhaw?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

trv: Prngaw ta storong sapah pyasan haw? Moda ta psoeyga.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

trv: Nta psliyanan alang dhno, mplokos ko lokos ta Sediq.
english: Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

trv: Malo balay qtan ka phpah snowil alang nami. Mphpah cida daw awah ming knan pa!
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

trv: Asi ka twaon dhoq srwasaw da, sqcoqi balay kiya da wah!
english: That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?
Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

trv: Ma so thdil mosa mniq alang ka iso?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

trv: Hmoya so ini eniq alang mkbrnox tmsa laqi moyas?
english: Why not teach in the city?

trv: Alaw lnglongon mo balay ka alang mo, smatang ko cmiyok onhoway alang ori.
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

trv: Mkla so balay tminon, ima ka tmnesa sonan?
english: You're very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

trv: Bobo rodan mo ka tmnesa knan, hiya ka mkla balay tminon alang nami.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.
How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

trv: Wowaya nami ka tminon, yoxon mo pltodon dongan ka wowaya.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

trv: Malo balay mahan ka sinaw maco ni.
Mkla so balay ka iso, bsiyaq balay ka smmalo sinaw maco ho?
english: You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

trv: Ini qbsiyaq balay, ya bay dha iyax sngayan da o malo da. Playon mhapoy ka dhqoy mi maco, malon tamol prmaxon dongal, kiya ka malo psaon liwas da.
english: No, it only takes about two weeks. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

trv: Niqan ocik mi qocon ka yako hini, pnhoma mo nanaq kana wah!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

trv: Briyon kana ka dha o khno pila?
Kana balay pa dha kbkoy mrimal pila.
Smkoxol ko lokos ni, piya pila?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

trv: Rima kbkoy pila ka lokos ni.
Mkray balay da, malo mhnok hari ho?
english: It's too expensive. Can't you lower the price a bit?

trv: Naqah, mhnok balay daw ini toko ka sntkowan mo da.
english: No, if I lower it further, I'll lose money.

trv: Iyaq wa! So kiya daw mari ko lokos mqalox way.
english: Alright then, I'll take a black piece of clothing.

trv: Mari ko yayo ni mi cbracan ni.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

trv: Kana balay o mposal kbkoy klaboy, smnalo mo bawa nanaq ka ni, qolong mosa malo bsiyaq ddiyon.
english: It's a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

trv: Pkla ko dangi mo miyah mari, ya malo mhnok hari dongan ho?
english: I'll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

trv: Iyaq wa! Dyaon miso skhnok mspac kmxalan paseynto.
english: Alright! I'll give you a 20% discount.

trv: Awah qmita wah! Niqan briyan kana ka lokos mi bonoh.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

trv: Kingal ka lokos pa toro kbkoy mrimal pila, toro lokos da o maxal kbkoy pila.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

trv: Mari ko kingal daw kiya da, brahaw so balay bqani ko borah.
english: I'll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

trv: Sndamac so balay, iyox ko mari hlama sokay mi siyang mqri.
english: Hello, I would like to buy red bean sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

trv: Wada qdowan mari da. Niqan ko emo sangas nina, mbari so ho?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

trv: Iyaq wah! Brahaw so balay, biqi ko kingal, miyah ko mari hlama sokay ka ndoray dongan.
english: Alright, please give me one. I'll come back next time to buy rice.

trv: Iyaq, dyaon miso lmabo loboy kapa, so ni o mrimal krtan pila.
english: Okay, I'll pack it in a bag for you. That'll be 50 dollars.

trv: Malo namo kana ho? Prading ta di.
sndamc namo,tgsaon mako kari Seediq so ppokon.
english: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say food in Sederik.
Do you understand what the teacher says?

trv: Ini mo klai mptgesa, rengo texan dongan ho?
english: I don't understand. Can you repeat it again?

trv: Ini ko qbahang, kparo hari rmengo ho?
english: I can't hear you, can you speak louder?

trv: Qita hini, snegon kenan smepo rmengo.
english: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

trv: Sepo mooyas texan, kparo heri hrenang.
english: Read it again. Please speak louder.

trv: Mptgesa, cmhongi ko madis ppatis da.
english: I forgot to bring my pen.

trv: Mptgesa, cmhongi ko madis sseros da.
english: I forgot to bring my eraser.
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

trv: Betaq hini snlhayan ta han, psterong ta bobo gdregan.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

trv: Laqi ko na Taso, Umin ko.
english: I am Taso's son, and my name is Umin.

trv: Tnogsaan ko na Watan, Siyac ko.
english: I am a student of Watan, my name is Siyac.

trv: Heya ge qbsoran mo, ngayan na Temo.
english: He's my brother, his name is Temu.

trv: Komo ka heya, swayi bobo mo.
Dangi mo ngayan na ge Seta.
english: She's a friend of mine, and her name is Seta.
