trv: Bitaq hini ka slhayan ta han,strong ta babaw sngayan dori.
english: Class dismissed, see you next week.

trv: Laqi ko Lbak ka yako, Yodaw ka hangan mo.
english: I am the son of Lbak, and my name is Yudaw.

trv: Laqi ko empatas Mowna ka yako, Ubos ka hangan mo.
english: I am a student in Mowna, my name is Ubus.

trv: Ima hangan na ka tama so?
Qbsoran mo snaw ka hiya, Awi ka hangan na.
english: He is my brother, his name is Awi.

trv: Kiya o, Pawan ka hangan na..
Ipay ka hiya. Koyoh qbsoran bobo mo.
Lopong mo ka hiya, Litok ka hangan na.
english: She is my friend and her name is Lituk.

trv: Piya hngkwasan so ka hngkawas sayang?
Piya hngkwasan na sayang ka hiya?
Maxal dha hngkwasan na ka hiya.
Piya hngkwasan na ka tama so?
Mrimal hngkwasan na ka tama mo.

english: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

trv: Dha ka qbsoran mo ni kingal ka swayi mo.
english: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

trv: Niqan qbsoran so snaw ka iso hog?
Ungat qbsoran mo snaw ka yako.
Niqan piya hiyi ka sapah so?
english: How many people are in your family?

trv: Niqan spat hiyi ka rowan sapah mo.
english: There are four of us in our family.

trv: Snaw swayi tama mo ka hiya.
Mano qpahon na ka snaw qbsoran bobo so?
english: What does your uncle do for a living?

trv: Niqan qpahon na ka qbsoran so koyoh hog?
english: Does your sister have a job?

trv: Gaga qmpah sapah spohan ka hiya.
Seejiq so Tmposo ka iso hog?
Kiya o, Seejiq ko Troko ka yako.
english: Yes, I'm from the Taroko tribe.

trv: Seejiq Tmposo ka bais so hog?
Iq o, kiya ni seejiq Sbnawan ka hiya.
Takar bi ka tama so hog?
Kiya, takar bi kana ka kingal rowan sapah nami.
english: Yes, we are all very tall.

trv: Gaga matas ka swayi so koyoh dhog?
english: Does your sister go to school?

trv: Mkla rmngaw kari Troko ka swayi so hog?
english: Do your siblings speak the language?

trv: Kiya o,mkla rmngaw kari Troko ka dhiya.
english: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

trv: Mseopo so mniq tama ni bobo so ka iso hog?
english: Do you live with your parents?

trv: Kiya, mseopo ko tama ni bobo mo.
english: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

trv: Mseopo so tghoy mniq baki ni payi so hog?
english: Do you live with your grandparents?

trv: Ini, ini ko mniq baki ni payi mo.
english: No, I didn't live with them.

trv: Mseopo so tghoy ima ka iso?
Mseopo ko tama, bobo ni qbsoran mo snaw.
english: I live with my father, mother and brother.

trv: Gaga alang Skangki ka sapah nami.
Gaga alang Skangki ka alang nami.
Mha so knowan ka alang so?
english: When are you going back to the tribe?
I will go back in the summer.

trv: Mnkala hidaw da, mtalox bi ka karat.
english: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

trv: Ini ktalox ni ini kskoy ka sayang, malo bi.
english: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

trv: Ungat rolong ka karat baraw, sriyo ka ppngrah da.
english: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

trv: Hana msowal, sriyo ka hidaw ni hakaw otox da.
english: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

trv: Mgmeeno karat ka gaga so nniqan hiya?

english: We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

trv: Mskoy bi ka karat,powsa lala lokos.
english: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

trv: Pqoyox paro kiya da, iya sngohi madas bobong.
english: It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

trv: Embrowa sayang bi, ida bi pqoyox ka kiya.
english: There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

trv: Mdka bi qmoyox da,mghoriq ka elog.
english: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

trv: Qmnoyox hog? ma mhoriq kana ka lokos so?
english: Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

trv: Qmoyox ka ngangot,ini ko adas bobong da.
english: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

trv: Paro bi ka bgihor, miyok tonox mo ni mnarox bi.
english: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

trv: Paro bi ka hidaw, thdagan ka tonox mo ni mtkwini da.
english: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

trv: Ini ko adas ka yako ori,lita marig.
english: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?
Well, I still have to buy erasers.

trv: Lita ta marig nhapoy mgrbog hog?
english: Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

trv: Aji ko, mnkan ko paah sapah da.
english: No, I've already eaten at home.
I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

trv: Seopo ta mkan hndayo mo da!
english: Then let's eat my lunch box together!

trv: Mkan so mano ka ska hidaw?
english: What are you having for lunch?
I want a nutritious school lunch.
What are you having for lunch?

trv: Mnadas ko hndayo ka sayang, seopo ta makan ska hidaw da.
english: I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Let's go play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.

trv: Iq, bgay mo sonan ka sksik nii.
english: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.
Can you help me with the cloth?

trv: Nii ko smsik, Plawa Lowking jiyagi ko mangal ksa.
english: I'm sweeping the floor, ask Lowking to get it for you.

trv: Mrociq bi ka dxgal, sai smros han.
english: The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

trv: Mrociq bi ka bling gaga, sai smros han.
english: That window is very dirty, go clean it.

trv: Yahan na, ini ko khdo smsik hini na.
english: Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.

trv: Emphoya so ka malax matas kiya?
english: What do you do after school?

trv: Mha ko mseopo meoyas lopong mo.
english: I'm going to sing with my friends.
She's at home, please come in.

trv: Ungat hini, niqan kari so hog?
english: She's not here, what can I do for you?

trv: Baki, yako Ribix wah, rwahi rhngon so hog?
english: Grandpa, I'm Ribix, please open the door.

trv: Ukan, yako o Iming, miyah ko miing sonan jita hmrapas da.
english: Ukan, I'm Iming, I've come to play with you.

trv: Kiya o, lmnglong ko bi sonan, iyah ta pprngaw da.
english: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let's chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

trv: Wa! tayal malo mahan ocia namo.
Kiya, soyang bi qtaan ka hiyi pnegalang dnii.
Malo oqon ka hiyi pnegalang hog?
Mnhdo mhapoy oqon gbiyan ka bobo da, iyah mkan nhari!
english: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I'll go wash my hands.

trv: Qoqo mkan, aji so seejiq isil ka iso.
english: Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you're not an outsider.

trv: Lala bi oqan mo da, mtngi ko bi da.
english: I ate a lot, I'm full.

trv: Mha ko da, tqita ta pxal dori.
english: I'm leaving, I'll see you next time.

trv: Keeman bi da, mha ko sapah da.
Iq, niqan jiyax so do o iyah tghoy sapah dori.
english: Okay, come to my house sometime.

trv: Embiyax namo kana, Madas ko monan sayang mha ta qmita alang rodan.
english: Hello everyone, today I'm taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

trv: Iq o, mha ta empprngaw drodan.
english: Yes! We have to speak Telugu to the seniors.

trv: Aji ta biyaw dhoq da hog?
Baki, miyah nami qmita sonan da.
english: Grandpa, we've come to see you.

trv: Ah! mkla namo rmngaw kari Troko o! Tayal knmalo ki da!
Embiyax namo kana, madas ko monan mha ta qmita hnmaan maso hiya.
english: Hello everyone, today my teacher is going to take you to the millet field.

trv: Iyah psbkog kana, iya shongi adas qnqaya namo.
english: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

trv: Iq o, mtgsa, madas nami qnqaya kana da.
english: Yes, sir, we've got our tools.
Not yet, it's still far away.

trv: Iq, yako ka emplaq qsiya na.
Usa mangal kraji liwaq qbhni ka iso.
english: You go get the bird catcher.

trv: Iq, yako ka mha lmiwaq qbhni.
english: Okay, I'll go and catch the birds.

trv: Embiyax namo kana, mha ta tbgan klgan mneoedos ka sayang.
english: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

trv: Tayal knmalo kida! emphoya ta msa mosa?
english: Awesome! How are we going to get there?

trv: Endowa psbkog kana, embarig ta paya da.
english: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

trv: Brah o klgan qbhni, bokoy o klgan qoyo,qita nanak.
english: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

trv: Mtgsa, meisog ko qoyo ka yako.
Ini hoya, asi osa qmita qbhni ka iso da.
english: It doesn't matter, then you go and watch the birds.

trv: Babaw kingal iyax toki do iyah ta pssli hini dori..
english: We'll be back in an hour.

trv: Qmita ko lala bi qoyo ni qbhni.
english: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

trv: Hbaraw bi seejiq ka nii tmapaq yayong hini.
english: There are a lot of people swimming here.

trv: Msqgoq bi ka qsiya gaga, tapaq ta yayong hini da kiya da.
english: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

trv: Pnapa so tdroy mano ka miyah?
english: What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?

trv: Seapa ko na tdroy tama mo.
Hnoya msa mosa ptasan kdjiyax ka hiya?
english: How does he usually go to school?

trv: Peapa mslikaw ppaan ka mosa ptasan.
english: He took the subway to school.

trv: Hnoya msa mosa marig pajiq ka payi so?
english: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

trv: Pneapa tdroy popok gakat mosa marig pajiq ka hiya.
english: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

trv: Hoya so msa mosa ka alang Ran-yig?
english: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

trv: Peapa ko aso ka mosa Ranyig.
english: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

trv: Hoya msa mosa Ran-yig ka hiya?
english: How did he get to Orchid Island?

trv: Pneapa aso skiya mosa Ranyig ka hiya.
english: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

trv: Peapa tdroy mano mosa Takaw ka hiya?
english: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

trv: Peapa tdroy qrngol mosa Takaw ka hiya.
english: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

trv: Pnapa tdroy qrngol mosa Tayto ka hiya hog?
english: Did he take a train to Taitung?

trv: Kiya,pnapa tdroy qrngol mosa Tayto ka hiya.
english: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

trv: Aji,Pnapa aso skiya mosa Tayto ka hiya.
english: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

trv: Niqan ppaan tdroy baho ka dalih hini hog?
english: Is there a bus stop near here?

trv: Niqan,slago so mksa do qtaon so ka pepaan tdroy baho da.
english: Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

trv: Sdalih bi ppaan elog tdroy mktroma dxgal o qori ino hog?
english: Where is the nearest MRT station?

trv: Ungat ppaan elog tdroy mktroma dxgal ka hini,asi so ka peapa tdroy qapi.
english: There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

trv: Khno qbsiyaqan pdhoq ptasan ka peapa ta tdroy baho hog?
english: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

trv: Maxal rima spngan toki ka pdhoq ptasan.
Khno qbsiyaqn pdhoq Tayciyo ka peapa ta tdroy qrngol hog?
english: How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

trv: Kingal iyax toki ka pdhoq Tayciyo.
english: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

trv: Mgriq tdroy mosa U-ray o bsiyaq hog?
english: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

trv: Khno qbsiyaqan peapa so elog tdroy mktroma dxgal ka miyah so sapah mo hog?
english: How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

trv: Mkla so peapa tdroy gakat hog?
english: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

trv: Mkla ko peapa tdroy gakat ka yako.
Niqan tdroy popok gakat so hog?
Niqan kingal tdroy popok gakat mo ka yako.
Niqan tdroy popok gakat so hog.
Ungat tdroy popok gakat mo ka yako.
Aji ko, aji lala ka gklaan mo ka yako.
english: Don't, I don't know much about it.

trv: Niqan jiyax so babaw kndaxan hog? Kmosa ko bi qmita sonan?
english: Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?

trv: Iq, mtaga ko sapah mo sonan.
english: Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

trv: Niqan jiyax so saman hog? kmpsiling ko qori endaan Troko sbiyaw.
english: Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legend of the Truku people.

trv: Mha ko daya ka saman, aji ko mniq sapah.
english: I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

trv: Qnbahangan mo o mkla so bi qori knkla rodan sbiyaw ka iso,kmpsiling ko bi sonan.
english: I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Amis, so I would like to ask you a few questions. *Please change [Amis] to your ethnic group.

trv: Aji lala ka klaan mo, kiya ka kiya ni qoqo ko msiyok wah.
english: I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

trv: Mtdowa ko moda mangakl sasaw otox hog? kika mha lxan bi klaan hici.
english: Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

trv: Piya hngkwasan so ka hkawas sayang?
Seejiq Bonon ka koyoh so hog?
english: Is your wife also a Bunun?

trv: Mnmano klgan kari klaan so rmngaw ka iso?
Mkla ko rmngaw kari Rokay ni kari Paywang ka yako.
Qrason mo balay mtdowa ko smiling sonan ka sayang,rngaw cici han,qori pndakar tmsamat ga?
english: It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

trv: Iq wa, embiyax ko siida o mosa ko tmsmat dgiyaq kdjiyax ka yako.
english: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

trv: Mhoway so bi, Tayal bi knmalo ka tnisa so sayang.
english: Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

trv: Ini bi qnoqo ka rnngaw mo, hnici snroan rodan sbiyaw.
english: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

trv: Bitaq hini ka snlingan mo sonan, mqaras ko balay ka pnseaso so kari.
english: That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

trv: Mowsa ko da, smolo ko qmbahang lala bi endaan so sbiyaw dori.
english: I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a cup.
Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a hat.

trv: Barig ko toto mahan, niqan sbrigan hog?
english: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?
No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.
I want to buy two bottles of oil.
We only have one bottle left.
How many pounds do you want to buy?

trv: Embarig so piya spngan hnjilan ka balong rodox?
english: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.
I want to buy two green onions.

trv: Msngari tro bkiyan ka hini, asi miso biqi kana.
english: There are three left, all for you!

trv: Dha kbkoy pila ka kingal loboy.
Spoon kana do emposal kingal bohog,emposal bohog do kiya da.
Mngari kmxalan rima bohog ka hini.
Embarig ko cicih dori, pdhqi ko kingal kbkoy bohog.
english: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

trv: Asi ko spgi rima kbkoy bohog da hog?
Tayal kngkrayan ka nii da, ghki ko cicih hog?
english: It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

trv: Ini tdowa, mhnok bi ka nii da.
english: No, this is already very cheap.

trv: Embarig ko kingal lboan emo nii.
english: I want this packet of cookies.

trv: Mtrol bohog ka emo nii, embarig so mano dori hog?
english: $30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

trv: Mtdowa ko kmsiyok pila so hog?
english: Can I borrow money from you?

trv: Tdowa o! piya ka ksiyokon so?
english: Yes! How much do you need?

trv: Smhongi ko madas pila da, mtdowa ko kmsiyok pila so hog?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

trv: Ini ko adas ka yako ori o!
english: I don't have any money either!

trv: Smhongi ko madas pila da.mtdowa ko kmsiyok pila so hog?
english: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

trv: Aji ko, ini sako biqi ka knsiyokan so pnlealay na.
english: No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

trv: Mtdowa ko kmsiyok lokos so hog?
Ksiyokon ta tdroy gakat so hog?
english: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

trv: Iq o, kiya ka kiya ni bqani ko saman dori.
english: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

trv: Qmoyox da,ini ko adas bobong, ksiyokon ta bobong so hog?
english: It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me one?

trv: Wana kingal bi ka bobong mo, pseopo ta bobong da!
english: I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

trv: Knsiyokan mo sonan ka patas nii, bgay mo sonan da.
english: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

trv: Kmqita so patas mano o tdowa so rmngaw knan.
english: You can tell me what else you want to read.
When do I have to pay you back?

trv: Ini hoya, niqan pila so siida do biqi ko da.
english: It doesn't matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

trv: Biqon so knowan ka pila mo da?
english: When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.

trv: Biqon so knowan ka patas mo?
english: When are you going to return my book?

trv: Aji miso wada biqan shiga dhog?
english: Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

trv: Knsiyokan so na Pawan ka ppatas nii hog?
english: Did Pawan lend you this pen?
Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

trv: Knsiyokan so na Lowking ka ppatas nii hog?
english: Did you borrow this pen from Lowking?

trv: Aji, bnrigan bobo mo ka nii.
english: No, this is what mom bought.

trv: Ungat ka cimo da, osa kmsiyok cicih cimo Soking han.
english: We are out of salt, let's borrow some from Suking.

trv: Sayi mlawa ka Yabong, bqani ko ka pila mo da ksa.
english: Go tell Yabung to give me my money back.

trv: Piya pila ka knsiyokan so na?
english: How much does she owe you?

trv: Mha ko hmaan pajiq hiya mhoma pajiq.
english: I'm going to plant vegetables in the garden.

trv: Lala bi ka spriq da, nii ko tmatak, emplaq ko qsiya ka sayang da.
english: There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

trv: Bqani knan ka sowki ni bkaroh hog?
english: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

trv: Gaga psaan kiyig qraq soso sodo hiya.
english: Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?

trv: Hana mo daan makox ka dxgal, mtokoy ko sayang da.
english: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

trv: Mtdowa ngalan ka phmaan so paji dhog?
english: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

trv: Mtdowa ngalan ka pajiq qorong hini da, ini tdowa ngalan ka spriq otox hiya na.
english: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

trv: Wa! Tayal lala ka knriyan so bonga.
english: Wow! You dug up so many gourds.
Will you help me with the barn?

trv: Nii nami powsa srahog empqraq nami qsorox.
english: We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

trv: Lala bi qnrapan qsorox ka ska rawa psaan qsorox.
english: The fish basket has been full of fish.

trv: Hoya so msa qmraq qsorox ka kdjiyax?
english: How do you usually catch fish?
I shoot fish with a spear.
Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

trv: Qmlobong ko tmsamat kjiyax, msowil ko dmooy poniq ni madas holing ka tmsamat.
english: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

trv: Dapil bowyak ka nii, kiya ni elog endan bowyak ka nii.
english: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

trv: Sai ta qmita nhari ka qlobong ta, mdka bi gaga tjiyal samat da.
english: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

trv: Mdka bi smknox knox ka holing da,Lita smnegol nhari.
english: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

trv: Qaya mano ka gaga so psaan hiya?
english: What is that thing you put there?

trv: Qlobong ka gaga, spqraq nami pada.
english: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

trv: Qrason ta balay ka howay otox rodan, lala bi nangal ta samat ka sayang.
english: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

trv: Kiya o, dson ta pseaso alang ka samat da.
english: Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

trv: Emptgsa ko monan qori kari troko mneodos.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Truku language today.

trv: Emptgsa ko monan qori kari troko hiyi pnegalang.
english: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Truku language today.

trv: Seopog qmita yamo thiyan so matas.
english: Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.

trv: Sangay ta da, qlahang ka mosa sapah!
english: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

trv: Iq wah! Mhoway so balay emptgsa.
Sangay ta da, swayay ta han.
english: The class is over, goodbye everyone.

trv: Embiyax namo kana, Hangan mo o Mowna.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Mowna.

trv: Embiyax namo kana, Hangan mo o Samaw.
english: Hello everyone, my name is Samaw.

trv: Mowna embiyax so, Yako o Watan.
Samaw embiyax so, Yako o Watan.
Yako o bobo ko Mowna, Tomon ko.
Yako o swayi ko Mowna, hangan mo o Robiq.
english: I am Mowna's sister. My name is Rubiq.

trv: Emptgsa mo ka hiya, Hiya o Moyang.
Hiya o qbsoran mo snaw, Yodaw hangan na.
Ima hangan na ka qbsoran so koyoh?
english: What is your elder sister's name?
My elder sister's name is Biyang.

trv: Ima hangan na ka swayi so koyoh?
english: What is your younger sister's name?
My younger sister's name is Ipay.

trv: Piya hngkwasan na ka qbsoran so snaw?
english: How old is your elder brother?

trv: Piya hngkwasan na ka swayi so snaw?
english: How old is your younger brother?

trv: Niqan ptasan ka alang namo hiya hog?
english: Do you have schools in your community?

trv: Gaga so matas alang hiya hog?
english: Do you study in your tribe's school?

trv: Kiya. matas nami hiya mdka nami kingal rowan sapah.
english: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

trv: Mano qpahon na ka bobo so?
Mano qpahon na ka tama so?
Hiya o swayi so snaw hog?
Aji, Hiya o lopong swayi mo.
english: No, he is my younger brother's friend.

trv: Hiya o qbsoran so koyoh hog?
Aji, Hiya o swayi mo koyoh.
english: No, she is my younger sister.

trv: Piya hmbragan hiyi ka sapah dha?
english: How many people in their family?

trv: Niqan rima hiyi ka rowan sapah dha.
english: There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

trv: Ungat ka swayi mo snaw, Niqan tro hiyi ka swayi mo koyoh.
english: I don't have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don't have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

trv: Kiya! Hiya o qbsoran mo snaw.
Seejiq namo tnposo ka yamo hog?
Kiya, Seejiq nami tnposo ka yami.
Hiya o seejiq troko ori hog?
Mskoy hari ka sayang, Qoqo mimah qsiya mtalox.
english: It's a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

trv: Mtalox ka karat sayang, Qoqo mimah qsiya.
english: It's a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

trv: Paro bi hidaw, iya pthidaw hiyi.
english: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

trv: Lala bi rolong, Ungat hidaw ka iyax mtqiri babaw dxgal.
english: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

trv: Ungat hidaw ka saman. lala bi rolong. paro bi bgihor.
english: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

trv: Mskoy ka karat siida. Plkosi lokos ka mlatat so.
english: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

trv: Mgmeeno ka karat jiyax sngayan siida?
english: How's the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

trv: Malo bi ka karat siida, Aji empqoyox.
english: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Yes, it will be rainy that day.

trv: Msowal da! sriyo ka hidaw da.
english: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

trv: Gaga qmoyox ka ngangot sayang hog?
Nii qmoyox da! Ini ko adas bobong.
english: It is raining and I don't have an umbrella with me.

trv: Ini qoyox da, babaw ska hidaw do empqoyox, mlatat so o adas bobong.
english: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

trv: Hkawas misan o empskoy balay hog?
english: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

trv: Kiya! Hkawas nii o mha mskoy balay, Plkosi lala hari lokos.
english: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

trv: Rbagan snii o mtalox balay hog?
english: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

trv: Kiya! rbagan o mha mtalox balay, qoqo mimah qsiya.
english: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

trv: Smkoxol ko bi srnabaw, meeoxol bi ka karat siida.
english: I like spring because the weather is warm.

trv: Ini ko skoxol krpohan, lala bi bgihor paro.
english: I don't like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.

trv: Kiya, Ksyoki ta ppatas so hog?
english: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

trv: Meekan so mano ka ska hidaw?
english: What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?

trv: Mnkan so mano ka mgrbo hog?
english: What did you have for breakfast?

trv: Mnkan so mano ka ska hidaw hog?
english: What did you have for lunch?

trv: Alay mosa ka iso, yahon miso miing kiya da.
english: You go first and I will catch up later.

trv: Aji ko, Sai ta mhaqol ka patas han.
english: No, we have to carry books first.

trv: Ini na, Nii ko sminaw prato.
english: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.
Why didn't you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.

trv: Gaga so hmoya ka soni hog?
english: What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

trv: Malax so ptasan do emphoya so dhog?
english: What are you going to do after school?

trv: Malax ptasan ka hiya o emphoya dhog?
english: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

trv: Ungat hini ka Apay. Yoko o Ipay. Mano kari so? Nasi miyah do rngangon moda.
english: Apay is not at home. I am Ipay. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

trv: Payi! Iyang ko ni Ipay wah! rwahi nami rhngon!
english: Grandma, we are Iyang and Ipay, please open the door for us.

trv: Yako o Boya, Miyah ko miing Utay.
english: I am Buya, I am here for Utay.
Grandma, I am here to see you.

trv: Bsiyaq so bi ini iyah da. Lnglongon miso balay.
english: You haven't been here for a long time. I missed you so much.
Api, I am here to play with you.

trv: Tmay sapah nhari. Tmaga ko bsiyaq da.
english: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

trv: Nhoma mo ka bonga nii, ekan binaw!
english: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

trv: Iyah! Nhoma mo nanak ka hiyi pnegalang nii. ekan binaw.
english: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

trv: Tayal knsibos ka hiyi qhoni nii.
Tloong! Nhoma mo nanak ka sqmo nii ini rosi sapoh!
english: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

trv: Wo! Tayal knsibos ka sqmo nii.
english: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

trv: Ini ko tdowa mkan mami. ekan ko sopaw do kida.
english: I can't eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.
Let me peel the fruit for you.

trv: Mhway so balay. shiya bi ka hiyi qhoni nii.
english: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.

trv: Qoqo mkan, Lala bi damat hnapoy mo.
english: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

trv: Wo! Shiya balay ni malo bi oqon.
english: Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

trv: Qoqo mkan, Lala bi ka hini na.
english: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I'll make myself at home then.

trv: Qoqo mkan, Lala bi ka hini na.
english: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

trv: Wada ko mkan lala bi da. Aji ko tdowa mkan da.
english: I ate a lot and couldn't eat any more.

trv: Madas yamo mowsa dgiyaq ka mtgsa.
english: I will take you to the mountains today.

trv: Rmngaw ka bobo lala bi labis ka dgiyaq.
english: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

trv: Madas yamo mowsa qmpahan ka mtgsa.
english: I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

trv: Dson ta na yayong ka mtgsa.
english: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

trv: Dson ta na dgiyaq ka mtgsa.
english: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.
Are we going to the riverside today?

trv: Aji, dson ta na dgiyaq ka mtgsa.
english: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?

trv: Aji, mowsa ta qmpahan ka sayang.
english: No, we are going to the fields.

trv: Mtgsa, mowsa ta qmita mano ka yayong?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

trv: Mtgsa, mowsa ta qmita mano ka dgiyaq?
english: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

trv: Mowsa ta qmpahan qmita hnmaan sqmo, qlahang niqan qbhni, walo o!
english: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

trv: Mtgsa mowsa ta tmapaq yayong hog?
english: Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?
No, we are going to see dragonflies.

trv: Mtgsa mowsa ta mhoma pajiq qmpahan?
english: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

trv: Hana ko qmita sayang ka balay bi meodos kjiyo.
english: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

trv: Wa! smkoxol ko bi klaway, soyang bi qtaan.
english: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

trv: Aji klaway ka gaga, walo ka gaga.
english: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

trv: Qita hini hay, iya osa dhiyaq balay o!
english: Come here and take a look. Don't go too far!

trv: Iq, aji nami mowsa dhiyaq bi!
english: Got it, we won't go anywhere too far.

trv: Iya ttalang, knhoway mksa aji so emptakor.
english: Don't run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?

trv: Mgriq ko tdroy qapi mosa biyi.
Hoya msa mosa spohan ka hiya?
english: How does he go to the hospital?

trv: Hoya so msa mosa Pong Hog?
english: How do you go to Penghu?

trv: Peapa ko aso skaya mosa Pong Hog.
english: I go to Penghu by plane.

trv: Peapa ko aso mosa Pong Hog.
english: I go to Penghu by boat.

trv: Peapa ko elog tdroy mktroma dxgal ka mosa sapah.
Peapa mano mosa ptasan ka Rabay?
english: How does Rabay go to school?

trv: Peapa tdroy qrngol mosa ptasan ka Rabay.
english: Rabay goes to school by train.

trv: Peapa mano mosa pnrholan ka Pisaw?
english: How does Pisaw go to church?

trv: Peapa tdroy gakat mosa pnrholan ka Pisaw.
english: Pisaw goes to church by bicycle.

trv: Peapa so elog tdroy mktroma dxgal mosa ptasan hog?
english: Do you go to school by MRT?

trv: Aji, peapa ko tdroy baho ka mosa ptasan.
english: No, I go to school by bus.

trv: Peapa so tdroy gakat ka mosa ptasan hog?
english: Do you go to school by bicycle?

trv: kiya, peapa ko tdroy gakat ka mosa ptasan.
english: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

trv: Peapa so tdroy qrngol pstlaway mosa Takaw hog?
english: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

trv: Kiya, peapa ko tdroy qrngol ka mosa Takaw.
english: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

trv: Peapa so tdroy qrngol aji ori o peapa so aso skaya ka mosa Taytong hog?
english: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

trv: Peapa ko aso skaya, yaasa mslikaw bi ka aso skaya.
english: I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

trv: Peapa so tdroy baho aji ori o mgriq so tdroy mosa pnrholan hog?
english: Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

trv: Mgriq ko tdroy ka mosa pnrholan, yaasa slikaw bi dhoq ka tdroy.
english: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

trv: Dalih sapah so ka sbrigan hog?
english: Is the market close to your house?

trv: Aji dalih, mgriq ko tdroy popok gakat ka mosa sbrigan.
english: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

trv: Dalih ptasan ka saan smko pila hog?
english: Is the post office close to the school?

trv: Dalih bi, mksa do dhoq da.
english: Yes, it is within walking distance.

trv: Dalih ppyaan tdroy ka oqan hog?
english: Is the restaurant close to the station?

trv: Mlatat so ppyaan tdroy mksa so rima spngan toki do dhoq da.
english: It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

trv: Niqan daon mo ka sayang. Pxal da wa.
english: I am out today. How about another day?

trv: Niqan jiyax so ka saman hog? babaw kndeaxan mowsa ko miing sonan.
english: Then, are you available tomorrow? I'll visit you tomorrow afternoon.
Sure, I will wait for you at home.

trv: Tdowa ko meangal kari mangal ka sonan hog? kmspatas mo.
english: Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

trv: Tdowa ka meangal sasaw mangal hog?
english: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

trv: Naqih ko qtaan, ini kragi ka rpon ori, aji ko hay.
english: No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn't been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.

trv: Mhoway so balay, srowa so psiling knan.
english: Thank you for accepting the interview.

trv: Ini hoya, mano ka kmslingon so?
english: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

trv: Embiyax so sbiyaw o mano ka qpahon so?
english: What do you do when you are young?

trv: Qpahon mo sbiyaw o knsat, sayang do wada ko msangay da.
english: I was a police officer but I am retired now.

trv: Niqan qpahon so ka sayang na?
english: Then, are you working at the moment?

trv: Niqan laqi so gaga mniq alang?
english: Do your kids live in the tribe too?

trv: Ungat, gaga mniq alang paro ka laqi mo.
english: No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

trv: Tmabog ko kingal holing ni kingal qbhni, dhiya o ida mdka kingal rowan sapah mo.
english: I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

trv: Tmabog ko kingal ngiyaw ori, niqan mneodos tgohoy o ini ta dongot.
english: I have a cat too. I won't get bored with the company of my pet.

trv: Mkmsmiling ko sonan qori gaya madok.
english: I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

trv: Aji lala ka klaon mo, nasi niqan ka klaon mo o ida ko smiyok sonan.
english: I don't know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

trv: Niqan mano ka gaya qngqaya madok hog?
english: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

trv: Qngqaya nami madok o ini tdowa tlngon koyoh.
english: Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

trv: Koyoh gaga o tdowa mseopo mosa madok hog?
english: Then, can women go hunting together?

trv: Ini tdowa, Ini tdowa mosa madok ka koyoh ori.
english: No, women cannot go hunting either.

trv: Pisaw, ongat sinaw payay da, osa marig sinaw payay.
english: Pisaw, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

trv: Aji niqan kingal longaw sinaw payay ka poyan, iya barig da.
english: There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

trv: Ini toko ka kingal longaw, osa marig dha longaw dori.
english: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

trv: Embarig ko sinaw payay, niqan sbrigan ka yamo hini?
english: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

trv: Embarig ko dha longaw ni kingal bowax dori.
english: I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

trv: Nii hini ka bowax, embarig so mano dori hog?
english: Here is the rice, what else do you need?
I want some eggs too, do you have some?

trv: Wada qdoon marig kana ka balong da.

english: I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?
I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

trv: Hoya msa ka lokos embanah nii?

english: We have white and blue ones too.
Please give me the clothes in blue.

trv: Pisaw mnsa so ino ka sayang da? mnsa so psbrax hiyi hog?
english: Pisaw, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

trv: Aji, mosa ko dmayaw marig pajiq payi mo.
english: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

trv: Kiya hog, niqan jiyax so ka keeman? sopo ta mkan nhapoy.
english: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

trv: Aji tdowa, mowsa ko marig lokos.
english: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

trv: Embiyax so, piya pila ka kingal pajiq nii?
english: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?
The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

trv: Mtrol pila ka kingal spngan hnjilan bonga.
english: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

trv: Biqi ko dha pajiq ni kingal spngan hnjilan bonga.
english: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

trv: Pisaw, smhongi ko madas ppatas da, tdowa sako ksiyokon hog?
english: Pisaw, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

trv: Ungat ka nako ori, nRabay ka nii.
english: I don't have one either. This is Rabay's.

trv: Ksyoki ta pnais bi, biqon miso nhari.
english: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

trv: Mhoway so bi, mhoway so bi ksa ka Rabay ori.
english: Thank you and thank Rabay for me.
I want to return these two books.

trv: Iq, mano ka ksyokon so dori hog?
english: No problem and what else do you need?

trv: Miyah ko kmsiyok tro patas dori.
english: I would like to borrow these three books.

trv: Kiya da. Tro jiyax do yahi moway da.
english: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

trv: Ini sako biqi ka sros na.
english: You haven't returned me the eraser.

trv: Ma ongat qtaan ka sros mo da.
english: Then, why is my eraser missing?

trv: Aji so wada ksiyokon Pisaw da?
english: Did you lend it to Pisaw?

trv: Ini ko kla, saon mo smiling ka hiya.
english: I don't know. I will go and ask her.

trv: Ksiyokon miso ka ssros mo han.
english: I will lend you my eraser first.

trv: Rabay, ksiyokan so na Pisaw ka lokos wagi nii hog?
english: Rabay, did Pisaw lend you this coat?

trv: Aji, bnrigan ko na bobo mo.
english: No, my mom bought it for me.

trv: Ma mdka likos wagi so ka lokos wagi Pisaw.
english: Pisaw's coat is the same as yours.

trv: Mqarox ka lokos wagi na, ini pndka ka lhang nami.
english: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

trv: Rabay, kmsiyok so pila Pisaw hog?
english: Rabay, did you borrow money from Pisaw?

trv: Niqan, robang mo biqon hyaan, smhongi ko madas pila da.
english: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.
Okay, I will tell Pisaw for you.

trv: Qolit o dangar ka tdowa qmrak, tkorih o dorang ka tdowa qmrak, kika balay.
english: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

trv: Kla saw kiya, mqnoqo ko da! kla kiya ida ko ini dhoq qmrak.
english: No wonder! I am mistaken and that's why I cannot catch any of them.

trv: Cisaon so hoya msa smalo ka dha wana nii?
english: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

trv: Kiya hog! Tayal knsoyang ki da! tdowa ko qmrak samat ka hici da.
english: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

trv: Bbaraw ka spriq qmpahan da. osa mangal sowki kawir, jita qmpahan.
english: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let's go to the fields.

trv: Gaga psaan ino ka sowki kawir?
Gaga siyaw rawa hiya, mosa so rpon do qtaon so da.
english: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

trv: Qlhangi mangal, iya ploqih. mhongol bi ka sowki kawir.
english: Be careful and don't get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

trv: Gaga troma qhoni ga ka wana mo.
english: My trap is under that tree.

trv: Niqan tmasi mo hini, kika mkal ko gaga ino ka wana mo.
english: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

trv: Srahog ka nii. psaon nami siyaw ayog qmrak qsorox.
english: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

trv: Yami hiya o ongat srahog, mdooy nami bhniq ngahi qmrak qsorox.
english: We don't have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

trv: Aji ko dnooy bhniq ngahi, tsai ko pxal da hog?
english: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

trv: Iq wa, sopo ta mosa pngahi qsorox pxal da.
english: Sure! Let's go fishing together next time.

trv: Csaon so srahog ka pxal da.
english: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

trv: Lmglog ka bhniq ngahi so da, ida bi niqan qsorox ka tjiyal da. brbil baraw nhari.
english: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn't the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

trv: Taga hay, lmglog bi ka aso da. brbil ko bhniq ngahi hini ka yako. jiyagi ko osa mangal kaji gaga hiya.
english: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

trv: Brbil yako hini ka qsorox. jiyagon niso brbil.
english: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

trv: Tayal knsoyang kida! lala bi ngalan ta sayang, thngyan kana ka rawa qsorox da.
english: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

trv: Jita sapah nhari ni pseasog ta kana.
english: Let's go back immediately and share it with everyone.

trv: Iya rawa dori ha, Usa tloong tleegan nhari hiya.
english: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

trv: Ini ta kla, qsoqi ko dhoq da!
Tgpiya jiyax iyax sngayan ka sayang hog?
Tgrima jiyax iyax sngayan ka sayang, jiyax sngayan ka saman, seopo ta mrawa ngangot kana ha!
english: It's Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let's go out and play together!
Great! Let's go to the riverside.

trv: Tgpiya jiyax iyax sngayan ka saman?
english: What day will it be tomorrow?

trv: Tgtro jiyax iyax sngayan ka saman, Jita hmrapas gorog ka babaw ska hidaw saman ha!
english: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let's go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

trv: Mgrbo saman o mmano ka qpahon so hog?
english: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

trv: Jiyax sngayan ka saman, mowsa ko Pnrholan tohoy bobo mo.
english: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

trv: Qntpbrih ko, mha ko ngangot han.
english: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

trv: Mtgsa, mnarox boyas mo, mha ko ngangot han.
english: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

trv: Aji biyaw malax matas da, osa kiya dori.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

trv: Mtgsa, mnarox tonox mo, sangay ko babaw kndaxan han.
english: It's almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

trv: Msangay ko bokoy tgkingal jiyax iyax sngayan, mha ko pqita empsapoh.
english: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

trv: Mnarox boyas na, ga ngangot ka hiya.
english: She has a stomachache. She's in the restroom.

trv: Mtgsa, mnarox glo na ka Rodaw, ga msangay ka sayang.
english: Teacher, Rudaw has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

trv: Ma ini iyah ka Iwal hog?
Brahaw miso rngaw edaan so nanak hog.
Rodaw Taro ka hangan mo, maxal hngkwasan mo ka sayang.
english: My name is Rudaw Taru, and I'm 10 years old.

trv: Laqi so tnposo seejiq tgima ka iso hog?
english: What ethnic group are you from?

trv: Tnposo seejiq kana ka kingal rowan sapah so hog?
english: Are all your family members indigenous?

trv: kiya o, Troko kana ka kingal rowan sapah nami.
english: Yes, my whole family is Truku.

trv: Aji, Troko ka tama mo, klmokan ka bobo mo.
english: No, my father is Truku, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

trv: Laqi ko Taro Ilay ka yako.
Aji, Alang bokong nami ka hiya, maspat kmxalan hngkwasan na da.
english: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

trv: Piya hngkwasan na ka qbsoran so snaw hog?
Maxal maspat hngkwasan ka qbsoran mo snaw da.
Lala bi pncingan na hngkwasan ka qbsoran so snaw hog?
english: Is your brother much older than you?

trv: Cbilaq nami rima hngkwasan ka yami.
Piya kmpraan hnigan hiyi so hog?
Snkokoh qmbragan hnigan kingal kbkoy mspatol ka yako.
Qbsiya bi ini strong da, maa yaa bbaraw hnigan so da?
english: I haven't seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

trv: Kiya, kingal kbkoy mtrol ka snkokoh qmpragan hnigan mo da.
Kiya, Spngan hnjilan nkana mtrol mo ka sayang da.
Mha ko qpahan rowan sapah miing mtgsa.
english: I'm going to the office to see the teacher.
He's going to throw away the trash.

trv: Gaga tmapaq tpaqan ka hiya, mha psdka tmapaq kiya ka hiya.
english: He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

trv: Gaga ino ka Iwal hog? Mha psdka tmalang kiya ka hiya.
english: Where is Iwal? She's going to compete in a running competition later.

trv: Gaga mniq paro pprngagan ska ptasan ka hiya, saon mo mlawa ka hiya.
english: She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.
Let's go to the playground together.

trv: Mosa ko marig oqon ska hidaw han, mha ko miing iso kiya.
english: I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.
Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

trv: Usa miing seejiq isil, mha ko miing mtgsa.
english: You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.

trv: Mha psdka gorog sbot ka sayang hog?
english: Is Rudaw competing in croquet today?

trv: Aji, mha psdka pstaril pkbbaraw ka hiya.
english: No, he's competing in high jump.

trv: Gdmhaw tmalang siida o mha so psdka baraw hog?
english: Will you compete in the sports day?

trv: Kiya o, mha ko psdka tmalang.
Tdowa ko mosa psdka gorog sbot.
Gdmhaw tmalang nami jiyax siida o mano ka qpahon hog?
english: What will we do in the sports day?

trv: Psdka nami embblbil gasil ka yami.
english: We will compete in tug of war.

trv: Msbarig ta oqon ka gdmhaw tmalang hog?
english: Will we sell food at the sports day?

trv: Mangal so tgkingal ngahan paro qrasan da o, tayal bi biyax!
english: Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!

trv: Nii hini, ga mtaqi tqiyan na ka hiya.
english: Yes, she's sleeping in her room.

trv: Ugat hini, hana wada ngangot ka hiya da, dhoq keeman ka miyah sapah.
english: No, she's not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

trv: Ga tgdha tntonan ka hiya, osa baraw miing hiya da.
english: He's upstairs. You can go up and find him.

trv: Kika Rodaw o, ini so qtai psiyaq da, embiyax so hog?
english: It's Rudaw. I haven't seen you in a while! How have you been?

trv: Embiyax bi! Meyah ko miing pprngaw sonan.
english: I'm doing great! I came to chat with you.

trv: Ga pcsiyos damat hpoyan ka hiya, saon mo mlawa.
english: He's in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

trv: Wada qmrak biyi rodox hi da.
english: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

trv: Ungat sapah hini ka baki namo, gaga qmpahan na, taga miyah sapah hiya ka yamo ha.
english: Your grandfather is not at home. He's in the field. Wait for him to come back.

trv: Miyah so da Swayi qbsoran tama!
Psiyaq ini qpita, mdakil so da.
english: I haven't seen you in a while. You've grown taller.
It's so good to see you.

trv: Bgay namo kalat nii, psaay ska kolo hoda.
english: Here's a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

trv: Maso psiyaq ini iyah, splawa mo kana miyah mkan nhapoy.
english: It's been a while. Let's have a meal together.

trv: Ana qo wa, imah ko ocia kida, iyah ta pprngaw rowan sapah.
english: No need to bother. I'll just have tea. Let's sit in the living room and chat.

trv: Mhoway so bi peekan knan, mha ko da.
english: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

trv: Hana qrtan ka rodox nii, dsi mosa qnhoway nanat mkan.
english: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

trv: Pprngaw ta babaw kndaxan saman hog?
english: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

trv: Pprngaw ta ptasan hog? meangal sasaw samaw ta.
english: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

trv: Jita pslian niqan da 'mha ko plokos lokos seejiq tnposo.
english: Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

trv: Alang nami ssnegil o soyang bi emphpah, tgai emphpah siida iyah miing knan.
english: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

trv: Ptaga bitaq srnabaw karat, qsoqi bi osoy da!
english: That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?

trv: Iyah jiyax Mgay Bari ka iso da.
english: Then come during our Thanksgiving Festival!

trv: Iq o! gdongos mo bi balay!
english: Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

trv: Ma so tbarah miyah kndsan alang dori?
english: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.
Why not teach in the city?

trv: Yaasa lmnglong ko alang mo, tai saw mha bbrinah alang ori
english: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

trv: Mkla so bi tminon, Ima ka cmisa sonan.
english: You're very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

trv: Payi mo, hiya ka mkla bi tminon alang nami.
english: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.
How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

trv: Tminon o kndsan nami, ptlotot ko kndsan.
english: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

trv: Tayal knmalo mahan ka sinaw maso nii.
Tayal so biyax! Mha tmnbaqo psnagon bsiyaq bi hog?
english: You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

trv: Ini o! Yaa bi kingal iyax sngayang da kida Sai psealo mhada ka dhqoy ni bowax gmimax odong, kika tdowa phtngay kska torol da.
english: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

trv: Niqan osik ni qosol ka nako. nhoma mo nanak kana o!
english: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

trv: Piya pila ka sbrigon dha nii hog?
Koxol mo ka lokos nii piya pila hog?
english: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

trv: Tayal bi kkray kida, tdowa mhnok hari hog?
english: It's too expensive. Can't you lower the price a bit?

trv: Aji tdowa, nasi mhnok do mha mlih pila mo da.
english: No, if I lower it further, I'll lose money.

trv: Iq wa! Asi ko barig kingal mqarox lokos.
english: Alright then, I'll take a black piece of clothing.

trv: Enanon mo ka pocing ni gokong nii.
english: I want this knife and this pot.

trv: Kana 0 emposal kbkoy pila, gbaga mo nanak pseosa ka nii, sbkla bi bsiyaq jjiyon.
english: It's a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

trv: Pgkla mo lopong miyah marig, tdowa mkhnok dori hog?
english: I'll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

trv: Iq wa! jiyagon miso tnegkmbkiya maspat pskaon.
english: Alright! I'll give you a 20% discount.

trv: Yahi qmita binaw ha! Niqan lokos qbobo ka sbrigon kana.
english: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

trv: Tro kbkoy mrimal pila ka kingal lokos, tro o maxal kbkoy pila.
english: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

trv: Barig ko kingal kida, biqi sako bgorah ha.
english: I'll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

trv: Embiyax so, mkmbarig ko botol ni moroq hiyi mqrig.
english: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

trv: Kdowan smbarig ka idaw da. Niqan ka sangas hlama mo na, barig so hog?
english: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

trv: Kiya hog! biqi ko kingal hog, maah ko marig pxal dori.
english: Alright, please give me one. I'll come back next time to buy rice.

trv: Dowa, jiyagon miso dooy loboy gmabol, saw kiya o mrimal pila.
english: Okay, I'll pack it in a bag for you. That'll be 50 dollars.

trv: Meniq ka pncbowan Tanah Tonox daka rodan ta mneniq Paran hii cbeyo we, Mosya zikeng" mesa ka Tanah Tonox ma
english: "Mkuni" mesa ka rudan ta ita Seediq Tgdaya."

trv: Nana ji ka dhoq ko sapah pyasan saya.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

trv: Smlohay moyas da, mtmay nniqan slhayan ka mptosa, rmngaw ka mdodol mpoyas " Totoy! Thmoko."
english: It's time for class, the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: "Stand up! Salute!"

trv: Smlohay nami moyas cida, tmsa smpo kari Sediq ka mptosa.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Seediq language of numbers.

trv: Smnol nami mptosa smpo mi, msopo nami moyas oyas spowan.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

trv: Oo bay snlhayan mo kari Sediq ka yako.
english: I have learned many Seediq languages.

trv: Mosa ko sapah pyasan kddiyax, slohay ko kari Sediq kddiyax, pqbhangon mo rmngaw kari Sediq ni ka bobo mo.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Seediq language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

trv: Maxal kngkwasan ka kngkawas mo da.
Niqan ko kingal qbsoran Kolas ka hangan na, maxal kingal kngkwasan ka hiya da.
english: I have a brother, his name is Kulas, he is 11 years old.

trv: Wa nami msopo moyas mntna kingal sapah pyasan ka yami.
english: We study in the same school.

trv: Smkoxol nami moyas oyas ka yami qbsoran mo snaw.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

trv: Smkoxol ko tmapaq qsiya ka yako, kiya o msangay cida, msopo nami mosa tmapaq qsiya ka kana tnsapah nami.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

trv: Smkoxol ko psdopong borah ka yako, kiya ka malo nami msopo moyas oyas mi tmapaq qsiya.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

trv: Wa mniq Toda ka sapah nami.
Niqan rima hiyi sediq ka knkana tnsapah nami.
english: There are five people in our family.

trv: Niqan toro mnswayi ka tnsapah nami.
english: There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

trv: Msopo nami mniq sapah ka tama, bobo, qbsoran snaw, qbsoran qridin mi yako.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

trv: Beyhing bay ka tama mo, keysaco ka tama mo.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

trv: Mliwang bay ka bobo mo, ising ka bobo mo.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

trv: Mniq sapah ka tama pa, mpprngaw nami kari sediq ka yami.
english: My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.

trv: Mosa nami alang msangay rbawan ka yami.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

trv: Mosa nami msopo qmraq crayox ka yami qbsoran mo.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

trv: Smkoxol ko bay tnsapah nami ka yako.
english: I like our family very much.

trv: Msopo ko bobo mo mosa mppolah ngangoc ka diyax saya.
english: I went out with my mother today.

trv: Mslingaw bay qtan diyan ka karac, ini kskoy mi ktilox, mtlto balay ka niyok bwihor.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

trv: Tlong nami babaw spriq dxral mkan nami emo, thdawan hidaw ka hiyi nami, moxol balay.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

trv: Babaw cka hidaw, asi knpriyox mbanah ka karac da.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

trv: Smiling ko bobo mo hmoya ho ma mbanah ka karac da.
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

trv: rmngaw kari ka bobo, ya bay miyah ka bwihor beyhing da.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

trv: Kman oka qtan rolong ka karac, pcriyo kana ka pngerah.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

trv: Mosa nami sapah ka yami ori da.
Mklelo mosa sapah cida, mqori ko pngerah dmoron sngtangan.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars

trv: Sngtangan mo o kani iyah ka paro bwihor, mkmosa ko ppolah ngangoc nina.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

trv: Wa mniq siyaw sapah nami ka sapah pyasan, mksa nami kddiyax mosa sapah pyasan, mmiyah sapah da o mksa nami ori.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

trv: Uxay kiya paro ka sapah pyasan nami, alaw ini khbaraw ka mpoyas, kiya o mkkla nami kana.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

trv: msangay ka lqlaqi han, mssli ondoba kana, msopo mppolah psboro mi mpprngaw.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

trv: Msopo mppolah yami ori ka mptosa, mntna balay kingal paro tnsapah ka sapah pyasan.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

trv: Smksik nami kddiyax ka yami, bliqan nami smksik ka sapah pyasan.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

trv: Doma o mosa smoros wawi bnlingan, oxay ori o mosa smksik doma.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

trv: Kana iyax mi moxi sapah pyasan pa, dan nami smksik kana, msaso mi mddayaw nami kana, mako lox ini krotiq kddiyax ka sapah pyasan.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

trv: Ciwa, nosa ko alang tqita tama rodan mo.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

trv: Bsiyaq nami ini pqqita da, lnglongon mo balay ka hiya.
english: We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

trv: Qmita knan ka tama rodan, kiya ka qdalan ko na sika, pmahon ko na ociya.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

trv: Ssibos balay oqan ka sika hnoma tama rodan, malo balay oqon.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

trv: Smkoxol ko ociya tama rodan ori, malo bay mahon.
english: I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

trv: Cka hidaw cida, msopo ko pchada oqon cka hidaw bobo rodan.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

trv: Oo balay pnchada na oqon cka hidaw ka bobo rodan, niqan qcorox, rodox, bawan mi pngocon ori.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

trv: Babaw mnkan nami cka hidaw daw, mosa nami kmtoy hnoma na sama da.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

trv: Mangal oo bay bonga, sari mi qocon sboway na knan ka bobo rodan, spadas ko na miyah sapah.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

trv: Smwayay ko dhiya da, rngawan mo mosa ko qmita dhiya ka ndoray dongan.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

trv: Diyax saya pa dsan nami na han mita ccamac ka mptosa, tbko nami rhngon hhan mari kipo.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

trv: Mtmay nami han mita ccamac daw, rmngaw ka mptosa, "Klowan qdoda ka brah, klowan qoyo ka bokoy, osa nanaq thoway sdmhaw qmita."
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

trv: Mico ko qmita qoyo ka yako, so kiya ini ko qita klowan qoyo.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

trv: Oo balay qdoda ka wada mo qtan, wa skaya babaw qhoni, qmnita nami tokong wa mtaqi bling qhoni ori.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

trv: Kcka han mita ccamac pa hay, niqan dapa ngocon, dapa dmay mi lklic, kndadax coxal o oxay mo bay qtan ka ccamac ni, mqras ko balay wada mo qtaon diyax saya da.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

trv: Oo balay pnsingan mo sasing saya, han mo pqita tama mi bobo mo.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

trv: Babaw niya daw, tohoy tama bobo msopo miyah.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

trv: Diyax sngayan ni pa, tohoy ko qbsoran qridin mosa nami Tayto qmita swayi snaw tama.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

trv: Kndadax nami Tayhoko tapa kisya mosa Tayto.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

trv: Dhoq Tayto da o, swayi snaw tama pa mriq rolo miyah smtrong yami.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

trv: Ppanan kisya dhoq sapah swayi snaw tama o ini sthiyaq balay, mriq rolo pa hay tnayis da o dhoq da.
english: The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

trv: Niqan beyhing bay tbowan ka dalih sapah swayi snaw tama, msopo nami mriq ddeyngsya mosa tbowan hiya.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

trv: Mniq nami tbowan hiya, han nami na ptabo miric mi tapa dapa dmayi ka swayi snaw tama.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

trv: Kman daw, msopo nami mosa alang mkbrnox han nami na pkan idaw.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

trv: Kari balay rolo ka alang mkbrnox, so kiya mriq nami otobay mosa hiya.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

trv: Smwayay nami cida, kla wada oyon ka otobay nami da, kiya o asi nami tapa baso miyah da.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

trv: Ni nami dhoq Tayhoko ka saya da, ya na wa sndalan ka otobay swayi snaw tama da ho?
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

trv: Claqi nami tiping cida, mneniq nami alang Toda han, prading ko mosa moyas sapah pyasan daw, mosa nami thdil Hori da, ana dhoq saya; ida mniq alang mkbrnox ka kndosan nami.
english: When we were young, our family lived in Toda. After I started school, we moved to Puli and have been living in the city ever since.

trv: Babaw mnosa ko moyas tobeyhing sapah pyasan daw, prading ko smlohay slhayan wowaya Sediq tnposo ka yako da, wada ko mkla oo balay kklowan waya Sediq tnposo Taiwan.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

trv: So kiya, sngayan rbawan kngkawas ni cida, mosa nami smiling rdrodan alang ka yami qbsoran mo snaw, iyox nami mkla wowaya Sediq ta nanaq.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

trv: Mspac kmxalan ka kngkawas rodan ni da, binaw qtan o mkkray balay ka hnyowan niya, so hari mrisaw na.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

trv: Slingan mo ka hiya, piya klowan kari ka klaon na rmngaw, mndongos balay ka rrngaw na kari Sediq Toda, ana kari Bonon, kari Hakka mi kari Tanah Tonox ori pa, klaon na rmngaw kana.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Toda, as well as Bunu, Hakka and Japanese.

trv: Smling ko hiya da o hana ko mkla, kla ori laqi cida ka hiya pa tna snelohay kari Tanah Tonox da, qridin na o Sediq Bonon, kiya mi mniq qpahon na o wada ppkla hbaraw Sediq Hakka, so kiya hay mkla rmngaw oo klowanan kari ka hiya.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunu, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

trv: Pprngaw nami cida, oo balay prngawan nami mqqori pkla waya tmcamac ka rodan ni.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

trv: Ana wada ini klayi hari mbahang doma ka kari niya, binaw wada nami dmowi qnawan ddilon psoeyga, malo mo ndwanon mbahang dongan.
english: Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

trv: Claqi ko cida, ini mo hari klayi ka wowaya mo nanaq, mako ko msiqa hari hyowan mo nanaq sediq tnposo.
english: When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

trv: Kndodol oo ka klaon mo da o, wada ko krinah qmita Sediq ka hnyowan mo nanaq pa, tnnanaq balay kiya, niqan ririh na pskoraw mo balay ori.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Sediq is unique and something to be proud of.

trv: Bbiyan saya mmiyah sapah swayi mo snaw.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

trv: Mosa nami sapah bbriyon mari rodox ka yami bobo rodan, hpoyo nami kman spkan swayi mo snaw.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

trv: Mnoda nami sapah bbriyan sama, mtna so balay hana snqitan kana ka sama.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

trv: Wada nami mari eyncay, lmbay mi ningjing da.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

trv: Rmngaw ka tawkey ssiyaw mbari hiyi pnwalang, "Chiya balay ka hiyi pnwalang kalac mi aring mo ni, briwi tikoh pa!"
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: "My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!"

trv: Bnari nami kalac mi aring ka yami.
Moda nami bbriyan hiyi wawa, rmngaw ka mbari, "Mano ka briyon so? Mtbnaw beyring mi msiyang ka rodox saya, kingal o toro kbkoy hbangan.
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, "What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD."

trv: Lmngelong ka bobo rodan o mkray balay da, smiling nami tawkey; ya malo mhnok hari briwan.
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

trv: Rmngaw ka mbari oo wada mo lihan da, oka brahan llihan da.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

trv: Lmawa ka tawkey siyaw, awah mari qcorox mo, paro mi mhnok briyan ka qcorox mo.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

trv: Hiti balay daw wada nami mari rodox mi qcorox da, mbrinah sapah pchada kingal handay damac.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

trv: Bsiyaq nami bay tmawa, mako balay mkong ka karac da.
english: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

trv: Miyah qnawan na rmngaw ka swayi mo snaw, mbarah ini psangay ka qnpringan heytay da, asi ka babaw iyax sngayan ka mbrinah miyah da.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

trv: Rmngaw ka bobo rodan wada pchada oo bay oqon, plwani kana ka dhiya awah msopo mkan pa!
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

trv: Plwani kana ka dadal mi dopong, miyah msopo tblayaq mkan mttoko bay pnchada oqon kman.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

trv: Niqan kingal tnhiqan mo, Temo ka hangan na, cmhongi bay madas qqiya na kdiyax ka hiya.
english: I have a classmate named Temu, he often forgets to bring things.

trv: Moyas slhayan cida, knbarox impico mi ssoros, oxay daw patas btason tnhiqan moyas ka hiya.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

trv: Mntxal, mdha, mtoro, kbrxan dha qqiya kddiyax.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

trv: Binaw niqan hari qnnaqah na, kiya bay knbarox qqiya daw ini iyah moway da.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

trv: Babaw niya ini dha koxi pkbarox qqiya da.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

trv: Niqan kingal diyax, msopo nami mosa rmiwaw kana nami.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

trv: Mklelo cida, mkmosa ngangoc ka Temo, binaw cmhongi madas crogamey ka hiya.
english: On the way, Temu wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

trv: Knbarox crogamey tnhiqan moyas ka hiya, binaw cmiyok rmngaw ka kana dha, ini nami adas ori wah.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

trv: Makolo saw msang lmingis rmngaw ka Temo, ma ana sa klaboy ssros solay, ini namo pkbarox kana!
english: Temu burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

trv: Rmngaw hiya ka tnhiqan moyas, alaw so ini balay adas nanaq, kiya mi knbarox so qqiya o, mlohay so ini brihi moway!
english: The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

trv: Mosa sapah pyasan ka so koson, tna mrbo balay dhoq sapah pyasan ka Temo da, Temo pa knbrxan na qqiya tnhiqan moyas o, skngalon na pbrinah moway dtnhiqan moyas kana.
english: The next day at school, Temu arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

trv: Rmngaw thiqan na matas ka Temo, srwayi ka qnnaqah mo. babaw niya, madas ko nanaq qqiya da, mhoway namo balay kana, pkbarox namo qqiya yako.
english: Temu apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

trv: Alang sediq hini, mkla bay tmcamac ka tama mo.
english: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

trv: Claqi ko cida, tama mo mi swayi snaw tama pa hay; mniq kman mosa ngangoc, madas poting mi poniq mosa tncamac.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

trv: Mncol mangal boyak mi mncol mangal rapic, kiya mi mncol mangal olaqan ori.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

trv: Mniq tmayan alang; dwanon dha maso sediq alang ka nangal dha ccamac.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

trv: Kntto ko rmngaw tama mo, mpsnol ko tama mosa mcbo camac lmiqo.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

trv: Rngawan ko na ka tama mo "Paro so daw, kiya dson miso mcbo mi posa wasil da."
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

trv: Mkla mosa dmorang ccmac lmiqo ka snaw alang, posa snalo na srak mi dmangar ori.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

trv: Mkla bay smalo dorang ka tama mo, rmngaw ka "tama, ddiyon qmraq tkorih ka ni, asi bay klaon kmoroy ta dapil camac ka ita, psaon toqar camac ka dorang.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

trv: Alaw iyox ko bay nhari smnol drodan mosa tncamac, kddiyax ko smlohay smalo dorang, ida kiya so balay bay ini biyaw qmraq ccamac ka smnalo mo dorang da.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practice making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

trv: Qmita ka tama mo da o rmngaw knan, hiti daw qolong ko mosa msediq balay mkla tncamac ka yako.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

trv: Paro ko mnhdo mdakil ka saya da, mapa ko nanaq bhniq mi bodi mo, smnol ko tama mo msopo mosa tncamac.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

trv: Dhoq alang cida, nangal dha camac o pson dha maso dsediq alang.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

trv: Rmngaw ka tama, qrason ta dmahor ka Utox Tmninon pndongos snbliqan, dhoq ta mangal oo bay ccamac, kiya mi dhoron ta ka otox rodan ori, msopo ta mqaras kana!
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

trv: Sqcoqi ko mosa sapah pyasan ka mrbo da.
english: I was late for school this morning.

trv: Mosa sapah pyasan cida pa, cmhongi ko madas kabang patas da.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

trv: Ini ko adas qqiya ana mano.
english: I didn't bring anything with me.

trv: Smlohay moyas cida, msopo nami qmita patas ka tnhiqan moyas.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

trv: Pnsong pnyasan cida, kbrxan ko na impico mi ssoros ka tnhiqan moyas.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

trv: Rmngaw knan ka mptosa, " Babaw da o knllo mtotoy caman, iya bay scoqi da! "
english: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

trv: Ukan ka hangan dangi mo, laqi ita Sediq ka hiya ori.
english: My good friend's name is Ukan, and he is also an Sediq child.

trv: Mnsopo nami moyas alang Toda ka yami.
english: We study together in the Toda tribe.

trv: Mbahang nami rdrodan snrno pnngalan kari kddiyax ka yami, mkla nami balay rmngaw kari Sediq kana ka yami.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Sediq proficiently.

trv: Reykon ko mi qthor ko bay ka yako, Ukan o llbo mi mliwang bay ori.
english: I am tall and overweight, while Ukan is short and thin.

trv: Mhrhaw balay ka Ukan, koxol dha balay kana ka hiya.
english: Ukan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

trv: Undokay sapah pyasan ka saya, moda dmodol oo balay pnsong ka sapah pyasan.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

trv: Niqan blbil wasil, mtor boro, tmalang, rmweri mi cnbo bodi.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

trv: Tmalang ko cida, mtakor ko da, msdara balay ka pongo qaqay mo.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

trv: Binaw mtotoy ko ka yako mi, mqori brah tmalang dongan.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

trv: Dhoq ko mnhdo tmalang cida da o mqaras balay kana ka sediq.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

trv: Ana ko ini angal ici bang, binaw mqaras ko balay, alaw wada ko mhdo pnsong da.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

trv: Yako mi tama mo pa mosa nami qmita swayi tama mo ka ciwa.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

trv: Mloqah ka qaqay swayi tama mo da.
Rmngaw yami ka hiya, mporoq kingal bling ka dnamox sapah na.
english: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

trv: Wiso smmalo dnamox sapah ka hiya cida pa, tboroq snpeyyah dnamox sapah da.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

trv: Madas hiyi dapa mi binro ka tama sobway na swayi tama.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

trv: Pprngaw nami kari mniq cka tqiyan ka swayi tama, snrno oo bay pnngalan kari ka hiya.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

trv: Smwayay ko brah cida, tndhon ko na ka swayi tama wada ko mdakil ka yako da, wada ko msediq balay ori da.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

trv: Rmngaw ko ka yako, "Tmawa malo ka qaqay swayi tama daw, awah tohoy sapah nami ndoray ori."
english: I said, When your foot gets better

trv: Mniq kngkawas mposal kbkoy mposal dha cida, seyho pa mnoda psli prngawan smatang malo wana spatas hangan sediq tnposo ka nibonso sediq tnposo.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

trv: Mnoda ko smiling pprngaw kari bsiyaq balay mbiyax meysa seyho nibonso o, "Morox posa hangan sediq" ka risaw alang Temo Nawi.
english: I interviewed Temu Nawi, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

trv: Wada ko mhdo prngaw hiya, mniq diyax sngayan ni mosa sapah na smiling kari hiya.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

trv: Mniq smiling kari cida, moda pkla knan poso pnyahan hangan na ka hiya, moda pkla knan tnsapah niya mi alang na ori.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

trv: Slingan mo ka hiya, hmoya ka kasi qolong balay knpriyox hangan Sediq, naqah ka waya smodal posa hangan pa?
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?

trv: Rmngaw knan ka hiya, alaw dmowi kari Telo o oka brahan mdongos bay pkla hangan na, doma sediq o lmawa hiya "Tey seynsey," wada so ni prana oo balay shlison ori.
english: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Tie Xian Sheng

trv: Rmngaw, "Spatas hangan sediq tnposo o kiya ka balay bay hangan nami. Hangan mo pa rmirih Sediq nami, tndadal nami mi hnyowan nami, so mosa hbaraw bay sediq tnposo o dhoq smdiyal hangan ta nanaq dongan."
english: Temu Nawi said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

trv: Tohoy ko bobo rodan mosa bbriyan pbari qqiya sbari ka ciwa, madas oo balay sama pnhoma na nanaq ka bobo rodan, smmalo oqon sediq tnposo ori mi spqita na kana sediq.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

trv: Koxol dha balay kana ka bbriyan bobo rodan, ocik qaong mi tmana o hbaraw balay sediq mari, miyah mkan pnchada na damac ka hbaraw sediq.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

trv: Hnpoyan na bonga mi pnhlama sokay pa malo balay oqon, niqan hnangoc mqri wawa boyak ori, knox na o hmoc bay hbaraw sediq mbari, miyah tbko mhiyo mari bbriyan nami kana ka sediq.
english: The sweet potato and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

trv: Pchada oqon cida ka bobo rodan o, mniq ko siyaw lmawa sediq mbari ka yako. Mniq ko siyaw tporaq balay lmawa, "Pnhoma nanaq kana ka sama, ini cyoqi noyako, nhari miyah mari wah!"
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

trv: Wada ini biyaw qdon pbari ka qqiya da, rmngaw ka bobo roda, "Alaw iso kana ka dnayaw."
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It's all thanks to your help.\""

trv: Owda ni pa, wada ko smlohay qori knkla pnwalang mi oqon sediq tnposo, kiya mi dhoq mkla moriq balay ka pbari bbriyan.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

trv: Qmita ko so ni skxlon balay bobo rodan ka oqon pnsltodan, pskoraw bay lhbon mo mi ana rabang sqrason mo balay.
english: Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.

trv: Mpito patis hido dehok ko sapah pyasan ali saya.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

trv: Prading mpooyas di, meyah remox sapah ttgsaan ka mptgesa, "Totoy! Tmhoko!" mesa ka mdodol miyan.
english: It's time for class, the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: "Stand up! Salute!"

trv: Paro ba kari nami mesa, "Sndamac so bale mptgesa."
Mooyas miyan de, tgsaan nami na kari ssepo ka mptgesa.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Seediq language of numbers.

trv: Smnegol nami mptgesa smepo ma, mooyas nami oyas sspegan.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

trv: Egow bale ka snlhayan mo kari miyan Seediq.
english: I have learned many Seediq languages.

trv: Mosa ko sapah pyasan klaali, smlohe ko kari nami Seediq klaali, saon mo pqbahang bobo mo.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Seediq language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

trv: Walis Pawan ka ngayan mo yako.
Pawan Dakis ka ngayan na tama mo.
english: My dad's name is Pawan Dakis.

trv: Robo Walis ka ngayan na bobo mo.
english: My mother's name is Robo Walis.

trv: Maxal ka knkawas mo saya di.
Niqan ko kingal qbsoran rseno ka yako, Takon ka ngayan na, maxal kingal ka knkawas na saya di.
english: I have a brother, his name is Takun, he is 11 years old.

trv: Ga miyan soopo mooyas kingal sapah pyasan.
