english: We study in the same school.

trv: Smkoxol nami mooyas oyas kana miyan ka qbsoran mo rseno.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

trv: Smkoxol ko lmangoy ka yako, mgdoro de mosa nami lmangoy kana ka tnsapah mo.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

trv: Smkoxol ko mgkela dangi bgorah ka yako, soopo miyan mosa mooyas oyas ma lmangoy.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

trv: Ga Mhebo ka sapah mo yako.
Rima hei kana ka tnsapah miyan.
english: There are five people in our family.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

trv: Ga ko soopo meniq tama mo, bobo mo, qbsoran mo rseno ma qbsoran mo mqedil.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

trv: Bbaro hnyegan na ka tama mo, kesaco ka heya.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

trv: Rqeling ka bobo mo, ga mgo-ising ka heya.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

trv: Rngagon nami na kari Seediq meniq sapah ka tama mo.
english: My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.

trv: Rbagan ka sngayan laqi mooyas de meyah ko alang klaali.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

trv: Soopo nami mosa qmerac qpaton yami ka qbsoran mo rsemo ma, qbsoran mo mqedil.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

trv: Koxol mo riyong ka seediq tnsapah mo.
english: I like our family very much.

trv: Maha nami theyaq ngangoc yami ka bobo mo ali saya.
english: I went out with my mother today.

trv: Mblawa ka karac diyan, ini ktilox ma ini ksekoy, tleeto ka bgihor.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

trv: Mekan nami ppoqon bobo dopi, so sapo ka ledax hido cmebo hei nami, mooxon bale.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

trv: Bbiyan de mgtanah ka karac di.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

trv: Smiling ko bobo mo, malox mgtanah ka karac.
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

trv: Mesa cmiyok ka bobo mo, "Yaani psbgihor paro."
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

trv: Uka plabo keeman ka karac baro, pkriyak ka pngerah di.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

trv: Maha nami sapah ka yami dori di.
Moda nami elow ssaan sapah, dronon mo pngerah ka sntangan mo.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars

trv: Naka ini eyah ka bgihor paro, mkmosa ko theyaq ngangoc dongan.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

trv: Ga ssiyo sapah mo ka sapah pyasan, mkkesa ko klaali mosa sapah pyasan ma meyah sapah.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

trv: Ini kparo ka sapah pyasan nami yami, ini keegow ka laqi mooyas, mgkela nami kana.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

trv: Mosa msseli caw-cang kana ka laqi mooyas, soopo mtheyaq boro ma, soopo mpprengo.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

trv: Msoopo theyaq yami ka dmptgesa dori, so hari kingal tnsapah paro ka sapah pyasan.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

trv: Smkesik miyan klaali ka yami, bleqon nami bale smkesik ka sapah ttgsaan.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

trv: Mosa smeros bais ka doma ma, mosa smkesi ceka dheran ka doma.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

trv: Ma, saon nami smkesi kana ssiyo sapah pyasan, mddayo mskingal lnglongan kana ma, oka rtrotiq ka sapah nami pyasan.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

trv: Ciga, mnosa ko qmita tama mo rodan.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

trv: Bsiyaq miyan ba ini pqqita di, lnglongon mo riyong ka heya.
english: We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

trv: Qmita ba yako ka tama mo rodan de, pqdalon ko na sikwa ma, pmahon ko na ocya.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

trv: Cheya bale poqon ka sikwa pnhmaan na tama mo rodan, bale ba malo riyong poqon.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

trv: Koxol mo bale ka ocya na tama mo rodan dori, malo ba mahon dori.
english: I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

trv: Ceka na ali de, soopo nami pore ido poqon ceka na ali ka yami bobo mo rodan.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

trv: Egow bale hnprayan na bobo mo rodam, niqan qcorox, hei rodox, tmorak ma waso bonga.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

trv: Mnekan nami ido ceka na ali de, mosa nami kmetoy sama qnalang.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

trv: Egow ba bnege na bonga, sari ma qocon ka bobo mo rodan, adis sapah keson ko na hiya.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

trv: Mnswaye ko dheya de, meeyah ko qmita yamo bobo na dongan keson mo hiya.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

trv: Deson miyan na tong-oyen ka mptgesa nami ali saya, mtbeko nami maroy kipo rhengon na.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

trv: Mremox nami tong-oyen de, mesa ka mptgesa, "Berah nii we qbheni so mllamo ma, bokoy na we qoyo so mllamo, sai naq rmigo."
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

trv: Miico ko qoyo ka yako, kika ini ko osa qmita.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

trv: Egow ba qbheni qtaan mo, ga skiya skiya bobo qhoni baro ma, ga mo qtaan ka tekong ga mtaqi beling qhoni dori.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

trv: Niqan dapa otox, dmai ma rkelic, oxe mo qntaan kana camac nii, qtaan mo saya de mqaras ko riyong.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

trv: Egow ba pnssingan mo, saon mo pqita tama bobo mo.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

trv: Mpsoopo ko tama bobo mo meyah bobo na.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

trv: Maha miyan qmita swai tama nami Tay-tong ka ali gdregan nii.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

trv: Taapa nami rolo poniq kndalax Taype mmaha Taytong.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

trv: Dehok nami Taytong de, mgeriq rolo meyah smterong yami ka swai tama nami.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

trv: Ini ptheya sapah na swai tama nami daka rlowan rolo.
english: The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

trv: Niqan kingal mocang paro ka siyo sapah na swai tama miyan, taapa nami didensya mosa mocang.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

trv: Dehok nami mocang de, deson nami na tmabo miric ma, taapa dmai ka sawi tama miyan.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

trv: Keeman de, soopo nami mosa mekan ido soci.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

trv: Soci we egow riyong rolo, kika taapa nami otobay mosa hiya.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

trv: Mmeeyah nami de, wada hiya ggoyan ka otobay nami di, oka naq brahan di ma, taapa nami baso meyah di.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

trv: Nii miyan dehok Taype ka saya di, ye na ga slayon ka otobay na sawi tama miyan de, ini nami kela dori.
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

trv: Slaqi ko han we mneniq ko alang Globan, mmaha ko mooyas sapah pyasan de, mosa ko meniq Taycong di, kika meniq ko naq Taycong hiya di.
english: When we were young, our family lived in Gluban. After I started school, we moved to Taichung and have been living in the city ever since.

trv: mooyas ko ta-se de, mnslohe ko kingl sslhayan keson gaya nSeediq, kika klaon mo mesa lmlamo bale ka gaya dSeediq Taywang nii.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

trv: so kiya de, gdregan laqi mooyas rbagan knii, maha miyan qmita ma smiling drodan alang, ano mkmlela nami gaya miyan naq Seediq.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

trv: mmsepac kmxalan ka knkawas na rodan mo sapah hii di, ani si so hari knriso ka qtaon dongan.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

trv: slingon mo mesa mkela so mrengo kari maano dongan ka heya, mkela riyong mrengo kari miyan Seediq ka heya ma, mkela mrengo kari Tayal, kari Plmokan ma, kari Tanah Tonox dori.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Seediq, as well as Tayal, Hokkien and Japanese.

trv: smniling ko heya de kika klaon mo di, kela naq smnlohe kari Tanah Tonox slaqi ka heya ma, weewa Tayal ka qedil na, meniq so qqpahon na dori we, ego klaon na Khilan dongan, kika ego klegan ka kari klaon na mrengo.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

trv: mpprengo nami ciida we, egow bale ka rnongagan na qori ppholing ma tmlenga ka rodan snlingan miyan.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

trv: ani miyan naq ini hari klai qmbahang we, wada nami hii saangal qnawan ddilon ka kari na ma, wada nami ro-ing dori, bleqon nami qmbhang bobo na dongan.
english: Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

trv: slaqi ko han we ini ko kela gaya nami naq Seediq, msiqa ko bale qnSeediq mo naq.
english: When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

trv: kndodol egow ka klaon mo di we, kika mkela ko mesa yami Seediq we ini ba pntena ma, qrason mo bale.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Seediq is unique and something to be proud of.

trv: mmaha alang keeman saya ka swai mo rseno.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

trv: maha nami mari rodox sapah bbrigan yami ka bobo mo, phangoc nami malo ppoqon damac ido bbiyan na swai mo rseno.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

trv: mnoda nami so bbrigan sama, egow sama hani nngalan ka bbrigan sama.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

trv: bnari ko encay, qmagas ma nizing.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

trv: ga rmengo ka mbaroy hei qhoni, "msibos ba poqon ka spoto mo ma aring mo mesa, brigi tikoh ho!" ga mesa.
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: "My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!"

trv: moda miyan so bbrigan siyang ma, mesa ka mbari siyan, "mbari namo maana we? mesa. Paro ma msiyang ka rodox saya, maha tero kbekoy ka kingal rodox." mesa.
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, "What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD."

trv: sgcoqi mkere brigon di mesa ka bobo mo roda, ye ini howa hridon tikoh kesi raw-pan mesa.
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

trv: ani si mhenok bnrigan di mesa ka raw-pan, oka hhridan di mesa.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

trv: mesa ka rawpan mgbari qcorox, "Agoh mari qcorox mo mesa, paro ma mhenok brigon" mesa.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

trv: mhiti na de bnari miyan rodox di ma, bnri nami ka qcorox dori di, asi mako kingal handay ka hnprayan nami dehok sapah.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

trv: bsiyaq nami bale mtara di, sreesa dori di.
english: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

trv: mgeriq qnawan sapah ka swai mo rseno, asi lox ini pgdregi ka sopi, asi ka ali gdregan bobo meeyah di.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

trv: nii egow riyong ka hnprayan di, plaani kana eyah mekan di kesa.
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

trv: splawa miyan ka dadal ma dangi miyan, agoh soopo mekan knkmalo ma egow damac ido bbiyan.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

trv: niqan kingl gnxalan mo keson Pawan, cmhongi madis qyqeya klaali.
english: I have a classmate named Pawan, he often forgets to bring things.

trv: mooyas miyan sapah ttgsaan ma, kmbarox ppatis, seros ma patis pptasan na gnxalan ka heya.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

trv: mntexal, mndaha, mntero, kbrexon daha qyqeya ka heya.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

trv: ani si naqah kbrexon qyqeya ka heya, ini prihi klaali.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

trv: mhiti de ini mkpkbarox heya ka kana daha di.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

trv: niqan kingal ali, mosa nami cyaw-yo kana nami.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

trv: mkmaha psngangoc ka Pawan mkkesa nami moda elow, ani si ga cmhongi madis we-song-co.
english: On the way, Pawan wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

trv: smiling pkbarox gnxalan na ma, ini nami adis dori mesa kana ka dheya.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

trv: asi lox lmingis snyexan na ka Pawan. Mseyang mesa, "Ma namo ini pkbarox wesongco yako kana namo!"
english: Pawan burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

trv: keson peeyah gnxalan na, ado so naq ini adis ka iso ma, kbrexon so qyqeya de, ini so pririh klaali.
english: The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

trv: ini beyo mosa sapah pyasan so koson ka Pawan nii, wada na prihon gnxalan na kana qyqeya knbrexan na di.
english: The next day at school, Pawan arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

trv: ini ba klai keson na dgnxalan na, maadis ko naq qyqeya bobo na di mesa, khwayon mako bale ka knbrexan namo qyqeya ka yako berah na mesa dori.
english: Pawan apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

trv: seediq ptcamac alang ka tama mo.
english: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

trv: slaqi ko, wada madis hlmadac ma halong ka tama mo daka swai na ma, wada lmiqo keeman.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

trv: lmedax de, ga madis nngalan daha meyah sapah.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

trv: boyak ncogin ma rapic ncogin, doma naq we niqan ka tkorih dori.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

trv: psogon miyan rhengon alang ka nngalan han ma, saaso nami seediq alang.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

trv: skribo ko tama mo klaali, maha ko smnegol tama mo lmiqo.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

trv: paro so de deson so mo deno mesa ka tama mo.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

trv: mkela paha tlenga ka rseno alang miyan dori, mkela paha dorang ma qapi btonox.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

trv: mkela riyong paha dorang ka tama mo, mesa tama mo, drangon tkorih ka nii mesa, asi ta ka bleqon qmita ka dapil na, psaon toqil na ka dodrang mesa hii.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

trv: pnteeyox mo mmaha smnegol tmlenga rodan alang, smlohe ko paha tlenga klaali, kika wada ko ini beyo mangal camac.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

trv: qmita yako ka tama mo ma, keson ko na, maha so mkela riyong mangal camac ka iso bobo na.
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

trv: riso ko saya di, mapa ko bodi mo ma raqic mo, smnegol ko tama mo mosa lmiqo.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

trv: dehok ko alang de, wada mo saaso seediq alang ka nngalan mo.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

trv: mesa ka tama mo, asi ta ka dmahor otox rodan ta, pngalon ta na ego ba ka camac.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

trv: Smrahoq ko mosa mooyas ka mgrebo.
english: I was late for school this morning.

trv: Cmhongi ko, madis loboy patis ka ciida.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
I didn't bring anything with me.

trv: Mooyas de, msoopo ko gnxalan qmita patis.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

trv: Psseong ciida, kbrexon kona ppatis ma seros ka gnxalan.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

trv: Msero yako ka mptgesa, "Bobo na grboi hari totoy, iya srahoq di!"
english: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

trv: Dangi mo ka Ukan, laqi Seediq ka heya dori.
english: My good friend's name is Ukan, and he is also an Seediq child.

trv: Gaga miyan msoopo mooyas alang Tongan.
english: We study together in the Tongan tribe.

trv: Msoopo miyan rodan mbahang rmengo kari ndaan klaali, mkela nami riyong rmengo kari Seediq.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Seediq proficiently.

trv: Reko ma qtehor ka hnyegan mo, llebo ma kore hnyegan na ka Ukan.
english: I am tall and overweight, while Ukan is short and thin.

trv: Mdromoc riyong ka Ukan, smkoxol nami heya ka yami.
english: Ukan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

trv: Gaga psseong pstarin saya ka sapah pyasan, psqaras lnlamo pssengan.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

trv: Psseong mllebil snoyok, metor cobo, tmalang, kmeeki ma cmebo bodi.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

trv: Tmalang ko ciida, mntakor ko ma sddara pongo mo dori.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

trv: Ani si, mtotoy ma tmalang ko dongan.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

trv: Dehok ko poting pssengan de mqaras kana ka seediq.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

trv: Ani naq, ini ko angal ngayan tgkingal ma mqaras ka lnlongan mo, ado wada ko dehok mhedo psseong.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

trv: Mnsoopo ko tama mosa qmita baki ka ciga.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

trv: Mloqah papak na ka baki di.
Rngagon nami na ka heya, gaga tbeling ka dnamox di.
english: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

trv: Smmalo dnamox ciida ka heya, mntoting peeyah bobo dnamox.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

trv: Saadis na hei dapa ma sbiki baki ka tama mo.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

trv: Msoopo miyan mpprengo sapah tqiyan ka baki, rmengo kana kari ndaan na.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

trv: Mmaha ko de mesa ka baki, nii ko reko ma mbtonox di.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

trv: Mesa ko "Malo papak so de, eyah theyaq sapah nami ka bobo dheno."
english: I said, When your foot gets better

trv: Pnrdingan knkawas mposan mposan daha, lmawa prngagon seho spatis ngayan Seediq ka patis pnyahan.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

trv: Smiling ko Umin Kolas bsiyaq mbeyax skadi seho spatis ngayan Seediq ka patis pnyahan.
english: I interviewed Umin Kulas, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

trv: Mpsterong nami ka ali gdregan nii, maha ko sapah na smiling heya.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

trv: Mpprengo nami ciida, pgklaon kona poso ngayan na, deson kona mgkela tnsapah na ma alang na dori.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

trv: Slingon mo, malox so ryoxon ka ngayan, naqah ngayan pntasan so cbeyo peni?
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?

trv: Keson kona, spooda matis kari Telo de oka dongos ka ngayan kiya, qnooqo lmawa ngayan mesa Riso U" ma phlison daha dori."
english: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Wu Xian Sheng

trv: Mesa ka Umin Kolas Spatis kari Seediq ngayan ta naq ka bbale. Ngayan mo ge ririh pngalan lowan Seediq
Mnsoopo ko bobo rodan mosa gnbaroy bbrigan ka ciga, madis ego sama pnhoma na ma sbege nami na snlmeyan ppoqon ta ita Seediq dori.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

trv: Smkoxol meyah bbrigan na bobo rodan ka seediq, meyah maroy ocik ma ciyak rodo, ego seediq meyah kncheya mekan hnprayan na dori.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

trv: Malo riyong poqon hnprayan na sama bale ma ido dheqoy ka heya, pnsrobo hmangac hei boyak ma mao, smkenox kncheya na ka seediq, kika meyah msseli mtbeko bbrigan hini.
english: The Lactucin and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

trv: Phpore ppoqon bobo rodan de, mosa ko smdamac seediq ka yako. Lmawa ko Pnhoma nami naq kana sama nii
Wada asi brigi kana nadis miyan di, mesa bobo rodan Ado iso ka mneyah dmayo.""
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It's all thanks to your help.\""

trv: Ooda nii ge, snlohe ko knklaan qqhoni ma ppoqon na Seediq, sllohe bbale oda gnbaroy dori.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

trv: Qmita ko snkoxol riyong ppoqon ncbeyo ka bobo rodan, malo bale ma sqaras mo ka ndaan na nii dori.
english: Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.

trv: jiyax sayang dhoq ko empito patas hidaw sapah pyasan ka yako.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

trv: Prajing slohay da, mtmay pyasan ka emptgsa, rmngaw ka qbsoran pyasan, "Hiyog! Thmoko!" msa.
english: It's time for class, the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: "Stand up! Salute!"

trv: Paro bi ka hnang nami rmngaw, "emptgsa embiyax so."
Smlohay nami siida, tmgsa mnan kari seejiq sppgan ka emptgsa.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the seejiq language of numbers.

trv: Sneegol nami emptgsa smpog, meoyas nami oyas sppgan.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

trv: Ego bi ka snlhayan mo kari seejiq.
english: I have learned many seejiq languages.

trv: Mosa ko sapah pyasan kdjiyax, smlohay ko kari seejiq kdjiyax, skari ko kari Seejiq qbhangon mo bobo.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the seejiq language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

trv: Maxal ka hngkwasan mo hngkawas nii.
Niqan ko Kingal qbsoran snaw, Koras ka hangan na, maxal kingal ka hngkwasan na hngkawas nii.
english: I have a brother, his name is kuras, he is 11 years old.

trv: Seopo nami meoyas patas kingal sapah pyasan ka yami.
english: We study in the same school.

trv: Smkoxol meoyas oyas ka yako ni qbsoran snaw.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

trv: Smkoxol ko tmapaq qsiya ka yako, msangay o seopo nami mosa tmapaq qsiya ka tnsapah.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

trv: Smkoxol ko pkkla bgorah dangi ka yako, tdowa nami seopo mosa meoyas oyas ni tmapaq qsiya.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

trv: Laqi ko Seejiq Balay ka yako.
Niqan rima hiyi ka tnsapah mo.
english: There are five people in our family.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

trv: Giso ko tohoy mniq tama, bobo, qbsoran snaw ni qbsoran qrijil.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

trv: Bowqax bi ka tama mo, key-sa-co ka tama mo.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

trv: Hlawax ka bobo mo, empsapoh ka bobo mo.
english: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

trv: Mniq sapah o skari kari Seejiq rmngaw mnan ka tama.
english: My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.

trv: Msangay rbagan o ida nami mosa alang.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

trv: Yako ni qbsoran o tohoy qmraq qpator.
english: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

trv: Koxol mo bi ka tnsapah mo.
english: I like our family very much.

trv: Tohoy ko bobo mo mosa rmigaw.
english: I went out with my mother today.

trv: Mgkarac bi ka karac baraw, ini kskoy ni ini ktalox ori, lto ka bgihor.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

trv: Tloong nami babaw sspriq mkan meyn-paw, smbo qbobor ka rdax hidaw, moxol balay.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

trv: Babaw ska hidaw do, maa embanah ka karac da.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

trv: Smiling ko bobo mo, ma embanah ka karac baraw hog?
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

trv: Yabi meiyah ka bgihor paro da, msa ka bobo.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

trv: Keeman ongac rolong ka karac baraw, smriyo ka ppngrah da.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

trv: Mniq ko kska elog seosa sapah, smolo ko ppngrah.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars

trv: Tay saw oxay meiyah ka bgihor paro, mkmosa ko bi rmigaw ngangoc na.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

trv: Gaga siyaw sapah nami ka sapah pyasan mo, mksa ko mosa sapah pyasan kdjiyax, mksa ko meiyah sapah ori.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

trv: Uxay ka paro ka sapah pyasan nami, ini khbaraw ka empeoyas patas mttkla nami kana.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

trv: Mssli tlaman kana ka lqlaqi, tohoy hmrapas boro, tohoy pprngaw kari.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

trv: Ida tohoy mnan mhrapas ori ka emptgsa, saw bi kingal tnsapah ka sapah pyasan.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

trv: Smsik nami kdjiyax ka yami, asi ka bliqon smsik ka pyasan nami.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

trv: Doma seejiq o mosa smros gagi bling, doma seejiq o mosa smsik dxgal.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

trv: Ssikon nami kana ka kkmohing sapah pyasan, mseasog ni mddayaw nami, ida bgorah bi kdjiyax ka sapah pyasan.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

trv: Shiga Mnosa ko alang qmita tama rodan.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

trv: Bsiyaq nami ini tqita da, lnglongon mo bi ka hiya.
english: We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

trv: Qmita bi knan ka tama rodan do, qlalon ko na sikwa, pmahon ko na ocya.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

trv: Shiya bi ka hnoma sikwa tama rodan, malo bi oqon.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

trv: Koxol mo bi ka ocya tama rodan ori, malo bi mahon ori.
english: I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

trv: Ska hidaw do yako ni bobo rodan o seopo nami hmapoy oqon ska hidaw.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

trv: Hnapoy ego bi oqon ska hidaw ka bobo rodan, niqan qsorox, niqan rodox, niqan baon, niqan ka pngosol ori.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

trv: Mnkan nami oqon ska hidaw do, mosa nami mabal sama smaan.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

trv: Mangal ego bi bonga, sari ni qosol sbgay na knan ka bobo rodan, pdson na knan mosa sapah.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

trv: Mswayay ko dhyaan ni rngagan mo, "yahon namo qmita babaw dori."
english: I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

trv: Jiyax sayang madas mnan mosa qlangan ssamac ka emptgsa, msbkog nami rhngon marig kipo.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

trv: Mtmay nami qnalang ssamac do, rmngaw ka emptgsa, "brah o dqdoda, bokoy o dqoyo, osa nanaq qmita."
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

trv: Ksogon mo bi ka qoyo, oxay ko mosa qmita qoyo ka yako.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

trv: Ego bi ka qdoda gaga skkaya babaw poso qhoni.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

trv: Rowan qnalang ssamac ga, niqan dapa wiwil mohing, dmai ni rklic, ini mo bi qtai na ka ssamac nii, mqaras ko balay qtaan mo sayang da.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

trv: Ego bi ka pnsingan mo sasing, saon mo pqita tama mo ni bobo mo.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

trv: Babaw do tohoy ko tama ni bobo miyah ko dori.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

trv: Jiyax sngayan nii ga, yako ni qbsoran qrijil mosa nami Taytong qmita swayi snaw tama.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

trv: Kndadax nami Taypey teapa rolo qrngol mosa Taytong.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

trv: Dhoq nami Taytong do pgriq rolo miyah smtrong mnan ka swayi snaw tama.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

trv: Sapah swayi snaw tama sdalih tgaan rolo, mgriq rolo o ini biyaw dhoq.
english: The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

trv: Kiyig sapah swayi snaw tama o niqan llabang bi qnalang tbogan, seopo nami teapa ddeynsya mosa tbogan.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

trv: Mniq nami rowan qnalang tbogan hini, madas mnan mosa tmabog miric ni teapa dmai ka swayi snaw tama.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

trv: Keeman do seopo nami mosa mkan nhapoy sapah oqan.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

trv: Ida ego bi rolo ka s-cyo, kiya ni teapa nami otobay mosa hiya.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

trv: Mmiyah nami sapah siida, wada goyon da otobay, kiya ni teapa nami baso meiyah sapah da.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

trv: Sayang do gaga nami dhoq Taypey da, ya wada slayon ka otobay swayi snaw tama dhog?
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

trv: Slaqi ko siida mniq nami Holi, meoyas patas do thjil Taycong da, bitaq sayang giso nami mniq alang paro na.
english: When we were young, our family lived in Puli. After I started school, we moved to Taichung and have been living in the city ever since.

trv: Meoyas ko pyasan paro do, mnegaaw ko kingal qori knkla kndosan seejiq tnposo slhayan, klaan saw seejiq tnposo Taywan ga niqan ego kleegan ka knkla kndosan.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

trv: Kiya ni, sngayan rbagan nii do, yako ni qbsoran snaw ga mosa nami alang smiling rodan, mkmkla qori kndosan mnan nanaq.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

trv: Kingal wada mspac kmxalan hngkwasan na rodan, ida mbiyax bi qtaan na.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

trv: Smiling ko hyaan, piya ka klaon so rmngaw kari hog? Ida mkla bi rmngaw kari Seejiq, mkla rmngaw kari Tayal, kari Tanah Tonox ori ka hiya.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Seejiq, as well as Atayal and Japanese.

trv: Kla kndadax slaqi siida, smnlohay kari Tanah Tonox, Tayal ka qrijil na, qpqhan na hiya o hbaraw bi ka klaan na seejiq Khilang, kiya ni ego bi ka klaan na rmngaw kari.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

trv: Smiling nami siida, smnro ego bi qori knklaan rdrodan sbiyaw ka rodan nii.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

trv: Ana nanaq ini lxani mkla qmbahang o, ida nami wada sro-ing rowan qnawal baga, tdowa saon qmbahang dori.
english: Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

trv: Slaqi ko siida, ini ko kla kndosan rodan sbiyaw, sqaon mo saw pneiyah ko seejiq tnposo ka yako.
english: When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

trv: Ego ka klaon do pqniqan nanaq lnglongan da, mqaras ko balay, yasa Seejiq ko Balay ka yako.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Seejiq is unique and something to be proud of.

trv: Meiyah sapah gbiyan kiya da swayi snaw.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

trv: Yako ni bobo rodan o mosa nami marig hiyi rodox brigan damac, sramal swayi snaw mhapoy oqon keeman.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

trv: Mnoda nami bbrigan sama, niqan ego bi klgan sama ka bbrigan sama hiya.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

trv: Bnarig nami eyncay, lmbay ni ningjing.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

trv: Rmngaw ka gaga mniq siyaw bbrigan hiyi qhoni embbarig, "Shiya bi oqon ka kalac mo ni qlopas mo, brigi cikoh hog!" msa.
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: "My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!"

trv: Moda nami bbrigan hiyi rodox siida, rmngaw ka embbarig, "Marig so mano hog? Paro ni msiyang ka hiyi rodox nii, kingal o tro kbkoy brigan." msa.
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, "What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD."

trv: Sihan mkray bi brigan bobo rodan, kiya ni smiling embbarig, "Ya tdowa mhnok hari brigan hog?"
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

trv: Kiya ka kiya ni embbarig o soqi mhnok da! msa rmngaw ka embbarig, oxay tdowa blihon da.
english: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

trv: Siyaw na embbarig o, "Agoh marig qsorox mo, paro ni mhnok brigan ka qsorox mo." msa.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

trv: Hici do bnarig nami hiyi rodox ni hiyi qsorox, mosa nami sapah do ego ka hnapoy nami damac.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

trv: Bsiyaq ka tnaga do, mkoong ka karac da.
english: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

trv: Miyah ka qnawal swayi snaw rmngaw, "ini tdowa msangay ka hey-tay, asi ka babaw jiyax sngayan do kika miyah ko da." msa.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

trv: Rmngaw ka bobo rodan, "Ego balay ka hnapoy damac, lwani kana ka dhiya, agoh mkan" ksa.
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

trv: Lwanon nami ka lopong ni dangi, agoh seopo mkan ego nhapoy keeman.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

trv: Niqan kingal ka tnhiyan mo moyas patas, Basaw ka hangan na, ida smhongi madas qyqaya kjiyax.
english: I have a classmate named Basaw, he often forgets to bring things.

trv: Smlohay siida, kmbarox ppatas, ssros oxay ori o klaboy spatas gnexalan ka hiya.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

trv: Enkingal, endha, entro, srwaon dha kmbarox qyqaya ka hiya.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

trv: Kiya ka kiya ni mlohay kmbarox do ini na bqani ka knbrxan na da.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

trv: Hici do ini nami srwai kmbarox qyqaya da.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

trv: Niqan kingal jiyax, seopo nami mosa mkksa ngangoc.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

trv: Mkksa ni mkmosa saan psngangoc ka Basaw, ida ini adas klaboy ssros ka hiya.
english: On the way, Basaw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

trv: Kiya ni kmbarox klaboy ssros gnexalan ka hiya, ida smiyok rmngaw hyaan ini ko adas ori msa.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

trv: Basaw o tbiyax mlingis da, msaang rmngaw ni, "Ma namo ini srowa kmbarox klaboy ssros knan kana!"
english: Basaw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

trv: Rmngaw hyaan ka gnexalan, yasa ini so nanaq adas ni kbrxon so o ini so bqani da!
english: The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

trv: Koson do, mgrbo bi miyah sapah pyasan ka Basaw, bqanan na gnexalan kana ka knbrxan na qyqaya.
english: The next day at school, Basaw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

trv: Msiqa ni rmngaw gnexalan na ka Basaw, kiya ni rmngaw, "peadas ko nanaq qyqaya babaw da, mhoway namo balay knbarox qyqaya knan."
english: Basaw aw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

trv: Slaqi ko siida, tama ni swayi snaw tama ga keeman do madas pocing ni poniq wada lmiqo.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

trv: Mrdax ka karac do madas nangal dha samac miyah da.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

trv: Mnsowil madas bowyak, mnsowil madas rapic, mnsowil niqan ka glaqong ori.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

trv: Qhdoon dha measog rhngon ngangoc han, kika seasog seejiq tnealang da.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

trv: Rngagon mo kjiyax ka tama, mkmosa ko snegol tama mosa tmsamac.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

trv: "Paro so do dson miso lmiqo da." msa ka tama.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

trv: Ida mdooy dorang qmraq ssamac ori ka dsnaw alang, mkla smalo dorang ni dangar ka dhiya.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

trv: Ida mkla bi smalo dorang ka tama mo, "Sqraq glaqong ka nii, bliqon nami kmoroy ka daping qaqay ssamac, bsaon elog daon ssamac ka dorang." msa ka tama.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

trv: Iyox bi knhari seopo drodan mosa tmsamac, kiya ni slohay ko smalo dorang kdjiyax, ini biyaw tdowan qmraq samac ka dorang mo da.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

trv: Qmita ka tama do rmngaw knan, "iso ka mosa mkla bi tmsamac hici da" msa.
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

trv: Sayang do paro ko da, meapa ko bhniq ni boji mo, sneegol ko tama mosa tmsamac.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

trv: Dhoq alang do seasog mo seejiq tnealang ka nangal mo ssamac.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

trv: "Ida gnealo otox rodan ka nii, seangal ta na ego bi ssamac." msa ka tama.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

trv: Msoqi ko mosa sapah pyasan ka mrbo da.
english: I was late for school this morning.

trv: Shongi ko madas loboy patas ka mosa sapah pyasan da.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
I didn't bring anything with me.

trv: Meoyas patas siida, mseopo nami qmita patas ka thiyan mo moyas patas.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

trv: Pnspongan siida, kbxan ko na ppatas ni ssros ka thiyan mo moyas patas.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

trv: Rngagan ko na ka emptgsa, "nhari totoy ka babaw na da, iya hari msoqi da!"
english: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

trv: Dangi mo ka Tosan, laqi seejiq balay ka hiya ori.
english: My good friend's name is Tusan, and he is also an Seejiq child.

trv: Mseopo nami moyas patas alang Troko.
english: We study together in the Truku tribe.

trv: Qbahang nami snroan kari ka rodan sbiyaw kdjiyax, mkla nami balay rmngaw kari seejiq balay.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the seejiq proficiently.

trv: Bowqax ni qthor ka yako, llbo ni mliwang ka Tosan.
english: I am tall and overweight, while Tusan is short and thin.

trv: Niqan bi bbiyax ka Tosan, smkoxol hiya kana ka seejiq.
english: Tusan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

trv: Yon-tong-kay sapah pyasan ka sayang, mowda ego bi pspong ka sapah pyasan.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

trv: NIqan brbil wasil, boro qqahan, tmalang, rmgrig ni smbo boji.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

trv: Tmalang ko siida o, mtakor ko da msdara ego bi ka pongo qaqay mo.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

trv: Ida ko totoy, tmalang ko mosa brah dori.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

trv: Dhoq ko siida mqaras bi kana ka dhiya.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

trv: Ana ko ini angal kaci, ida ko mqaras bi, yasa wada ko mnhdo pspong da.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

trv: Shiga, Mnosa nami qmita swayi snaw Tama mo ka dha nami Tama mo.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

trv: Gaga mangal loqih ka qaqay swayi snaw Tama mo.
Rmngaw yami ka hiya, gaga mbling ka babaw dnamox.
english: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

trv: Smalo dnamox siida ka hiya o, dboroq knnadax dnamox da.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

trv: Madas wawa dapa ni pinglang ka Tama mo, bqana na swayi na snaw.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

trv: Pprngaw nami tqiyan ka dha nami swayi snaw Tama mo, egobi ka snloan kari niya.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

trv: Mmosa ko siida, rngagan ko na maso wada mdakil bi hnigan ni mseejiq bi ka swayi snaw Tama mo.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

trv: Smiyok ko rnngaw, "tay malo ka qaqay so da o, iyax bi mseopo tohoy sapah."
english: I said, When your foot gets better

trv: Hngkawas emposal kbkoy emposal dha siida, mneoda pprngaw ka klwaan tdowa borox powsa hangan kari ta nanaq ka patas hnyigan Seejiq Tnposo.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

trv: Smniling ko risaw alang Walis Howac, hiya o bsiyaq balay mqori klwaan embiyax meysa patas hnyigan " borox powsa hangan kari ta nanaq.
english: I interviewed Walis Huwac, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

trv: Mnhdo nami pprngaw, jiyax sngayan nii mosa sapah na smiling hyaan.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

trv: Saw mniq sniling siida, pgkla knan pnyahan hangan na, dson ko na pgkla kingal rowan sapah na ni alang na ori.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

trv: Smiling ko hyaan, hmoya ma so ida mkray lnglongan priyox hangan, oda powsa patas seoxal o naqih kiya hog?
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?

trv: Rmngaw ka Walis Howac, "Hangan bnatas kari Seejiq Tnposo o kika balay bi hangan ta. Hangan mo o ririh saw pgkla klgan seejiq ta, tnsapah ta, hnyigan ta, tay saw emphbaraw balay ka seejiq dhoq hmlay hangan dha nanaq."
english: Walis Huwac said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

trv: Shiga o mosa sbrigan smbarig ka yako ni bobo rodan, madas ego bi ssama nhoma na nanaq ka bobo rodan, smmalo ooqon Seejiq Tnposo ori biqan na ana ima.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

trv: Smkoxol bi sbrigan bobo rodan ka kana seejiq, hbaraw bi seejiq marig osik ni bonga, hbaraw bi seejiq miyah mkan nhapoy hnpoyan na.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and sweet potato, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

trv: Lmala ni hlama dhqoy hnpoyan na o malo balay oqan, niqan modoh hiyi bowyak ori, hmgoc hbaraw lopong mniyah ka knox na, miyah tqnay sbrigan nami kana.
english: The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

trv: Mhapoy siida ka bobo rodan, mniq ko siyaw kmeagoh lopong ka yako, mjiras ko mlawa siyaw, "Hmaan nanaq kana ka ssama, ini rosi sapoh, iyah marig nhari wah!"
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

trv: Ini biyaw qdoon smbarig kana ka qyqaya nami da, "Noxay bi jiyagan so" msa ka bobo rodan.
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It's all thanks to your help.\""

trv: Eoda nii, wada ko smlohay pnegloban qori knkla pnhmaan ni oqon Seejiq Tnposo, dori ni mkrbok moda smbarig.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

trv: Qmita ko bobo rodan smkoxol bi ooqon Seejiq Tnposo smparo ni mqaras bi lnglongan mo.
english: Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.

trv: Empito toki ka mosa ko ptasan sayang.
english: I arrived at school at seven today.

trv: prajing ta matas do, mtmay rowan ptasan ka mtgsa,rmngaw ka mdodol, "Hiyog! Thmoko!"
english: It's time for class, the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: "Stand up! Salute!"

trv: Paro hnang nami rmngaw, "mtgsa, embiyax so hog."
Matas siida o, tmgsa mnan sspog kari Troko ka mtgsa.
english: In class, the teacher taught us the Truku language of numbers.

trv: Smnegol nami mtgsa smpog, moyas nami oyas sspog.
english: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

trv: Smlohay ko lala bi ka kari ta Troko.
english: I have learned many Truku languages.

trv: Mosa ko matas kdjiyax, smlohay ko kari ta Troko kdjiyax, rrngaw mo ni pqbhangon mo bobo.
english: I go to school every day, I learn the Truku language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

trv: Maxal hngkwasan ka hngkawas mo sayang.
Niqan kingal qbsoran mo snaw, hangan na o Yodaw, maxal kingal hngkwasan ka hngkawas na sayang.
english: I have a brother, his name is Yudaw, he is 11 years old.

trv: Seopo nami matas kingal tgbilaq ptasan.
english: We study in the same school.

trv: Smkoxol moyas ka dha nami qbsoran mo snaw.
english: Both my brother and I like to sing.

trv: Smkoxol ko tmapaq qsiya yayong, msangay siida o, mseopo nami mosa tmapaq qsiya yayong ka kana rowan sapah mo.
english: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

trv: Smkoxol ko mklaan bgorah lopong, saw kiya o, mtdowa nami mseopo moyas ni tmapaq qsiya yayong.
english: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

trv: Laqi ko seejiq Troko ka yako, ga mniq Bsngan ka sapah nami.
english: I am an Truku child.Our family lives in Bsngan.

trv: Rima hiyi ka rowan sapah mo.
english: There are five people in our family.

trv: Niqan tro mnswayi ka sapah nami.
english: There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

trv: Niqan tama, bobo, qbsoran mo snaw ni qbsoran mo koyoh.
english: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

trv: Ttakar bi ka tama mo, knsat qpahon na ka tama mo.
english: My father is tall and he is a policeman.

trv: Hlawax bi ka bobo mo, msapoh qpahon na ka bobo mo.
english: My mother is thin and she is a doctor.

trv: Tghoy mnan mniq sapah rmngaw kari bobo ka tama mo.
english: My father speaks the Truku language with us at home.

trv: Mseopo nami mosa alang ka msangay rbagan.
english: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

trv: Tghoy ko mnswayi mo mseopo nami qrak qpator.
english: My brother and sister and I will catch frogs together.

trv: Smkoxol ko kingal rowan sapah mo.
english: I like our family very much.

trv: Mosa hmrapas ka bobo mo ni yako sayang.
english: I went out with my mother today.

trv: Mgqliyang bi ka karat jiyan, ini ktalox ni ini mskoy ka karat, mtleeto bi ka bgihor.
english: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

trv: Meekan nami bawa mniq babaw spriq, sbo mniq qbobor mo ka hidaw ni moxol balay.
english: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

trv: Babaw kdaaxan da, ppriyox ka karat da.
english: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

trv: Smiling ko bobo mo, hmoya embanah ka karat hog.
english: I asked my mother why the sky is red.

trv: Rmngaw ka bobo mo, ida bi biyaw miyah ka bgihor paro da.
english: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

trv: Nasi ongat rolong ka keeman do, sriyo ka ppngrah da.
english: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

trv: Mosa elog sapah siida o, smolo ko tghoy ppngrah.
english: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars

trv: Smolo iya iyah ka bgihor paro, lmnglong ko mlatat mosa hmrapas.
english: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

trv: Kiyig bi sapah nami ka ptasan mo, mksa ko mosa ptasan kdjiyax, mksa ko miyah sapah ori.
english: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

trv: Aji paro ka ptasan mo, aji hbaraw ka laqi matas, pmkkla nami kana.
english: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

trv: Mseopo nami mssli ngangot ptasan, mseopo nami mrrawa qorog, mseopo nami empprngaw.
english: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

trv: Mdka sapah paro ka ptasan, smksik nami kdjiyax, smksik nami mtbhgay ka rowan ptasan.
english: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

trv: Smksik nami kdjiyax, smksik nami mtbhgay ka rowan ptasan.
english: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

trv: Doma seejiq o rmisoh smros bling rhngon, doma o mosa smeeksik.
english: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

trv: Mosa nami smksik kana knkingal mohing ptasan. mseopo nami ppdayaw, mtbhgay balay kdjiyax ka ptasan.
english: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

trv: Shiga, mnsa ko alang qmita baki.
english: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

trv: Bsiyaq bi ini nami tqita da, kmdamat ko bi hyaan.
english: We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

trv: Qmita knan ka baki o asi ko na pqdali sagas. pmahan ko na qsiya rnabaw.
english: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

trv: Ssibos bi hnoma na sagas ka baki, balay bi malo oqon.
english: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

trv: Mkoxol ko qsiya rnabaw baki ori. malo bi mahan ori.
english: I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

trv: Ska hidaw do, mseopo ko payi mhapoy kdeaxan.
english: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

trv: Mhapoy soyang bi kdeaxan ka payi, niqan qsorox, rodox, baon, pngosol ori.
english: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

trv: Babaw mnhdo nami kmjiyax do mosa nami qnpahan pajiq kmtoy pajiq.
english: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

trv: Mangal lala bi bonga, sari ni qosol ka payi sbgay na knan adas sapah.
english: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

trv: Mswayay ko dhyaan ni meiyah ko mita dhyaan pxal dori son mo.
english: I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

trv: Sayang o meadas mnan mosa rwaan mneodos ka mtgsa. Mniq nami rhngong embkog marig paya.
english: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

trv: Babaw mtmay nami rwaan mneodos do rmngaw ka mtgsa:" Brah o qqbhni, bokoy o qqoyo, lita nanak qmita."
english: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

trv: Mngongo ko qoyo kika ini ko osa qmita qyqoyo.
english: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

trv: Qmita ko lala bi qbhni, ga skkiya babaw qhoni ka dhiya. qmita ko porong ga mtaqi ska rangah qhoni ori.
english: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

trv: Rwaan mneodos o niqan kacing wiwil mohing, kacing mrata/ema ni rklit. Aji ko qmnita ka nnii mneodos. Qtaan sayang do balay bi qrason wah.
english: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

trv: Lala bi psingal mo ka sasing, Pqtai mo tama ni bobo.
english: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

trv: Pseopo ko tama ni bobo miyah pxal dori.
english: Next time I will come with my parents.

trv: Jiyax sngayang nii, mosa nami qmita swayi snaw tama mo ka qbsoran mo koyoh ni yako.
english: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

trv: Paah nami Taipei papa tdroy qrngol mosa Taitong.
english: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

trv: Dhoq Taitong do mgriq tdroy miyah smtrong pyaan tdroy mnan ka ririh tama.
english: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

trv: Aji thiyaq bi ka knthyaqan sapah ririh tama ni pyaan tdroy, mgriq cicih tdroy do dhoq da.
english: The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

trv: Dalih sapah ririh tama hiya o niqan 1 paro bi tbgan. Mseopo nami peapa tdroy gakat dhoq tbgan.
english: There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

trv: Mniq tbgan do madas mnan ka ririh tama tmabog mirit ni peapa ema.
english: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

trv: Keeman do mosa nami sbrigan paro alang mkan nhapoy.
english: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

trv: Ska paro alang o lala bi tdroy, kiya ni papa nami tdroy otobay/popok mosa hiya.
english: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

trv: Mtealax bi siida do, dowa hlayan ka tdroy otobay wada goyon da. Asi nami papa tdroy baho tealax.
english: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

trv: Miyah nami dhoq Taipei ka sayang da. Ini klai ririh tama gaga na hlayan ka tdroy otobay na dhog.
english: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

trv: Bilaq ko siida o mniq Bsoring ka sapah nami. Babaw matas do mosa thjil Teypaq da. Ida mniq meodos alang paro.
english: When we were young, our family lived in Bsuring. After I started school, we moved to Taipei and have been living in the city ever since.

trv: Babaw matas paro ptasan do smlohay ko 1 iyax toki qori ptasan knkla kndsan seejiq tnposo, mkkla ko lala kngklgan seejiq tnposo Taiwan knsyangan ka knkla kndsan.
english: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

trv: Kiya ni rbagan hngkawas sayang do mosa alang qmita smiling rodan ka qbsoran mo snaw ni yako. Kmklaon nami nanak ka knklgan seejiq knkla kndsan ta.
english: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

trv: Wada maspat kmxalan hngkwasan na ka rodan da, kiya ni mdka saw mgska knrodan seejiq qtaan.
english: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

trv: Smiling ko hyaan mnmano kari ka klaon na, mkla bi rmngaw kari Troko ka hiya. mkla kari Tayal, kari Ngayngay ni kari Nihong.
english: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Truku, as well as Atayal, Hakka and Japanese.

trv: Smnilng ko hyaan do hana ko mkla, kla sa paah laqi do smlohay kari Nihong da. Koyoh na o seejiq Tayal. Kiya ni qnpahan na o mgkla lala bi seejiq Ngangay, kika saw nii mkla rmngaw lala knlgan kari.
english: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

trv: Empprngaw nami ssida do lala bi rnngaw na qori knkla knxalan madok ka rodan.
english: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

trv: Ana nami ini qhdoi mkla embahang, kiya ni spowda nami nngalan nami sasaw qnawal baga, mtdowa tgloos embahang dori.
english: Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

trv: Bilaq ko siida ini ko kla knkla kndsan seejiq ta nanak, ita nanak ka saw seejiq tnposo o niqan cicih saw smsiqa kida.
english: When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

trv: Rinah lala klaon ta do, rina tgkla ita nanak ka seejiq Troko o maa kingal bi nanak ni balay bi tdhoon ori.
english: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Truku is unique and something to be proud of.

trv: Gbiyan sayang, meiyah sapah ka swayi mo snaw da.
english: My younger brother is going home this evening.

trv: Mosa marig rodox sbrigan ka payi ni yako, ppsramal mhapoy ooqon swayi mo snaw nhapoy gbiyan.
english: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

trv: Moda nami sbrigan damat, lala bi bgorah mgpajiq pajiq ka sbrigan damat.
english: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

trv: Marig nami wahir bonga, lnbay ni tbihi banah.
english: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

trv: Rmngaw ka tnposo sbrigan hiyi qhoni, "Ssibos bi ka kalat ni qlopas mo. brigi cicih wah!" msa.
english: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: "My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!"

trv: Mnarig nami kalat ni qlopas ka yami.
Moda nami sbrigan hiyi, rmngaw ka tnposo, embarig namo mano? Paro ni mtbnaw bi ka rodox sayang, kingal o 300 kbkoy pila.
english: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, "What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD."

trv: Soqi bi knkrayan da msa lmnglong ka payi. Slingan na ka tnposo ini tdowa mhnok cicih son na.
english: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

trv: Kiya ni rmngaw ka tnposo mhnok bi ka kida, ini tdowa mhnok da.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

trv: Rmngaw ka kiyig tnposo, iyah marig qsorox mo, paro ni mhnok bi ka qsorox mo.
english: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

trv: Tghici bi do marig nami rodox ni marig qsorox ori. Saan mhapoy sapah kingal tloan ka damat.
english: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

trv: Bsiyaq bi tnegaan, mkoong ka karat da.
english: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

trv: Miyah qnawal na ka swayi mo snaw rmngaw asi lo ini tdowa msangay ka qporing mrata da ni empxal jiyax sngayan do kika mtdowa miyah da msa.
english: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

trv: Rmngaw ka payi mnhapoy saw nii knlala, plwaani kana iyah sopo mkan wah!
english: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

trv: Mlawa nami lplopong dlotot, mseopo tblaiq mkan knsyangan oqan gbiyan.
english: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

trv: Niqan kingal tnhiyan mo matas hangan na o Yakaw, smhongi bi madas qaya kdjiyax.
english: I have a classmate named Yakaw, he often forgets to bring things.

trv: Matas bi siida, kmsiyok ppatas, ssros aji o ptason patas tnhiyan na.
english: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

trv: Empxal, mndha, mntro, pksiyok bi qaya hyaan kana.
english: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

trv: Kiya ni niqan kingal naqih lnhayan na. Kmsiyok qaya do ini bgay.
english: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

trv: Hici bi do ini pksiyok qaya hyaan kana da.
english: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

trv: Niqan kingal jiyax, mosa nami msopo mrrawa ngangot.
english: One day, we all went on an outing together.

trv: moda elog kmosa bi ngangot ka Yakaw, kiya ni smhongi madas lblak ssros.
english: On the way, Yakaw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

trv: mksiyok tnhiyan na lblak ssros, kiya ni smiyok hyaan kana ini ko adas yako ori msa smiyok rmngaw.
english: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

trv: Mtbiyax bi ka Yakaw ni lmingis da. Msaang rmngaw, hmoya ma namo ini pksiyok lblak ssros knan!
english: Yakaw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

trv: Smiyok hyaan ka tnhiyan na. Yasa ini so bi adas nanak ka iso, dori ni knsyokan so ka qaya o ini so bqaani!
english: The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

trv: Saw saman mosa ptasan, mgrbo bi dhoq ptasan ka Yakaw. Ngali na ka knsyokan na tnhiyan na ka qyqaya o bqaani na tnhiyan na kana.
english: The next day at school, Yakaw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

trv: Psrowa tnhiyan na ka Yakaw ni rmngaw, babaw na do ida ko bi meadas qaya mo nanak, mhoway namo balay brah na o smrowa namo pksiyok qaya hyaan ori.
english: Yakaw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

trv: Bilaq ko siida, mlatat keeman ka nirih mo tama ni tama, madas pocing ni poniq.
english: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

trv: Rmdax karat do madas nboan dha samat miyah da.
english: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

trv: Doma o bowyak, doma o rapit, msowil niqan glaqong ori.
english: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

trv: Mniq rhngong alang sgon na ka samat ni seasog dha sjiqon.
english: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

trv: Stnxay skribog ko tama mo kdjiyax, mkmosa ko sneegol tama madok.
english: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

trv: Rmngaw ka tama, paro so do dson ko na sopo madok da.
english: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

trv: Mkla dmoooy qlobong qmrak samat ori ka snaw alang, mkla smmalo waya qlobong ni dangar btonox.
english: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

trv: Mkla bi qmlobong gasil ka tama mo, rmngaw ka tama, nii o qrak glaqong kiya, tgloos ta bi qmita ka dapil papak endaan samat. Psaan ta elog ooda samat ka qlobong.
english: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

trv: Iiyox ko nhari mseopo rodan mosa madok, smlohay ko qmlobong kdjiyax. Ini bi biyaw balay bi mtdowa qmrak samat ka qlobong mo da.
english: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

trv: Babaw qmnita ko tama rmngaw knan hici o ida so mha maa malo bi emptsamat.
english: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

trv: Sayang paro ko da, mapa ko bhniq ni boji mo, mseopo ko tama mosa madok.
english: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

trv: Miyah alang do ngalon nami ka snbo nami samat sseasog nami seejiq ta.
english: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

trv: Rmngaw ka tama, qrasan ta bi ka otox rodan smblaiq mgay saw nii lala bi nngalan ta samat.
english: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

trv: Mqsoqi ko mosa ptasan ka mgrbo da.
english: I was late for school this morning.

trv: Mosa ptasan siida, smhongi ko madas aba patas.
english: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

trv: Matas siida, seopo ko tnhiyan mo matas qmita patas.
english: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

trv: Pspong matas siida, pksyokan kona ppatas ni ssros ka tnhiyan mo matas.
english: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

trv: Rngagan kona ka mtgsa, " babaw na do totoy nhari, iya pqsoqi da! "
english: The teacher told me, "Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!"

trv: Malo bi lopong mo o Watan, laqi Troko ka hiya ori.
english: My good friend's name is Watan, and he is also an Truku child.

trv: Seopo nami matas mniq alang Kdosan.
english: We study together in the Kdusan tribe.

trv: Seopo nami embahang rodan rmngaw endaan sbiyaw kdjiyax, mkla nami bi rmngaw kari Troko.
english: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Truku proficiently.

trv: Takar ni mtbnaw ko bi, llbo ni hlawax bi ka Watan.
english: I am tall and overweight, while Watan is short and thin.

trv: Mpplaq bi ka Watan, smkoxol bi hyaan kana.
english: Watan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

trv: Jiyax psslian tmalang ptasan ka sayang, moda lala bi psdka ka ptasan.
english: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

trv: Niqan brbil gasil, qorog btragan qaqay, tmalang, rmgrig ni pstalang boji.
english: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
I participated in the running competition.

trv: Pklog ko tmalang siida, mtakor ko da, sdara bi ka bqlit.
english: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

trv: Kiya ni mhiyog ko, ida ko mqori brah tmalang.
english: But I stood up and continued running forward.

trv: Dhoq ko nhdaan siida, mqaras bi kana ka seejiq.
english: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

trv: Ana ko ini angal tgbrah hangan, ida ko mqaras balay, yaasa mnhdo ko psdka da.
english: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

trv: Yako ni tama mo o mosa nami qmita nirih tama mo ka shiga.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

trv: Mloqih ka qaqay nirih tama da.
Rngagan nami na, emproq kingal bling ka dnamox sapah.
english: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

trv: Pklog smmalo dnamox ka hiya siida ga, mtocing pnaah dnamox da.
english: He fell off the roof while repairing it.

trv: Madas hiyi kacing ni sbiki ka tama sbgay na nirih tama.
english: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

trv: Empprngaw nami rowan sapah ka yako ni nirih tama, seasog kona rmngaw lala bi endaan na.
english: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

trv: Mmowsa ko siida, tmdaho knan ka nirih tama, wada ko maaparo ni mtradaw bi ori da.
english: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

trv: Rngagan mo, "Tgai saw malo ka qaqay so da o iyah tohoy sapah nami ori."
english: I said, "When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us."

trv: Hngkawas emposal kbkoy emposal dha siida, mnda emprngaw ka Klwaan tdowa powsa hangan kari ta nanak ka patas hnyigan Seejiq Tnposo.
english: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

trv: Smniling ko risaw alang Umin Peydang, hiya o bsiyaq balay gmspong patas hnyigan "powsa hangan kari ta nanak" mqori Klwaan.
english: I interviewed Umin Peydang, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

trv: Mnhdo nami empprngaw, jiyax sngayan nii mowsa sapah na smiling hyaan.
english: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

trv: Kska Sniling mo siida, pgkla knan pnyahan hangan na, dson kona pgkla kingal rowan sapah na ni alang na ori.
english: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

trv: Smiling ko hyaan, hmoya ma so saw ida gigit priyox hangan, oda powsa patas seoxal o naqih hog?
english: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?

trv: Rmngaw ka Umin Peydang, "Hangan pnatas kari Seejiq Tnposo o kika balay bi hangan ta. Hangan mo o pgkla klgan seejiq ta, pnswayan sapah ta, hnyigan ta, tai saw emphbaraw balay ka seejiq dhoq hmlay hangan dha nanak."
english: Umin Peydang said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

trv: Shiga o mosa sbrigan smbarig ka yako ni payi, madas lala bi pajiq nhoma na nanak ka payi, smmalo oqon Seejiq Tnposo ori biqan na ana ima.
english: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

trv: Smkoxol bi sbrigan payi ka kana seejiq, hbaraw bi seejiq marig osik ni srohing, hbaraw seejiq miyah mkan nhapoy hnpoyan na.
english: Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and Nest fern, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

trv: Rmala ni botol hnpoyan na o malo balay oqan, niqan modoh hiyi bowyak ori, knshiya na hmgot hbaraw lopong mniyah, miyah embkog sbrigan nami kana.
english: The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

trv: Mhapoy siida ka payi, kmeagoh ko lopong mniyah kiyig ka yako, mlawa ko kiyig hiya, "Hmaan mo nanak kana ka pajiq, ini rosi sapoh, iyah marig nhari!"
english: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, "The vegetables are self-grown, all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!"

trv: Aji biyaw qhdoon smbarig kana ka qngqaya nami da. "Noxay bi dnyagan so." msa ka payi.
english: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, "It's all thanks to your help."

trv: Eoda nii, wada ko smlohay pnegloban qori knkla pnhmaan ni oqon Seejiq Tnposo, dori ni knrbkan moda smbarig.
english: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

trv: Qmita ko payi smkoxol bi oqon nrodan, smparo ni mqaras bi lnglongan mo.
english: Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
